Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nalla_B_12
Reviews.Content: Hotel close to the railway station so convenient for connections but the area rather scruffy and has some unfortunate inhabitants. Check on google map for location as not the usual frontage for a hotel and could be difficult to find. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms very clean, of a good size with air conditioning and mini bar. Asked for a room overlooking the courtyard, as recommended but was given a room overlooking a scruffy back alley but was probably quieter than the ones facing the main road when they set up the morning market. Breakfast adequate but cereal and fruit would have been nice, can run short of items; then just ask. Quite a few small, local restaurants that don't take advantage of tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Family business”
Reviews.Author: geotool
Reviews.Content: I have been there with my wife and my daughter before 2 days (17-18 February 2012). It is a family business, something very important for me. The owners work as receptionists and this is great for the customers, as their service is the best. The brothers who own the hotel are very polite. Via Milazzo is a small road that begins from Termini station, exactly in front of Terracafe. So, if you come from the airport with a Terravision bus you are lucky as you will find easily via Milazzo. You have only to walk 2-3 minutes to go to the hotel. And of course is near the Termini metro station (4 minutes) where you can find a supermarket to buy water etc. The problem was that when I found the number 42 of via Milazzo, nothing minded me that there was a hotel there, as it forbidden to owners to put something like a neon sign outside the building. So you have to ring the bell. The building accommodates two hotels and many other companies, but you will find very easily the reception office of the hotel if you turn right and then left. The building is old and the rooms are large. It is not a super duper hotel, but it is clean (very clean) and actually you will not have any problem. If I want to find some negatives I will refer that the water was not very hot in the bathroom and at breakfast the croissants were not so fresh. I recommend it for those guys who don’t search for a luxury hotel but can do with something more simple. I understood that the receptionist was the owner by myself, as he was not had a typical behaviour, but he was really interested to serve me, something that only the owner can do. If I will go to Rome in the future, I will prefer it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: Mire L
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Family owned... carisssiiiimi !!! They help me with any questions I had, with sightseeing, trains, metro.... In the middle of a snow day after more than 20 years, they managed to help everyone!! It was my birthday and they were more than great!! a bottle of wine and chocolate as a gift was waiting for me in my room!!! GREAT GESTURE!!! I really felt that they care for people!! If I go to Roma again, I'll stayed there. It was recomended by a friend, and I will recomended to anyone I can... Thank you guys for all the great service...

Reviews.Title: “Great little 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_737
Reviews.Content: A family owned hotel (3 brothers). We dealt with Mossimo, who was friendly and helped with our questions regarding sightseeing and dining out. Booked our 3-night stay through Wotif but may have got a better deal by dealing direct with the hotel. Breakfast was good, bed was comfortable, central heating (can be cool in January), rooms very clean, with 'fridge and minibar. The location is convenient; close to Termini Station (access to both metro lines, also buses/trains to the airport). A short walk to San Lorenzo for cheap and cheerful restaurants (try Formula 1 Pizza). It would have been good to have tea and coffee making facilities; occasionally water in the shower was not quite hot enough. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel, clean, safe, marvelous!!”
Reviews.Author: cherrypanda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six nights in December 2011. I could accept pickup service to the airport for more than five nights. I felt sorry for me only, for all that, staff kindly offered pickup service. As I had to push the bell to enter the hotel and the floor, I could stay with security. Room is very clean, spacious, and quiet, with large bed, minibar and air conditioner. I could be in good shape. Attractive courtyard can be seen from the window. I felt as if I were in the medieval world. Bathroom is equally very clean and spacious. The room is cleaned up every day. I could stay comfortably. Breakfast of blood oranges, yogurt, cappuccino, espresso were delicious, especially bread and pastry were. Various Danish pastries and bread were served, it was fun to choose which to eat every morning. Access from the termini station is just across the Via Marsala, within a few minutes’ walk. The airport bus runs on the Via Marsala, and the bus stop is nearer than the station, on the extension of the street in front of this hotel. The airport bus is cheaper than the train, only six euros. Staff members are very friendly and kind. They can speak plain English. This hotel contributed to my Roman holiday, it can stand comparison with the four and five star hotels that I had ever stayed, on the contrary, this hotel is best. I was impressed with Roman historic sites and this hotel, and so, I want to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied all our needs!”
Reviews.Author: Roberta R
Reviews.Content: Eight of us spent two nights at this hotel (in 4 rooms) at the end of November. We all agreed that the small hotel was very satisfactory. It was very clean, and the owners and staff were very helpful. They allowed us to leave our luggage beyond check out time so that we could do more sightseeing before our scheduled train departure. The hotel was very affordable and included good continental breakfasts. Moreover, it had a great location -- about a 5-minute walk from Roma Termini so we didn't need to take any taxis from the train station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseSkavlebo
Reviews.Content: When we were dropped off a the train station late one night I must admit I was a little bit frightened by the area however my first impression was completely wrong. We walked to the hotel from the train station and found it easily. I loved the old building the hotel is in, it has a great old world charm. The elevator was so tiny it fit two of us and our luggage. So romantic! Our room was LARGE, and extremely clean. We had just flown in from Paris and our room there was so tiny so we were expecting the same in Rome but we were really pleasantly surprised! The bathroom was a great size as well the only thing missing was a bathtub, it only had a shower. It would have been nice to soak in a tub after hours and hours of walking during the day but that is so minor. The hotel was very quiet and I loved how our huge window had shutters we could open and close and it looked over a courtyard. The staff was extremely friendly and the breakfast was fantastic! It was a good start to everyday. The main thing for me when I travel is whether or not the hotel is clean, quiet and close to everything and this one was perfect. Next time I am in Rome I will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Two Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roadking7
Reviews.Content: We are two seniors and took our daughters for a Celebrity Cruise out of Rome, (Civitavecchia) and we stayed at the Domus Praetoria. It is a small botique hotel run by a single family, and I and my wife have stayed there before. The room was clean, the air conditioning and heat worked well, and the bed was quite comfortable. The small continental breakfast included in the morning was quite adequate. The family was especially helpful in planning out my itinerary for us to see the Trevi fountain, the Collosseum, and the Vatican museum all in one afternoon by using the metro. The wireless internet was free, and it worked well with skype to make very cheap calls back to the states including straightening out a problem with our airline reservations. They arranged an excellent driver to take us to the airport at 3am in the morning. He was on time, and his roomy mini van accommodated us quite well. The hotels location just two blocks from the train station, the Termini, enabled us to save $400.00 in cab fares by rolling our bags to the station to go to the port. I would recommend this hotel and these fine people without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: shane k
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, really nice staff, very accommodating, they let us have a late check out at no extra charge and looked after our luggage until that eve as we had a late flight. Free wifi was also available, excellent croissants and cappuccino for breakfast. Rooms were kept very clean, couldnt have asked for more, and they even had the weather sorted for us in mid Nov at 20 degrees !!!!

Reviews.Title: “What's the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: sluffer
Reviews.Content: I am a little baffled by the great reviews that this hotel gets. Sure it is close to the train station but it is not on a particularly nice street. Yes the service is good but you have to ring to get in the front door and there is no lobby for the hotel. The rooms are clean etc. but really quite ordinary and pedestrian. We stayed there last year and while it was okay, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb and very good and friendly english language service”
Reviews.Author: judith14
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Rome (about 5 times now) I stay in this hotel, managed by teo very friendly brothers! It is situated near the trainstation (via milazzo, at the ending of which the hotel is located at the left hand side) is across the street, this street is situated approximately where the terravision buses to the airport leave. Thus: a very central location for public transport, direct A line to st pietro and other highlights. Quiet hotel and friendly service :-)!

Reviews.Title: “A nice , clean well priced property with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: mjacobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. It is by the train station so very handy if you need ot get to the station early in the morning. They gave us the "family apartment". It was HUGE- it had like 4 or 5 rooms- it was clean. The furnishings are a bit outdated. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and t ended up being our favorite meal of our trip! Friendly Staff. Nothing bad to say. A good budget find.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and super helpful owners....”
Reviews.Author: scot_in_oz
Reviews.Content: This is an oasis of peacefulness, run by three brothers who seemed willing to do everything they could to assist their guests. The hotel is in a quiet street near the Termini station. The entrance is a little hard to find - there's no obvious hotel sign, just a name on a door buzzer, so don't give up when you are looking for the door! There's a tiled courtyard, and the reception is off to the right towards the rear of the building. One of the brothers is always at the front desk, and the brothers seem happy to answer any and all requests for assistance - they speak excellent English. When I arrived the router providing wi-fi on the second floor was broken: because i required it during my stay (I was there on a work trip), they immediately suggested moving me to a room on the third floor. Breakfast is in a small room behind reception. I've seen some comments here that's it's basic, but I was perfectly happy with what was provided: really good blood orange juice, water, tea, any kind of coffee you like made to order. there are plain bread rolls (with jam or nutella), yoghurts, and also some sweet pastries like almond croissants. I stayed here for 4 nights, went elsewhere for the weekend and then for one night the subsequent week. The brothers kindly allowed me to leave one suitcase at the hotel while I was away for the weekend; when I returned on the Monday, the bag had already been taken up to the room for me - very thoughtful. There's a small street market in the mornings outside the front of the hotel, which is nice, but be aware that this means stalls set up from about 6am, so there is a small amount of noise as a result. If you are in a room at the front on a lower floor, you might need to sleep with your window closed (there's air-conditioning, so having windows closed on a hot night isn't a problem). I was on the third floor, and the noise wasn't an issue. In terms of Roman neighbourhoods, the Termini area isn't the most scenic, but it is not as dingy or as unsafe as some guide-books will tell you. Watch out for pickpockets around the station, but otherwise it seemed fairly safe. It's really convenient to be close to the intersection of two Metro lines and to the station if you are travelling elsewhere in Rome. However, be aware that many interesting parts of Rome (eg Trastevere, Campo dei Fiori) are a pretty lengthy walk or a very awkward journey by bus from Termini - allow lots of time to get to and from your destination. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Domus Praetoria, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: nmh2010
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and friendly, the size of the room was very decent and clean. The room was quiet and came with a continental breakfast. The location of the hotel is great because it is near the Roma Termini. The price is also reasonable. I will definitely stay in this hotel again whenI go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good B&B”
Reviews.Author: Saurshan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and overall experience was quite good. Location: Hotel is located very near to Roma Termini station and thus you can access all important landmarks in rome through subway. Rooms: Rooms were of decent size, and were clean with air conditioning. The bathroom though is bit small and not really upto the mark Food: Breakfast doesnot have a great spread, apart from basic stuff. We were often eating outside the hotel because of lack of choice Service: The staff is generally courteous, and are willing to help with directions about how to reach a location in Rome and general trivia. Internet: There was no free WIFI access, and internet was available through a desktop at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, very nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Natalie P
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was large and clean with both air-conditioning and a large stand-up fan. The room was quiet and came with a continental breakfast. While the Termini neighborhood is not the nicest, we chose it for proximity to trains, buses, etc. There is a terrific little cafe across the street, and a vendor's market appeared each morning on the street outside the door of the building. Overall a very good choice and excellent value for the price - we'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of fraudulent reviews..pictures of this hotel are very deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Kdodez
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel at the end of our 2week European tour and it was by far the most disappointing. We used the recommendations of trip advisor for most of our planning and are very disappointed that this hotel had such high recommendations. After one night stay, (we had booked for 3), we were both sneezing and had itchy eyes. There is a predominant moldy smell in this hotel, so beware if you have allergies. The pillows and sheets are paper thin and our sheets had numerous, small round holes in them. The hotel staff showed us another room the following morning that had been recently updated but by this point we were not going to sacrifice our healthy by saving a hundred euros. We lost a nights rate but found a wonderful, bright and mold free hotel in a much safer and friendly area, away from the trAin station but still within walking distance of a metro stop. A valuable lesson learned, read both positive AND negative reviews. We have learned from experience that there are fraudulent reviews out there. This is an easy city to get around in, don't opt to stay near the train station for convenience. This is a busy, crowded city and the train station is not a pleasant area to be walking around in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsenal
Reviews.Content: Was a very pleasant stay at this hotel for my mum and I. Friendly staff and the good quality of the hotel. Location was close to the buses and train station, although would have been more convenient to stay on the other side of the train station. Although obviously for that you would need to pay a premium

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: LaraCA2011
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Seconds from the Stazione Termini so easy access to all buses and trains. There's actually a street fair every morning right in front of the hotel which was very convenient for us. I was unprepared to have my legs and shoulders covered for a visit to the Vatican and was able to get some capris at the street market. Even though our window faced the street, we could not hear a thing. Everything was impeccably clean and the room was very spacious. We could not have asked for a better entrance into Italy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: ikeekee
Reviews.Content: i was afraid to stay close to Termini but this hotel was wonderful. it was quaint and quiet as well as very clean. the staff was wonderful. Fabio was very helpful and friendly. i thought i would be giving up something by staying near the train station, but i wasn't! the location was helpful for leaving the next day to head home, and the neighborhood was quiet. great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of TA reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Akg6462
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here in June during a 2 week tour of Europe. We chose the hotel based on the good TA reviews. This hotel was dark, dingy, down a creepy side street and is nothing that is described in the reviews. Yes, the help was friendly, but staying in this hotel felt like we were staying in a dungeon. We stayed in the hotel the first night but after getting no sleep due to dogs barking and loud noises in the hallway we could not bare another night and decided to move another hotel. Staying at Hotel Domus would have ruined our time in Rome. My mother stated "I just can't stand thinking about having to come back to this place after a great day." Bottom line: don't trust everything you read on TA and don't stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: weejoakbor67
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights here for our stay in Rome, and found it exactly what we were looking for. We had a single country rail ticket and the fact that it was near the Termini (also ideal for access to the metro) Station was what first attracted our attention. However, we found that the hotel had so much more to offer: impeccably clean from top to bottom; spaceous rooms for a three star; excellent air conditioning (very useful during the heatwave we experienced with temperatures exceeding 35 degrees) and wonderfully helpful and pleasant staff. The breakfast was basic but above average quality for three star accommodation in Italy. At 100 euros per night it's a little pricey but worth the money for the peace of mind of knowing you have somewhere of quality to stay (Rome has many pitfalls when it comes to cheaper accommodation). My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and would definately use the hotel again if we go back to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel conveniently located near Termini station.”
Reviews.Author: kchill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first two nights of our trip to Italy, and returned 10 days later for one more night before our flight back home. The hardworking proprietors were gracious hosts. Our room was located at the front of the hotel overlooking the street, but was very quiet. The bathroom was spotless, and included a hairdryer and roomy shower. The elevator was very useful, as our room was on the 3rd floor. The hotel is just a few blocks from the train station, which was an easy walk. We were 2 women traveling together and did not feel unsafe. The first day we arrived about noon, prepared to just leave our bags until check in, but our room was ready and were able to check in right away, which was a welcome relief after an all night flight. There is no Internet access, but we were referred to an Internet site at a laundry just a block away, so that was fine; and once when I had to quickly check my email about travel arrangements, the proprietor offered to let me use the computer at the front desk. The street that the hotel is on was frequently closed off for a sreet market, which was only a problem when the taxi dropped us off or picked us up.... on the day we were to leave for the airport, the proprietor called the cab for us and walked us down to the end of the block with our bags to catch it, which was a very nice ending to a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on quiet street near Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: hushaphone
Reviews.Content: Small, quiet hotel on a street that's quiet despite being a very short walk from Termini train station. Like a lot of other hotels in Italy, I guess, it's a front desk and small breakfast area on the ground floor plus a few rooms in a hallway on one of the upper floors in an old, courtyard building. Huge bedroom w/ridiculously high ceilings; very clean. Rate we paid was 115 euros/night; felt like we were getting a great deal compared to reviews/costs of other hotels we thought about booking. Only drawback: Wi-Fi was too weak to reach our room (and that of one other set of guests we spoke with). To get a signal, we had to camp out in the hallway below the transmitter.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right for Rome”
Reviews.Author: LoladeTiburon
Reviews.Content: Our first night in Rome was easy and comfortable, thanks in large part to the Hotel staff and their convenient location. This is definitely the side of the Termini you want to be on! Safe, easy to navigate and with a few cafes and an enoteca for bites nearby. We had a good night's sleep in a comfortable room, welcoming staff to answer our "which way is the?" questions, and a great location for setting out on foot to explore Rome and shake off jetlag. We walked much further than we expected, beyond the Spanish Steps and back again, in just a few hours. There was a produce market set up Saturday morning right outside the hotel, which made things a bit loud in the morning but was a friendly sight when we stepped out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you want to be close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: markandsue-84
Reviews.Content: We only needed one night near the Termini as we had flown into Rome in the evening, took the Leonardo express to termini, and were travelling out by train the next morning. We arrived around 9.30pm and with clear instructions from the hotel walked around 5 minutes. There were bars and cafes with plenty of people around, and the area didn't feel unsafe at all. Providing you know that there is no large sign advertising the hotel, it is just a gold plaque on the wall, then you should have no problem finding it. I thought the price was reasonable for Rome, it is different to a regular hotel, more like rooms in an old apartment, but generally you are out most of the day. It was very clean. The desk is manned 24 hours by either Massimo or his brother. Massimo recommended a small restaurant around the corner for a very reasonable pizza - Grotto Azurra - grumpy guy, but cheap and good . The breakfast was basic, but good pastry's and Cappucino's. As far as spending more time in Rome to explore, this would not be my pick of location - but if being close to Termini is a priority, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: farvista
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked very well for our three nights in Rome. It is within easy walking distance (even with luggage) of the main train station and the subway system hub, was well maintained and clean, was affortable for Rome, and the staff was very helpful. The breakfast was basic, yogurt and rolls with good coffee. A few reviews complained about the neighborhood but we found it to be fine and never felt uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: ebduval
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a friend's recommendation on our very last night in Italy, but it certainly wasn't worth 130 Euros. During our two-week trip we stayed in much nicer places for half the cost. We found the front desk staff to be rather cold and irresponsive (no one at the desk, no one answered the phone, etc.), although they did try to help when our TV didn't work and our shower drain was clogged. The only good thing was the hotel's proximity to the Termini station, as we had an early flight home. I will say by this point in our trip, I was ready to go home and was starting to feel like an Ugly American, so perhaps if we had stayed here earlier in the trip I wouldn't have been so harsh on it. However, the bottom line is that we would not stay here again. Do your homework and find something cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Bearable but needs to lift its game”
Reviews.Author: russAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a reasonable location and the room was reasonably comfortable. For Rome it is probably considered a budget hotel and you certainly get what you pay for. The staff are reasonably friendly and helpful, but like the rest of the hotel, there is no real effort made for the guests. With little cost this could be a whole lot better. Those little touches that make a similar 'standard' hotel an excellent stay were not there. Poor breakfast, no sign of any fruit or cereal product. How hard can it be? Also, breakfast not ready at the advertised starting time. Only two coathangers in the room??????? Safe not working and not repaired. Bed arranged so there is nothing behind the head of it, just to fit a double bed in a single room I expect.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: fishertrick
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Hotel Domus Praetoria five years later and it was like coming home. The hotel has made some improvements since 2006 - expanded the number of rooms and also provides a great breakfast in the hotel rather than in a restaurant across the street. The family who owns this hotel continue to be extremely professional, helpful and all speak fluent English. We were at this hotel at the beginning of our Italian vacation and then again during the last night prior to departure. We can`t say enough about the quality of this hotel with respect to the size of the rooms, the cleanliness, the service and location. We would not consider staying elsewhere in Rome as long as this hotel exists.

Reviews.Title: “good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: i_flanders
Reviews.Content: nice hotel once you've found it, Not appealling from outside just a big door. Looks like an apartment buiding. Once inside things improve. The room was really big and comfortable, the breakfast was adequate. A good tourist hotel at the cheaper end of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well-located”
Reviews.Author: CiaoCiaoBella
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The service was outstanding - nothing was too much trouble, the hosts speak excellent English and are very accomodating. We stayed two nights at the beginning of our 3 week trip around Italy and two nights at the end. This was not our first trip to Rome but it was the first time we were not involved in an organised tour group so we did all the planning and bookings ourselves on line. We know from experience that European hotel rooms tend to be smaller and older than their counterparts in Asia. Location, price and previous review comments were the main determinants of our choice. Bamboozled by the choice of hotel locations in Rome, we eventually settled on staying near the Termini as this provided easiest access to Rome itself and other destinations on our trip. Whilst we did not spend a lot of time around Termini itself, it is easily reached on either bus or metro if you want to drop any shopping off rather than carry it around with you. TIP - buy the unlimited daily transport ticket for EUR4 rather than paying EUR1 for each trip. This hotel has an elevator and a good quality, typical Italian breakfast is served on the premises. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is safe”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler295
Reviews.Content: I had heard not to stay near the train station, but this location was great for us. Short walk from the train station which has the buses and the metro, too. We felt totally safe walking around in the late evening. There are lots of restaurants and other hotels and b&b's on the street and the surrounding streets. Our room was nice and quiet, very clean, and had a nice little balcony overlooking the courtyard. I especially loved the large shower. The elevator was good, too, although it only holds two people at at time and you do have a few stairs up to the lobby and elevator. Breakfast is in a room off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fine but worth the search! Great place”
Reviews.Author: blr5004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very short walk from the train station in Rome. This makes traveling elsewhere very convenient. I felt silly because I walked up and down the street a couple times before finally finding the hotel- there was only a small plaque outside and there was some street market going on; however, I met my dad there and he had no idea why I had trouble finding it, so maybe it was just me. The staff was very friendly and even though we arrived before check-in time, they allowed us to get some breakfast and leave our bags so we could start exploring. Our room felt enormous compared to every other room I had stayed at in Italy. It looked very fancy and even the bathroom was large and clean. The beds were comfortable and you could not hear street noise from our room. The breakfast the hotel provided was a good way to start the day. We always got there as soon as it opened so I am not sure how crowded it gets. The staff was very helpful in answering all our questions and providing good advice. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Secure small hotel with nice staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: jparkkonen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Termini station, and therefore has good travel connections. This is a very busy area and there seems to be a hotel in every corner, and some of them are not looking very secure. However, this has a very secure feel to it, and you do go through various locked doors before you get to your room. Staff are very helpful and speak quite good English as well. Our room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Nothing fancy or flashy, but what we wanted and expected. There is a small breakfast room, that can get quite busy in the morning, although we never had to wait for a table. There are loads of restaurants nearby, although they are quite standard, and if a key purpose of your visit to Rome is culinary exploits, then this location is probably not the best. That said, if your main purpose is to walk around from dawn till dusk soaking up 2000 years of history, you may (like us) be so knackered by 8/9 pm that any standard pasta or pizza will do. And even those are not bad at all in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Romantiq77
Reviews.Content: My only gripe are small limited breakfasts and weak wifi.. But I still think overall it was a great place

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant customer service, handy location”
Reviews.Author: auspejo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very happy with this hotel. We stayed in a double room on the third floor in Winter, and the room was warm, sizeable and comfortable. It is right down the street from the main metro station, which makes all of Rome's landmarks very accessable from this location. The location is no more dodgy than anywhere else in Rome, and my partner and I were never frightened walking back at night as many reviewers here seem to have been. The desk is staffed 24 hours a day by one of the three brothers who run the hotel. The three brothers also make coffee with breakfast in the morning, which is continental and includes a wide variety delicious pastries as well as yoghurt, bread and various spreads. One of the brothers even helped me to fax some documents back to Sydney free of charge, which was very helpful. In fact, I would say the three brothers were some of the most friendly people we met in Italy. The only problem was that the free wi fi didn't reach all the way up to our room, but we just used it in the mornign at breakfast or stood outside near the lift if we really needed it. This is a very generously priced hotel with friendly staff and I would recommend it to other couples travelling in Rome, particularly younger ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: jgunzy
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on its great reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. For the price, I expected there to be something wrong with it, but I couldn't fault it. It is a simple, no frills hotel, but the room was immaculately clean, the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and spoke perfect English. The breakfast was simple, with not much choice (yoghurt, bread and croissants, plus coffee), but it was good enough to give us energy to start the day and get us on our way. The location is good, 5 minutes from Roma Termini, and an easy walk to the Historic centre and the Colisseum. If I had to pick any faults, the elevator is not recommended if you're claustrophobic, and there was no reception for the free wifi in our room. Nothing that would put me off recommending the place. You can step out of the front door and find a market, a pharmacy, and a tabacconist to buy your train tickets. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: gzanuz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Domus Praetoria is only 3 blocks far from the Termini Station, which is obviously a very convenient location for train travelers (and also to go to other places in the city, by subway and bus). However, the street where it's located is always blocked during the day, as there's a street fair in it everyday. So, if you arrive by car (like we did), it's quite complicated to get near it to leave baggage, you'll probably need to park in a near street to do so (which is always a pain in Rome). It's a boutique hotel, with an usual and confusing entrance, but very clean and comfortable rooms and attentive staff. Our room was spacy, a little noisy (from the street) but we didn't have any trouble getting asleep. Bed was really comfortable. Breakfast is good, not great. There's free wifi available in the rooms, but one of the three days we stayed there it was non-functional. Bottom line: the Domus Praetoria is a good hotel, quite unexpensive, considering that all hotels in Rome are expensive, but its location is better for who gets there by train.

Reviews.Title: “good value greate hospitality”
Reviews.Author: asafr_11
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very friendly and very hospitality. although is a 2 star hotel the rooms are not small and equipped with all the right things for guests. don't count of the breakfast (very basic) although the location is near temini (not so pleasent neighborhood) the hotel is far enough from the termini station in a way that you don't feel very much the neighborhood but in the other hand so close to trains and buses which make life easier. the hospitality and the service is absolutly greate , more then you expected.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: 45-nomad
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly, rooms are good size with clean modern bathrooms. The hotel is located at the end of a street about 5 minutes from Termini train station. The location is convenient to metro and trains, and if you prefer walking, is doable in about 20-30 minutes to coloseum, Spanish Steps, etc. I stayed at this hotel when it first opened around 2003-4 and was glad that the quality had remained. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: MitRussia
Reviews.Content: This hotel occupies part of the appartment building and has no sign at all (just one of the ring buttons says 'domus praetoria') so it was not so easy to find at the first time. Location is great, few minutes walking from Termini station, not far from the city center and major attractions. Right on the street in front of the hotel there is a small street market selling various junk and also fresh fruits including strawberries which was appreciated:) In fact this hotel consists of several big appartments transformed into hotel rooms. The room was spacious and perfectly clean, seems like recently renovated. Hotel staff was very efficient with regards to small help like booking tickets or arranging a taxi. They also offer free breakfast but don't expect much. But at least the coffee is good. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_789
Reviews.Content: - very good location - clean - decent breakfast - very good value for money, more than you can expect from **

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Europe”
Reviews.Author: martinhaa
Reviews.Content: Super nice small hotel. Guests hoteliers (3 brothers) speak good english. Clean, good rooms, good location - and the neighborhood is not as bad as described by others. Thin duvet - and only minimal breakfast - but it's Italian tradition. The hotel was an oasis in a chaotic city. Internet Wi Fi worked after it had been reset a few times at the reception. We miss the Hotel and the weather already - but actually we do not miss Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply.... The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert A
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Domus Praetoria is extremly clean and the rooms are very large & comfortable with free wi-fi & breakfast as well. The hotel in a great location, very close to the Termini and the three brothers (owners), Massimo, Antonio and Fabio speak english very well. We are so happy we found this gem! No need to look further... Enjoy Rome! -Robert and Melanie Raleigh, NC, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KCL1114
Reviews.Content: When my friend and I checked in at the hotel, Massimo mentioned that the room had one large bed but that if we preferred to have the bed split, they would do it for us. It was a thoughtful gesture, so we accepted. The next day, he apologized stating that they actually can't split the bed in our room, so instead, he would give us an extra room free of charge! They went beyond what I expected to make our stay comfortable. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast that was included was nice. The only thing for me was that the location was a bit far from some of that areas we wanted to stay out late in, so getting back was not as convenient. It's very close to the Metro, but the Metro stops at midnight-1AM. But we figured out the bus schedule and it wasn't too bad... If you don't plan to stay out late, the Metro is very convenient. I would stay here again the next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FlanoJJ
Reviews.Content: The Rooms at this place was like staying in an apartment, very large. Really large bathroom. Very clean. Good walking location to lots of attractions. Only problem we had is that I use a wheelchair and they didn't mention the 3 steps you need to climb to get to the elevator which is tiny. But we made it work and for most travels a great place to stay that is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: SkyeSJ
Reviews.Content: This small, budget hotel is family-run, and the service is absolutely excellent for anything in this category. I was also quite surprised at the quality of the rooms (large bathrooms, newly remodeled floors and cabinets). The neighborhood isn't exciting, and I wouldn't stay here for any long time. But it's near the train station, which is very convenient if you're transiting (we had an early morning flight, so spent the previous night here, after taking the train to Rome). All in all, considering the overall costs of Rome, it was a good value. The service was the stand-out, though.

Reviews.Title: “fair from A to Z”
Reviews.Author: alienBBA
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff - very friendly, because the hotel is family-owned. Good location, near to the main train station, supermarkets and bistros in a 5 minute radius. Very clean, decent breakfast, free WLAN in the rooms. Within 2 metro station away from the most atractions (Colosseum, Spagna, Trevi Fountain) or 20-25 minutes walking distance. Very good price-value ratio! Great choice for a medium budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, janky hood”
Reviews.Author: sigbraun
Reviews.Content: You can't complain about the service here, but the street market outside our window was a real bummer. Very loud in the morning. The room was nice, but small. Rome is just expensive, period. Of all our hotels in Italy, this was the smallest room in the worst area for the most money. It's not far from the train station which is nice, but the walk there is kind of dirty. For Rome the price was ok, but next time we'll be looking for another neighborhood that is a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel near Termini Train Station”
Reviews.Author: MikeChippewa
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the Domus Praetoria was very good overall. This property, while a basic hotel, was very clean, well kept, and conveniently located near the Termini Train Station. The location is great for travel throughout Rome, as you can easily take the subway or bus with a couple block walk to the Termini. The owners are extremely helpful. This is a family run hotel with at least one of 3 brothers always at the front desk. They spoke very good English, and were very helpful with directions or recommendations for restaurants or activities. They were always ready to help and make sure you were comfortable. My wife, adult daughter and I stayed in one of their triple rooms. This worked very well for us , as the room turned out to be spacious by what I would call European standards. A simple Italian breakfast of rolls, croissants, and coffee was also offered in the morning, which made a good simple start to the day. If you are looking for a five star hotel with that level of amenities, this is not your place. If you are looking for a good, clean, quiet, centrally located hotel with great service, this is your spot. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Rome. This hotel is located in the Termini Train Station area, which is a great central location for getting around Rome. On the critical side, The Termini area is very typical of most European large city train station areas, you will see a few panhandlers and other less fortunate people in the area, and there will be a fair amount of commercial traffic and activity. On the positive side, there are also a lot of hotels and restaurants in the area, and it is a great location for getting around. That said we felt safe in this area and had no problem walking around even at night coming home from dinner, just be aware of your surroundings. As a tip if you go to Rome, use the ROMA Pass, as it is a great way to get into museums without the wait, and it includes a 3 day transportation pass to help you get around. Well worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Domus-weekend break”
Reviews.Author: mossalop
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel Domus for 3 nights on a weekend break in October. Really enjoyed our stay, The hotel is very central so you can walk to most of the sites (not the vatican) or hop on the metro at Termini station which is a 2minute walk from the hotel. The brothers who run it are very helpful and will answer any questions about getting around Rome or recommending places to eat. Didnt spend much time in the room as Rome has so much to see and do. But it was the perfect spot to base ourselves. For the price we payed the hotel was good value (by Rome standards) and i would recommend it to anyone who was planning to visit Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations, A Great Budget Option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: OhioArtsygirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Domus Praetoria for 3 nights at the beginning of October and truly enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very friendly and we were very happy with our surprisingly spacious room. Made for a perfect budget option and home base to explore the sights of Rome. Pros: - Very roomy, clean double (full-size+ bed) room with small balcony overlooking residential courtyard area (We stayed in room #209) - Had a tiny elevator, which made it helpful to transfer luggage to & from our room, porter showed us to our room and demonstrated the energy-saver key (that controls the lights in the room). - Bathroom was very clean & spacious, quite pleased with stand-up shower & bidet as a bonus. As with a lot of budget options in Europe, do bring toiletries & washcloth, should you require them, and also a hanging toiletry organizer, as shelf-space is at a minimum. We re-stocked at a wonderful Pharmacy down the street for soaps and shaving cream. - 2 or so blocks from main Termini Station, excellent if you need to catch the Metro to sights in Rome or EuroStar/Trenatalia trains onward throughout Italy. We are so glad that we chose the location of the Domus because of the ease of catching transportation from here. - Breakfast was included in our rate: Included yogurt, pastries/bread and jam, espresso/cappuccino, and juice. May want to consider a supplement breakfast snack or ceral from a nearby grocery store. - Room was peaceful and quiet, away from the hustle and bustle in Rome - We felt very safe in this neighborhood, had the impression that this a tourist hot-spot. Do consider bringing a hybrid backpack/rolling suitcase due to the uneven, cobblestone terrain. I was fine with my carry-on rolling suitcase, but saw some struggle with larger cases on the narrow streets. - Wireless Internet in the room: perfect for surfing on our netbook. - As others have mentioned, a very quaint street market during the week on the street near the hotel. I honestly cannot think of any negatives to list for this hotel. It exceeded our expectations, and was a very affordable option compared to other hotels in Rome. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: monsoon1inGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We have recently enjoyed a great few days in Rome and stayed in this hotel. We travelled from the airport by bus and arrived at Termini and round the corner was our hotel. Our room was huge and everything was very clean. The staff were also very helpful as where to eat as we arrived later in the evening....they got it right! We have no complaints whatsoever.......in fact we would recommend this hotel to anyone who is wanting to send a few days in Rome. The location is ideal as you are so central for all methods of transport. The weather was good too......which helps!

Reviews.Title: “great location' good value”
Reviews.Author: steviewonder34
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family room. 3 mature ladies. This must be the best value hotel in the area if not all Rome. Reception staff very helpful, large clean room. Couldn't really find fault at this price, 465 Euros for a 3 night stay in a family room. Breakfast good but basic, just what you would expect in Italy (they don't really do breakfasts anywhere). If you have loads of dosh, go to a 5 star, if you are a working person and love great value stay here. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and friendly hotel, perfect base for Rome on the hoof.”
Reviews.Author: Ted_Magee
Reviews.Content: Just back home after spending the last 5 nights in the Hotel Domus. Bus from the airport dropped us off at Termini, happened to be at the end of the street the hotel was on, nice one. Used the hotel as a base for the walking marathon that is Rome. 3 brothers run it and they are on the desk 24/7. Really helpful and great WiFi, and a funky wee lift if you can't manage those last few steps, there was also great coffee but we didn't manage too many mornings. This hotel is my top tip, it made the holiday so easy. The room was very big and had a great bathroom, all you could need. The view wasn't great, it wasn't even good but it was very reasonable so we got way more than we paid for. The TV wasn't much use but who needs TV in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, a real travellers find...”
Reviews.Author: AR_London
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Domus Praetoria for 4 nights in early October and would happily return there. The hotel is near Termini, Rome's central station and about 5-7 minutes walk from there. It does look like a bit of a dodgy area but we felt safe and never had the slightest of problems. The hotel itself was fine and the reception staff were a real credit. They were knowledgable and helpful throughout (including a 'left luggage' option on the last day). The room (a twin) was large and well laid out and it and the bathroom were clean and functional. On this I'd commend the hotel in particular, although it was 'no frills' it wasn't a complete dump and you could spend a few hours there without getting cabin fever! The breakfast was basic and 'functional' rather than delicious but there are plenty of near-by alternatives if you like. Getting around Termini is on the tram, metro and bus routes so you can get wherever quite easily. We even walked back from 'central' (i.e. touristy) Rome a few times and it took a bit over a half hour. One complaint would be the noise that we had at around 8.30am each day from nearly builders doing work to adjacent buildings. I assume that this is temporary, other than that we slept well and really liked Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: NYHonduran
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Domus Praetoria during the first week of October and found it to be perfect for our needs. We enjoyed a large and very comfortable room with fast and free wireless. After a charming breakfast (great cappuccinos!), we would venture out into the city. The brothers who run the hotel speak perfect English and were really helpful and attentive. The location is convenient to get to from the airport, though it takes about 20-30 min to get from the hotel to the historic center of Rome using the metro. Still, given its great value and staff, we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of the real Rome”
Reviews.Author: PeggyS148
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel since some of the reviews were great and others were not. I was delighted to see it for myself. First of all the location -- right in the heart of Rome and within an easy walk to the Termini. Also an easy walk to the Hop on Hop off bus station which takes you all over Rome. The hotel is in an apartment building, but don't let that put you off -- many family owned hotels in Rome are similarly situated. This hotel is owned by three brothers. The rooms are nicer than I anticipated and extremely clean. Breakfast is provided and is the typical European continental breakfast. There is a street market right outside the hotel which is fun to browse through. If you want the typical American three-star experience, this is not for you. But if you want to get the flavor of living in Rome and run shoulders with the residents of the city, you will love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Little, clean, enough ...”
Reviews.Author: drhako
Reviews.Content: The hotel 2-3 minutes to Termini station. Area is a little poor. The Staff were the best - very helpful and always going out of their way to help us. The rooms were also very well done - spacious and clean. They also had enough breakfast there in the morning with delicious cafe. Just a really lovely hotel and great value for money especially for your first Rome holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Picked It”
Reviews.Author: moretosee043
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 7 nights (spread over two visits) and were really pleased. Three brothers run it (we mostly dealt with two of them) Very accomodating and pleasant. Rooms were spacious and clean and had all the appropriate amenities. We were in the back, which was a bit dark, but who cares at night? Front rooms might be a little noisier with a market out in front each morning- we found it charming, and handy to pick up fruit for snacks later on. We were a bit nervous when we booked because of its proximity to the railway station (a 7 minute walk) but being close to the station worked well since we had ready access to the metro too. All in all, with continental breakfast included, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff, great walking location to train station”
Reviews.Author: ilovetheCotswolds
Reviews.Content: The brothers that own hotel were very gracious, and helpful with directions, bus routes, etc. Short walk from train station...felt totally safe. From outside you have to look hard to see sign. There are 3 hotels in the building! Our room was plain, but spacious & had everthing we needed to be comfortable. Would definnitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best of its type”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Inspector
Reviews.Content: This is one of very many hotels using the apartment buildings in the area east of Termini station - they buy up an apartment and subdivide it into rooms, and each of the hotels can have several of these apartments in a building, sometimes on different floors. Domus Praetoria has managed it very well, with recently-converted rooms of a high standard: solid internal walls and new double-glazed external windows keep almost all the noise out. My room was small, which was OK for a single traveller - others were bigger. WiFi is free and very reliable, and each room has a fridge and a/c. Bathroom was good and some thought had gone into the decoration of the room - the fittings were of a high quality. The owners (three brothers?) seem to rotate on Reception duty, and are very welcoming and helpful (with excellent English). Breakfast (included) is modest but adequate. There are plenty of reasonably-priced restaurants in the area, and a small alimentari across the street for essential supplies (corkscrew supplied in the room!). However you need to go further afield to find a DeSPAR or Carrefour mini-market for really cheap water and wine - I did not find one nearby. The street market outside during the mornings is good for fruit and cheap clothing. It's important to know when first arriving that there are no signs outside the building, just a discreet label on one of the doorbells for the big double doors (press the bell and the lock is released without any chit-chat). Inside, Reception is out of sight, to the right and then left before the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: CatAtkinson81
Reviews.Content: We found it quite difficult to find a good hotel in Rome at a reasonable price, especially after reading on here that not all receptions are 24hr and that sometimes you need to ring the hotel to arrange to be met and let in. We didn't fancy this as we were due to arrive late at night! However, this hotel is manned 24hrs a day by very helpful staff who all spoke really good english. We had an additional problem in that our flight was cancelled and we needed to travel to the other end of england to catch another flight the following day. I was really worried that our room would get given to another person as we wouldnt be arriving at the expected time. We rang the hotel to inform them we would be arriving the following day and they told us we would not be charged for the night we missed, which was great. We had another mishap- my boyfriend left his Ipod on the plane in Rome airport and only realised when we got to the hotel. As our Italian skills are non-existant we didn't fancy our chances ringing the airport to enquire if it was at lost property. Fortunately one of the hotel staff found the right telephone number and rang them twice to enquire. It was never found but the hotel were really helpful! THe room was nice enough for our needs, good size and the windows (when closed) were really soundproof. Breakfast was basic but did the job. It is very close to Termini station and I did not think the area was too seedy, as I was warned about this. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel after we checked out and they put our passports in a safe drawer so we didn't have to lug them around Rome on our final day. There is also a free safety deposit box in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Location and Hotel. Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Wasif77
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked to stay at this hotel for 4 nights. When we arrived at the hotel we saw that the place is run down, the rooms are small, basic and the view from the room was of a run down court yard. I checked out the next day and moved to another hotel . Unless you are a single backpacker, want just a room to sleep and have to catch the next day train from the nearby Termini station then please dont stay here and find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Rome, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2L2gether4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon and couldn't have asked for a better value. The hotel is located close to Termini and although a fair walk from many of Rome's many attractions, it was enjoyable and scenic. The room was by far the largest we stayed in all of Italy, which was a nice surprise. Good service and felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Good Value Hotel by Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: lsychen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights, as we needed to travel via Termini station the next day. The location is right by Termini, about a 5 to 7 minute walk from there. When you buzz into the building, it looks like there are a bunch of other hotels in the building. Turn right (I think it's labelled as side "B") and you'll meet reception of the hotel. The rooms were very clean, and the bathroom was very clean as well. There was a fridge for free use as well as a lock safe with key. The hotel manager was very nice, and on our return for the 2nd night, we got a free upgrade to a larger room. There are early morning markets where set up begins around 6:30 in the morning, so sometimes, we could hear this. It is a hotel where it's good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “My Third Visit 2007, 2009, 2010 ... need I say more”
Reviews.Author: YasmineinSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Domus Praetoria 5-6 June 2010 and 1-2 Sept 2010. This is my third visit to Rome and again I booked Domus Praetoria. I like that this B&B is family owned and the 3 brothers are all professional hoteliers ... they really have a passion for the B&B and making their guests welcome and comfortable and I want to support that ethic by putting my money in their business when I visit Rome. I love that I can arrive at Rome Termini station at 10pm and it is only a 5 min walk down the street to check in. There are loads of cafes, bars and restaurants around to get something to eat. I love that I feel safe and secure in the building. Although this is rated 2 star on TripAdvisor it could certainly give 3 star (and some 4 star) hotels a run for their money in cleanliness and in service to the guests. I know one of the brothers does or did work at the 5 star St Regis Rome, and I can see in the way they operate that although they are a B&B they are striving to be like the "Big Boys" in their service attitude ... and good luck to them! I have no hesitation to recommend this to my Mum, sister or best friend!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & easy but a bit small.”
Reviews.Author: SweetPNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. The hotel was clean, the front desk staff was very nice and helpful and the price was right for what it offered. The cons are that the rooms are a bit small for two people, the breakfast is mostly sugar and caffeine, the hotel is located at the end of the block which is a long walk from the train with heavy luggage and the street below can be a bit loud.

Reviews.Title: “This was a very fine choice”
Reviews.Author: roet
Reviews.Content: If you do not know where the reception is located, it is a little confusing to find it, but that is the only negative thing. People at the reception (three brothers)were very kind,helpful and correct. Beds were very good! Hotel is good located for touristic sightseeing and for going to the university. I'm sure to come back one time.

Reviews.Title: “if you want to stay near Termini station, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: jakeandali
Reviews.Content: This hotel is private, secluded, but near Termini station ... so very convenient. The rooms were newly rennovated, very clean, and very big. The front desk staff was extremely helpful, he even walked us all the way up to the room to point out instructions about the hotel. We enjoyed the 2min walk to the main train station ... and from there, access to all of ROME!

Reviews.Title: “a great, inexpensive base for seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: oojaded26
Reviews.Content: We spent the final leg of our honeymoon in Rome. The hotel is not far from the metro and the people who work there are very nice. Nice size room and best ac ever- and we've stayed in top of the line hotels in europe. Quiet and a small breakfast in the morning where I had the best cappicino. Would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Very poetic, quiet and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Sorinna
Reviews.Content: It was the best experience ... Italy could not have presented itself better through this hotel. Very quiet, amazingly clean and romantic..would go back there tomorrow given the opportunity

Reviews.Title: “fantastic base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: toffee290
Reviews.Content: What a great find. Excellent location.....near the Termini and the terravision bus to/from ciampino airport. Good local restaurants and coffee shops. The brothers running the hotel are very helpful and the rooms were far better than anticipated. All in all a great, if slightly unusual hotel, but all the better for it!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CVJim
Reviews.Content: My daughter, niece and I stayed here for 5 nights towards the end of June. It is 2 1/2 blocks from the train station which is great because you can catch the trains, buses and subway right there. When we first arrived, we thought the area was a little dirty and seedy but it turns out, most of Rome looks like this - not a very clean city. We felt perfectly safe walking around the neighboring streets, looking at different buildings and finding good places to eat (all the places around were delicious). The staff was very friendly and always willing to help with a smile. The breakfast was very simple, bread and yogurt, juice and coffee. However, each morning but Sundays, there is a little market that sets up on the street that sells fresh fruit and vegetables, clothing etc... so I just went out and picked up some plums, peaches etc... and the 3 of had snacks for the day for 5 euro. The room was a little small for a triple (150 Euro/night) compared to what we had in other cities but we were there to see Rome, not the room. It held the 3 of and our suitcases and that's all we needed. The girls seemed to think the water in the shower was a little "gritty" but I didn't notice any difference. Again, the location is perfect because we took the subway to the Vatican, The Spanish Steps and the Coloseum. 5 minute walk, 5 minute ride and you are there. Subways were definitely crowded heading towards to major sites unless you get an early start (8 am)... If you are there to do the tourist thing, this is a good place to stay... it's not fancy, frilly or romantic... It's a good, basic hotel with clean, comfortable rooms with a great locaton to get around. On a side note, if you are doing the tourist trip, I'd highly recommend the Segway Tour of old Rome. 3 hours of cruising around old Rome seeing the ancient sites without having to walk everywhere in the heat (It was about 86 degrees in Rome at the end of June). You don't get to go in an visit inside the sites, you see them from the outside but it gave us a good perspective on the layout so when we did go visit the Coloseum, Forum etc... we knew where we were. Well worth it and the guides were great. www.italysegwaytours.com Also, if you are doing a tour of the Vatican, we hired 7hillstours to give us a private tour. Andrea gave us three hours of detailed information that you just won't know if you go in on your own. It was $160 Euro for the 3 of us but they do have group tours that are cheaper and this tour is at 2:30 in the afternoon so the crowds have thinned out and you don't have to wait in lines. We also did an underground tour of the Necropolis under the Vatican and you see St. Peter's Tomb - incredible. You have to book that directly through the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: jhansel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here one night before an early morning flight out of Rome. It was our first time in Rome and we were unsure of what to expect. In general, we did not like Rome for what we saw of it. We found it dirty and crowded, but were only staying one night. The Hotel Domus was very close to the train station which was convenient and the room was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and the hotel was pretty quiet. I wasn't totally comfortable walking around in Rome in general and this area was no exception, but that's usually what you find in such a large city. If you have to go to Rome and are looking for a comfortable, clean place near the train station, then this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: 404kaye
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome one night before catching flight back to US. We chose this hotel since it was near the Termini Station and we were taking the express train to the airport the next morning. It was clean, comfortable, and within walking distance of station with luggage. There was a very nice bathroom with shower & hairdryer, air conditioning, tv, safe and a mini refrigerator. The beds & pillows were very comfortable. It is very secure, having to ring to get into building, then they unlock door to your floor for entry ( this is a more diverse neighborhood, but never felt unsafe, just more of a 'neighborhood' feel). A small lift also helpful. This is a family run small hotel and they could not have been nicer. Helped direct us to a wonderful Cucina/Wine Bar for dinner (Meid in Nepols), just a few blocks away. This hotel is one I would recommend highly. Continental breakfast included and was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: travellers067
Reviews.Content: Faced with finding accommodation in a city with as many hotels as Rome we were, as usual, guided by the Trip Advisor reviews we have always found to be a good guide.. The Domus was in a convenient location just a couple of blocks from the station and near to the long distance bus terminal. The room was quiet and spacious. Excellent service from the brothers who run this establishment. Breakfast was good, including coffee made to order. We would definitely stay at the Domus again.

Reviews.Title: “Large spacious rooms with a very caring and knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: easier_writer
Reviews.Content: This was certainly the best hotel that we have stayed at during our trip. We were traveling on a semi-tight budget and decided to stay at Domus Praetoria based on reviews from trip advisor. We had our flight to Rome on the day that we checked in, and calculated that we would arrive there at around midnight, so we sent an email saying that we would be coming a little late, which was almost immediately answered. Unfortunately, getting out of Fiumicino airport without getting ripped-off was challenging and we only arrived at the street of our hotel at quarter past one. There Massimo, one of the hotel staff, was waiting for us outside of the hotel. He seemed like a nice and hardworking person. The staff was one of the best parts of our stay. For example, Massimo was there the next day in the morning making coffee for us. The other staff members were also great. They always knew which buses to take and the closing times for different places. They also helped us find the trains that we needed. The lift was a little small, but the rooms were wonderful. They were very spacious and bigger than any of the rooms that we had stayed at in Europe. The bed was average sized, but very comfortable, and there also was a reclining chair that could also serve as a bed.There also was a refrigerator in the room. The bathroom was large with a shower, sink, toilet, and bidet. Free breakfast and WiFi were also very useful. For us, Domus Praetoriia was a gem of a hotel for the price which wasn't too high, and the quality that we got for it. When we return to Rome again, we will definitely go to Domus Praetoria.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, great value stay!”
Reviews.Author: doughawka
Reviews.Content: Ended up staying for 6 nights (was supposed to be 3) due to the volcano ash. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff - they were very accommodating in finding us a last minute room for the same price as the rest of our stay. Will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneJoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus for 5 nights over Easter and can't recommend it highly enough. Our room overlooking the street was the largest we stayed in during our visit to Europe and was spotlessly clean and modern. The staff were friendly and helpful, and nothing was too much trouble for them. Breakfast was basic, but standard fare for Italian hotels. Don't be put off by the plain entrance - inside is a delight, with the added bonus of a street market outside every morning. It is only 5 minutes walk to Termini Station, with plenty of places to eat at the top of the street. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Domus.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: bugbit
Reviews.Content: very good hotel. Right next to the train station Terminii. Close to subway. Close to McDonalds. Antique elevator, small but in good working condition., Rooms were small but clean. There was a small market grocery store in the Terminii station. Staff were nice and friendly. The luggage was carried to our room while we checked in. Hotel was secure and safe however the location was not after sunset. Linen was changed daily. Soap, shampoo provided. Shower head was dysfunctional but upon told the problem was fixed quickly. However, started to leak again. Wet bar/refrigerator was stocked with beer, fanta, water. Clean tiled floor in room and bathroom. No balcony and no views. Airconditioning was comfortable. Key card for room. Breakfast was complementory of bread, pastry and tea or coffee. Entry to hotel was not conspicuous but directions on internet sufficed. Accurate information about Rome and sightseeing tours wasprovided at the reception. Reception called for Taxi at 3:30 AM in the morning right at the door for airport pick up. No tipping was expected. Staff was extremely courtous and pleasent. There was a market on the hotel street open in the morning but windows were soundproof. No restaurant or bar in hotel, but plenty of restaurants close by. No swimming pool, gym, spa, health club. TV was small so could not properly watch FIFA soccer. However, TV was in good working condition and plenty of channels were available including BBC world news.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel ,good location close to Termini and walk to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Elaine1944
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights very helpful staff street markets outside there is a bit of noise early morning. Enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “what a great find in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy797
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the front door, this is a charming, lovely and welcoming hotel, well-located in Rome, near the station yet off the beaten track. We all loved it here. There's a great marketplace out in front nearly every morning. The brothers who run the place are helpful and kind, and there are quite a few nice and reasonable osterias in the neighborhood. From here you can easily walk to the station and take a bus anywhere you like-- it's also close to one of the better National Museums. Our room was spacious and light-filled, breakfasts were delicious and even when we were running late our hosts were kind and made fresh cappucino. Make sure you keep those yummy rolls in stock! Bravo. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: dear_nikolas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Domus hotel for 1 night. We were greeted with a friendly staff. The room we stayed in is super spacious (maybe because we were given the corner room) with high ceiling. The room and bath room was clean. The breakfast was decent. The only problem is that locating the hotel. There was minimum hotel sign and in front of the hotel there is a market that almost block the entrance. But overall, I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Dango_2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Praetoria for 3 nights. The Hotel is located about 3 minutes walk from Rome's central train station (Termini), where you also find the subway & the bus station. If you've never been to Rome, this means that you are about 3 minutes walk + 15 min underground (including walking, tickets & riding the tube) from all the major attractions in Rome - this saves you a lot of time and money (taxis are expensive). The Hotel itself is a two star Hotel, so if you expect luxury - go somewhere else, this is not the idea. If you want to sleep well in a small Hotel, and in a relatively large room, eat continental breakfast and go out to see Rome - this is the place for you. The Hotel is Family owned and they are really very nice people, very helpful and answer any question, give advice and in general give you a very pleasant feeling. Rooms are cleaned once a day, and you get clean towels, soap, shampoo etc. each time. Towels are not 5 star thick and soft, but are really OK. We had two problems - Our flight got canceled AND the Laptop stopped working. The Hotel manager offered us to use his desktop in order to search Google for a solution to the laptop problems, and to find alternative flights. The feeling you get is that they REALLY want to help you because they are nice people. So if you're in Rome and don't want to spend all of your budget on accommodation, but still want a large, clean centrally located Hotel with very friendly owners - then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome little hotel right near the train station”
Reviews.Author: mugsy58
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff was very helpful, and the location was great - just a five minute walk from the train station. The entrance is hard to find, and it's confusing as you enter. There are apartments in the location, too, so it doesn't seem like there's a hotel there. The rooms are well appointed and clean, and very comfortable. I would highly recommend it for a reasonable night's stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sharumba
Reviews.Content: We thought the location of this hotel was fantastic. From the airport you get the bus"Terrivision" for 4 euros each to the "Termini" - The Hotel is just down a side street from this stop so perfect, no taxi's required. The hotel is not well sign posted but is on the left hand side near the bottom of the street. When you are in Rome you need to travel mainly by underground, there is line A and Line B - the Termini is that the main metro station which takes you to all the attractions. The Hotel was very clean, and we got clean towels each day. Breakfast wascontinental perfect. Rooms also had Air Con. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: murraba
Reviews.Content: Hotel Domus Praetoria is perfectly situated for a visit to Rome. We found it easy to walk from the hotel to several places we wanted to visit, and it is close to Termini, from which trains, buses, and the subway run virtually everywhere. The clerk gave us excellent directions. We also enjoyed a good Roman breakfast. Our only problem was finding the hotel. It is not well identified from a sign in the street, and the street names in Rome are not clearly marked.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience again”
Reviews.Author: PragueCosmopolitan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Domus Praetoria Hotel for 5 days in the mid of March. It was my second visit (first in October 2009) and it was a very good experience again. Location near the Termini Station, close to the public transport and airport express, very helpful and friendly hotel staff, good quality of rooms and other services. Definitely will come again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good-value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivt
Reviews.Content: The hotel located 5 mins from the train station (Termini) and the Terravision bus stop to the Ciampino airport. Nicely, it is located not in the first couple of blocks next to the station, which are noisy and a bit seedy, but a couple more blocks away. Termini location is not bad, as Rome does not have a single focal point anyway. You will need to travel from any place. Why not from Termini then? Do not forget the address of the hotel (via Milazzo 42) as the hotel does not really have a good sign: you can only see the name on the small door button. It is one of these city hotels located in the converted apartments. The (24hr) reception is on the ground floor and the blocks of rooms are situated (at least) on a couple of other floors of the buidling. But they all (it seems) share a common starecase. The rooms are large (at least ours), with high ceilings, wooden floors, etc. The only thing I disliked about the rooms was "weak" flush of WC (sometimes you need to wait for 5 mins just to do it... sorry for this detail; but maybe the hotel management reads reviews and fixes it). Also breakfast was not the best one: only bread, butter, jam, yoghurt, some juice and croissant-like pastry. No cheese, ham or smth like that. But morning capuccino is good. Considering that we paid less than 100 eur it was good value for money, overall.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay and just as pleased, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: IandP
Reviews.Content: After staying here two years ago we had no hesitation in re-booking this time around. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and tastefully decorated with adequate cupboard space.
