Noise was not an issue and we both slept well throughout our four night stay. Rooms are quite large compared to some we have stayed in both in Rome and other European cities. Plenty of towels and toiletries as well as a good over-bath shower. TV is not something we watch much on holiday so BBC world news and Italian weather were more than adequate! Continental style breakfast is usual fare and the bread and pastries come fresh from the shop across the street. The area is maybe not the most salubrious in Rome but we have always felt safe and there are a selection of good options for eating in the neighbouring streets. Most are full of Italian clientele so that is always a good advert! The brothers, yes there are three, are very helpful and will help with directions, information etc and because it is a small hotel you always feel you are getting the personal touch. We didn't find the major toursit attractions too far of a walk and central Rome is not that big! (we walked to Ostiense in less than 45 minutes) Buses, trams and metro are all at termini if necessary. If you want somewhere clean, comfortable and friendly at a very reasonable rate I'd recommend this hotel. When we are back in Rome again we will certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WELCOMING AND CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Cookie_Au
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my husband and daughter in January. Initially booked 4 nights but extended another night with no issue. As per other reviews, the brothers are very helpful and a delight to deal with. Room was more than adequate for the 3 of us and bathroom also a good size. Yes there is a few steps to the lift and usually on 1 person and a large piece of luggage can fit but at least there was a lift.If no luggage then it can take 2 people quite comfortably. We found the location perfect to walk to all the sites. When we were out further we found being so close to the Termini was a definite advantage. We thought the market downstairs quite a novelty and like others had no issue with noise whatsoever. The brothers gave us a wonderful restaurant recommendation just around the corner called "Made in Napoli" . The only downside was that the WIFI was very temperamental and a little slow which was a little disappointing as the router was right outside our door. Although on vacation, I needed to have access to my company email. We found that when it worked, it would be only if we sat in a certain position on the bed in the room. A smaller issue is the lack of English programs on the TV which is always nice to have when you have returned from a day of sightseeing etc. That being said, I have no trouble recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: pomandoztrax
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable, secure and quiet it also had high ceilings, comfortable bed, fridge, a safe for belongings and a free Wi Fi connection. This hotel is very close to the main railway station and most tourist sites. Give all the above the it was very good value for money. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for price and location”
Reviews.Author: Gateway_12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in late October for several days. I arranged my booking directly with the hotel via email and seemed to get a fair price. When I arrived I was told that I had been upgraded, which was great to hear, but not entirely sure if it was the truth (my apologies if it was true). The hotel itself is located in the far end of a quiet street. I arrived quite late in the evening, and at that time it was quiet. It actually has a flea market early in the morning. I had no problems finding the hotel, it is two minutes from the termini rail link. The area around the hotel isn't great, a littel burt run down if anything. Upon arival was shown my room. No issues with the room, large, and had a nice bathroom. My room faced the street, but had no issues with the noise etc (even with the flea market outside early in the morning). The bizarre things about this hotel is that it has a very tiny lift, and to get to your room, you have to go through a large door to get to your landing and then another door to get to your room. In the morning when I tried to leave the room the landing was black, and you need to find the light switches.I did after several minutes (this may be discerning for some). To get off the landing you have to go through the large the door, having arrived very late the nifght before, I struggled to get off the landing (lol), you get used to this after the first time. Breakfast was fine, nothing great, but not bad either. I was offered coffee by the waitress who then made it, which was nice. The brothers are very good and pointed to the places that you should see. they gave some good recommendations of local restauarnts etc Overall, the hotel was ideal for what I was looking for, somewhere quite cheap, easily access to transport, safe and breakfast included. It ticked my criteria boxes. I came to Rome to see the sights, and didn't intend to spend much time at the hotel. Rome itself is awesome....enjoy Rome and this hotel ain't bad either...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BarryJohn212
Reviews.Content: Really nice and friendly hotel, The staff we met (3 Brothers) were really helpful and friendly. They arranged trips via the reception based maps and telephoned restaurants with no issues. Rooms good and Quiet and fitted with safes and room bar. Really Great location near the terminal and the direct bus to the airport. Highly Recommended Barry John

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: grumbleweed1
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel situated only 3 or so minutes from the Termini station. Only a 20 minute stroll to the main ruins area. The Hotel was clean, comfortable and roomy and the brothers who own it couldn't have been more helpful. It must be said that my partner didn't like the walk from the hotel to the termini, especially at night, but I thought it was safe enough. Overall, for its position and value it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Andrewuk_7
Reviews.Content: if your looking for a hotel thats is clean, has a great location for the termini and airport shuttle drop offs, and has helpful staff, then this is perfect. we had 3 double rooms in our party, and all were a very good size from normal to very large. the brothers that run the place were very helpful and even booked us a table at a restaurant for us. we travelled round rome on the 4 euro a day metro ticket you still she alot of the city because you have to walk through small streets to most of the major sights and discover hidden churches etc. there were buses but they seems to gets stuck in traffic, and we were only there for 2 days. we will definatley use this hotel again and hope to return soon, with more time, to see the cities wonders.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 1planete
Reviews.Content: Very good choice, quite and central location , Termini station is very close by, we didn't need any taxi, our bedrooms was new and nice furnished, the staff were always available to our questions... we will be back .

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: canziano
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night in this hotel but that was enough to understand that all revies on tripadvisor were right. The hotel is 200 metres from the main train station, but still very quite in the night, rooms are extremely clean and quite large for central hotels in Rome (bath and shower were both quite large), staff is very kind and ready to answer any request, breakfast basic but good. I would say this is a no-frills hotel, which would deserve more than the 2 stars it has. In short, unbeatable value for the price (btw, call them directly to be sure to get the best rate for the room), if you are looking for a cheap, safe and confortable accomodation the most beautiful city in the world, do not hesitate to pick this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the $$. Definitely worth returning”
Reviews.Author: klwalker75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It's close to the termini and metro stations (less than 5 min walk), which made it really easy to get around Rome. The brothers were incredibly friendly and I exchanged several emails with them prior to our trip. They recommended some affordable restaurants in the area, one of which had the best pizza I'd ever had in Italy! The 24 hour service was great. There were 3 of us traveling together and they were very accommodating. The room was quite large for European standards for 3 people. The outdoor market in the mornings was great to see. If I ever return to Rome, this will be the only hotel I'll stay in!

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CaBrasil
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for honey moon and I got this hotel. In the begin I was afraid but when I got there I was so surprised. The room and toilet was big ( it is a surprise for eropens´s rooms) and very clean and confortable. The locations couldn be better. The breakfast is simple and the people qho work there are very friendly and helpfuly.I defintely will be back again once I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to train station”
Reviews.Author: DavidArlingtonVa
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel specifically because it is very close to Termini train station, where one gets the train to the airport. I looked unprepossessing when I arrived - you have to buzz yourself in through a big door on a somewhat empty street, but the room was very clean and modern with a comfortable bed. The space is tight - not much room aside from the bed and a modern closet bedstand. But it has a real shower and a nice bathroom. The night staff were very gracious with excellent English. Breakfast was pretty limited -- good coffee, yogurt and bread and jam. And only 3 blocks from the station. This is not a neighborhood I would generally recommend if you were spending a longer time in Rome -- not very lively at night, mostly budget hotels, limited restaurants. But perfect if you need a place before catching an early plane home.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms”
Reviews.Author: lilysouthcarolina
Reviews.Content: Very spacious clean nice rooms, really good coffee with light continental type breakfast, excellent staff, short walk from train station although some difficult by cab/shuttle as flea market in front blocks entrance requiring a short walk to vehicle, no lobby area to relax. Probably not the most upscale or scenic location, but certainly in safe area with restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars + for this great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: z1bby
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty well travelled and hotels in general just kind of morph into each other and it's hard to remember anything distinctive about them - but not this one! From the moment you push open the huge wooden door and enter into the lobby it just smacks of something special. Easy to locate from Termini, less than a 5 minute walk in a vibrant neighbourhood - plenty of great restaurants (the hotel recommend a couple of them) laundrymats, deli's, internet cafe's and a daily market held right outside the hotel. Huge room, clean and comfortable, the guys that run the hotel are so hospitable and helpful, cute little breakfast room with the best coffee, and once you get your bearings, you realise that you are in fact within walking distance of most of the sights - as long as you do like to walk!! Our room was directly above the street and the market sets up quite early (5amish) and it did disturb us initially until we remembered to shut our window at night and surprise surprise, no more street noise! We ended up returning to Rome a day early from our travels around Sorrento and managed to book another night here. If I am ever fortunate enough to return to Roma this is where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SBSCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Domus was the perfect place to stay in Rome - a few blocks from the Termini, where you can catch the subway or buses to any location easily. It was in a quiet neighborhood, away from the rush of tourists. Rooms facing the street are fun for people-watching, especially in the mornings with the local street market. They do start setting up at 6am, but the windows do a great job of blocking out noise. There is only WiFi at the hotel, but if you need computers/internet, there is an internet cafe/laundry facility 2 block away on Via Varese, 33, and can be used for 1.5Euro /hour (hint: their printer sucks, so if you need to print documents, do it elsewhere). Breakfasts are sparse, and the staff describe it as a typical "European breakfast". I remedied this by going to a local grocery store and buying cheese and meusli (there are small refridgerators in the rooms), and this supplemented their breakfasts affordably. Lovely, helpful staff. Others have commented on the hotel being in a questionable neighborhood, but traveling as a solo female, did not find it to feel unsafe at all. It was a quiet, lovely retreat at the end of long sightseeing days and I would recommend it to anyone without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay, 3 brothers are so friendly”
Reviews.Author: solivene
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on 9/24-26/ 2009 before our cruise and we found the place so clean and roomy, the 3 brothers are so helpful, finding the place was no problem just accross Roma Termini and 2 blocks walk. We came back for another night on Oct. 10, this time he gave us the whole apartment with 3 bedroom, and he only charged us for the same. I recommend this place to anyone even for someone who has never been in Rome, very clean, breakfast are okay and the brothers speak English fluently. With their directions we managed to see Villa d Este Tivoli with no problem. You made our stay wonderful. When we go back we will use your hotel again, it was a bargain for the price and location, perfect. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel 3 minutes from Termini”
Reviews.Author: Phluffy024
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed at in Rome. It is located in a decent part of town 3-5 min from Termini (train station) which made travel around the city fairly easy as there was the metro stop very close by. The hotel itself is within a building that you must buzz into, so it is very safe. The room was ok; two twin beds pushed together with one sheet made up the queen sized bed. The bathroom was small and the shower drain was clogged which was remedied fairly quickly. There was FREE INTERNET, which was sweet and a rare commodity, it seems, in italy. The breakfast was very basic, but adequate. Overall, a good experience and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: marleycat25
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at Hotel Domus Praetoria. What a great find. ... Just a few blocks from Termini. You can be anywhere in Rome in minutes. There is a market right outside every morning, with fresh fruit and just about everything else. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was super large and very clean, we even had a mini fridge, and a window with a view of the courtyard. The bathroom very modern and the shower was the largest we ever had in Italy. We highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Jave09
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel a few hundred meters from the train station. We were able to walk or metro everywhere. The rooms are super clean and big -- really big. The bathrooms are a little on the small side compared to an American Hilton (for example) but are big enough, well-appointed and very clean. The morning breakfast is nice with the staff preparing a fresh coffee, expresso, etc., However, we found it lacking in any protein or whole grain breads. Despite this, our stay was nearly flawless, with the staff giving us a "map tour" of the city and some recommendations on sites to visit that were really wonderful but the guidebook didn't do them justice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place. Good stay”
Reviews.Author: caraelizab
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel in September. The rooms were clean, the people nice, and it was quiet. I would return. My only complaint is about the showers...the bathroom over all is nice. The shower just didn't have a lot of pressure and was hard to get hot. They had hot water I think you just needed to put it in the right spot. Kinda annoying. Overall a great stay though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SMAHumble
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccommend this hotel. I can not say enough nice things about Antonio and his brothers who were extemely nice, helpful and accomodating. Antonio jumped up from his desk to let my husband use his computer! Who does that? It was so kind!The street it's on is not the best part of town, but it's not terrible and I never felt unsafe. The many locked doors you must go through to get to your room provides a perfectly safe environment. The short walk to Termini can not be beat as far as convenience! The rooms were large in comparison to European standards and extremely clean and I am very, very picky! It had the best, cleanest and largest shower out of every Italy hotel I've stayed in, maybe in all of Europe. My daughter said the same thing about the shower in her room. Breakfast was forgettable, but I think the price , room size and cleanliness more than makes up for that. When comparing price, cleanliness, location and customer service, my top four priorities, out of four different hotels I've stayed at in Rome, I would go back to Domus Praetoria first! Thanks Antonio for a wonderful stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jonsar2
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the service that we got at Hotel Domus. Antonio, Fabio and Massimo the three brothers went out of their way to make our stay the most wonderful one it could be. The accomodations are great, the location is central to everything. You are right near the train and bus station which you will need to get around Rome. I would not hesistate to stay there. Simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--Don't Let the Street It's On Fool You”
Reviews.Author: Voyajeuse
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location just minutes from the train station. Our room was quite large and nicely decorated, with a small balcony overlooking the street. The room was clean and quiet. There was a street market the day we arrived and the clutter had me wondering what the hotel would be like. But everything was fine and the rate was excellent too. The breakfast is modest, but there are plenty of places selling pastry, juice, espresso, etc., along the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: telco
Reviews.Content: If you like being located right near the main train terminal, you are in luck. Absolutely no thrills. Decent sized rooms, decent bathroom. Breakfast completely forgettable. Cheapest towels (pill all over everything) known to man. A TV smaller than a good, mid-size pizza pie. A remote that only does channel up/channel down. But, clean, cheap and exactly as promised. The desk guys helpful. A solid, reliable, affordable 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Italoknitter
Reviews.Content: Three nice brothers manage this small, well-kept establishment in the heart of the Termini area. I got a free room upgrade, help booking reservations for trains and museums, good recommendations on restaurants...and a nice room and bath. Very convenient to the train station and subway and some good museums nearby. In a courtyard-type building, fairly quiet despite being on a street with a market and other commercial activities. Would definitely stay again if I wanted to be in that part of town. Much better than staying in one of the large, noisy hotels. Only drawback was the flat panel TV tuned to MTV in the breakfast room...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TurnboSydney
Reviews.Content: Please don't let negative review re hotel mix up sway you! This hotel was wonderful with central position, secure and very clean comfortable room. The staff were helpful and as I was travelling solo they went out of their way to be helpful, especially when I left they escourted me to the taxi. Breakfast was basic, but who cares.

Reviews.Title: “Domus Praetoria is one of the best places to stay in Rome. At any price.”
Reviews.Author: marinlicina
Reviews.Content: To say it short and sweet: Domus Praetoria is one of the best places to stay in Rome. At any price, let alone in it's low price category. As many at TripAdvisor probably thought, I wasn't expecting the hotel to really be as good as all the reviews suggested. Maybe the people just enjoyed Rome so much they overlooked the hotel's flaws. But I can honestly tell you to believe the hype. It's the cleanest hotel I have ever been in, including 4 and 5 star Hyatt's and Hiltons. The service is personal, exceeds expectations and at a very pleasant point between formal and amical. For Italian (or European) standards, the room are above average in size, and what I liked about our room was that it was furnished so well: I usually hate when the bed is crammed into a space leaving you with only a few centimeters to walk by, when closet's cant open fully etc. etc. Our room wasn't large by any standard, but it never felt crammed. Airconditioning is good and not limited to some low-power consumption mode like in some hotels: you can crank it up to cool as much as you like. Another superb thing: cloth hangers! Most hotels provide you with 3 or 4. Here we had around 10. It's such a considerate detail that most hotels decide to ignore. The bathroom is also the cleanest I have ever seen. No dust, smudge, anything at all. The toilet, bidet, shower, everything was as clean as it can possible be. Towels were switched daily, even though some of them were only used once or not at all. Our showerhead was damaged by the previous guest, but it was something the maid overlooked. So the shower was spraying around, making it a bit difficult (but not impossible to shower). We pointed them to this detail and they fixed it immediately, while we were away for dinner. New shower head. Problem more than solved. Breakfast is ok if you like Italian breakfast (brioche and jam, capuccino and some fruit juice and/or yoghurt). No luxurious breakfast here, but I'm in Rome to go out and have some fun, not to have 2 hour breakfasts. The breakfast room was very, very clean, the food was fresh and plentiful. So it might be a very simple breakfast, but done very well. The brothers make a great capuccino. The staff is friendly and ready to answer questions, their english is very good and they even allowed us to check out of the room 1,5 hours after the regular checkout time, although there were other guests coming in the afternoon. A very big plus in my opinion is free and quite fast Wi-Fi. I hate it when expensive hotels decide that being able to check your e-mail once in a while should cost 10 euros or whatever a day. Our Travel guide specified the neighbourhood as 'shady' and said it might be better not to be there for too long at night. We didn't notice any of this. Yes, it does have a large concentration of immigrants, some characters loitering around the central station (Italian and foreign alike), but we never felt unsafe or saw anything unusual or treathening. The police is ever present around the Termini station, day and night. Speaking of the station, Termini is the place you get off when coming from the airport and the only crossing of Rome's two subway lines, which I find really valuable, instead of wasting time going to and from your hotel, you can be almost anywhere in central Rome in less than 20 minutes. To summarize: if you don't need a sauna, swimming pool, restaurant or conference room in your hotel, this is the one to choose. It's clean, the rooms are very good, the service is fantastic and the price is unbelievably good. If you just want to stay comfortably in Rome for a few days and don't have any special needs only a large hotel could fulfil: go to Domus Praetoria.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Hotel Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: FADI1981
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had stayed at the Domus Praetoria Hotel for 4 nights and it was really a great place to stay. Location was perfect with 2 minutes walk from the main station of Rome (Termini Station). Breakfast was included to room rate. shops, restaurants, internet cafes are available at the same area. many thanks to the helpful staff HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: ReidRock
Reviews.Content: Three night stay after a week in Umbria.What a briliant little hotel! Quite quirky in that it is just part of a building and you pass through public areas to get to the rooms but very secure - all access doors controlled by surveillance cameras. Lovely room,very clean, very good condition, even a small balcony. Great staff, nice little breakfast room serving simple fayre, great location - walking distance to station and metro. Love it, love it, love it!

Reviews.Title: “lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: ms60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Domus last January and it was a lovely experience. Because of the high euro my friend and I had to forsake three star hotels in charming locations. Hotel Domus is a two star hotel near the train station. The rooms and bathrooms are large and spotless, as is the rest of the hotel. They served a nice breakfast that included a variety of pastries and multiple cappucinos. The best part was the people. The hotel is run by a father and his two adult sons -- they could not have been more civilized or nicer. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the train station so the neighborhood is somewhat tatty (tatty, not seedy). What we discovered however is how convenient it is to be right at the transportation hub. The hotel also directed us to a stylishand good restaurant a couple of blocks away. We'd be happy to come back here .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: thevara
Reviews.Content: I would agree with all the previous entries.The location is very close to termini station (and the Metro station).Although we were a bit worried about the area, we had no problems and on most nights were getting back at around midnight. Although most sights are not close to the hotel they are walkable or are accessable by the Metro (2-4 stops and cheap).The rooms are neat and clean.The 3 brothers who run the hotel are friendly and extremely helpful if you have any enquiries.One slight downside is the breakfast which could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bzchrmr
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious rooms (and bathrooms) for the price. Rooms didn't have much character, but were very comfortable. Super close to the Termini/Metro, and minutes by Metro from all the main tourist attractions (maybe only 20 minutes or less to Vatican City). Staff were all very helpful. We had an unexpected friend join our travels, and they set up an extra bed immediately in our room. One of the brothers actually helped me make a same-day last-minute reservation to the Villa Borghese gallery, which turned out to be a highlight of my trip to Rome. They also let us leave our luggage in the reception area from about 10am until 7pm, when we left to catch our late flight. The area felt very safe, though we mostly took cabs back late at night. Breakfast was typical of Italian b&b's, with a variety of brioche and rolls, yogurt, juice, and of course fabulous coffees available. Each morning we were there (three days, two nights), a farmer's market was set up on the street immediately outside the building. It was a wonderful market, with incredibly sweet tomatoes, cherries and peaches that we would purchase to take along as a snack on our way out. To our astonishment, we never heard the noise of the market in the morning, even though our window faced the street. Overall, a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: lovetomatopasta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night. It was very close to the Termini station and also to Metro which was very convenient. We walked to Colosseo but the walk wasn't too bad. The room was very clean and quiet, not too small -- I guess you could even say it's a bit roomy considering how cramped European hotel rooms can be. Staff was helpful (they let us leave our luggage after check-out until we depart the city to do some sight seeing). We arrived at Termini at night and got lost somehow, away from the busy area and it seemed a bit dodgey. The hotel is located not at the end of the street but one building before, in what looks like an apartment. There is a small gold sign. (no large signs)

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, noise and breakfast let the place down”
Reviews.Author: meljhart
Reviews.Content: For reasonable value for money, large spacious rooms, proximity to Termini station, and front desk staff, this hotel is great. The only factors that led to a score of 4 instead of 5 out of 5 were: - the breakfasts - we would have rathered that breakfast was not indicated as included (and thus not charged for), we have travelled to many places and have pretty minimum expectations, but given you could choose between a croissant or nothing, we would have rather just not had breakfast included, and stopped by a bakery on our way out. - the noise - we realise that the hotel is in Rome, and unikely to be quiet, but at our time of staying there the air conditioning was not able to be used, and thus we had to choose between a very hot room or a very noisy room.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!!! Best value in Rome! Period!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPimp
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms. Good price. Great family run business. Pastry shop across serves decent to go food and fresh milk. Spend your hard earned money on small business with great service instead of corporations that don't care. Secure Hotel. The family service is par excellence. Great location to Termini Station. Use Fountains for free water.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: looneytune123
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - easy walk to Central Station and Metro stops - busy street but felt safe walking even late night. Building does not look like a hotel but more like an apt in a building where you have to buzz for the door to unlock and you enter a courtyard foyer. Elevator cage takes you to your floor where the door is again unlocked from the front desk. Makes you feel very safe and secure in the building. Our room for 3 was huge!! with clean hardwood floor , simple decor and clean toilet. Internet wifi is free although had a hard time connecting b/c of the long corridor in our room. The staff is SUPER NICE - the 3 brothers running it are all very pleasant, attentive and helpful. They allow you to leave your luggage for the day for a late flight or will store them for free - makes up for a very minimal breakfast - bread, coffee and juice- we dont wake up early enough for breakfast anyways so no big deal. Overall, this is a great hotel esp for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Owners and location are great; a bit of noise the only drawback.”
Reviews.Author: MoseyOn
Reviews.Content: Three generations of our family stayed here in three rooms for four nights in July 2008. The hotel is very conveniently located a short walk from the Termini train station, making it ideally situated for getting around Rome. There are several restaurants and plenty of gelato within a short walk, as well as a laundry not far away that we used after two weeks on the road. The brothers who run the hotel provide outstanding service. They helped with directions and advice, booked tickets in advance for some of the museums that issue them, and arranged transportation to the airport--all of it without seeming the least bit bothered by our requests. The breakfast is not exciting, but it will get you through the morning well enough. The only complaint we had was that in one or two of the rooms, there was a great deal of noise from above at night. Fortunately it did not go terribly late, but while it lasted it was unpleasant. But that was the only drawback, and it would not prevent me from giving a very positive recommendation to the hotel. The rooms themselves were fine. Each was different, but all were comfortable. Conclusion: I would recommend this to anyone looking for good value, a great location, and terrifically friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, large clean rooms, central location”
Reviews.Author: swansea-lass09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights over the period for the Champion's League final. Close fo the Termini train station, the hotel is well placed for accessing all public transport in the area. The rooms are spacious and very clean; ours had air con, a mini-bar and a small balcony overlooking a back-street. The hotel is run by two brothers who we found to be extremely helpful and friendly. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the vicinity - you may find that if you hit the small breakfast room at peak time, there wont be room to seat you. We would strongly recommend the nearby cafe at number 68/70 Via dei Mille, just around the corner, where the owner Roberto and the waiter Remo made us feel very welcome. My only criticism of this hotel would be that there seemed to be a lot of noise from the regular closing /slamming of the door between the lift and the hotel rooms. If you stay at this hotel, I would recommend that you ask for a room that is as far from the lift as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, Friendly staff, good location near Termini”
Reviews.Author: AMS47
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel near Termini. The area is a bit run down, but lively at night. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Recommended two restaurants nearby which were excellent. We would recommend the Maid of Naples. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to an apartment which had two bedrooms a sitting room, and a balcony - small bathroom, but very clean. We would definitely stay here again. The hotel is quite easy to find - once you know how. Once in the train station, walk towards the main gallery and take the exit on your right-hand side and you will be on Via Marsala.; follow cars' direction and take the first street on your left-hand side: that is Via Milazzo. The hotel is at the very end of the street at number 42 (which is the last door on the left-hand side). There is only a little brass plate outside and you buzz to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, good price, convenient location to train station”
Reviews.Author: CloudlessBlueSky
Reviews.Content: I forgot to write a review of this place back in November, but I wanted to take a minute to do it now. It really is a nice hotel, I agree with much of what the other reviewers have said. Large, clean, quiet room, with nice breakfast. If you want bacon and eggs, you'll be disappointed, but we liked what we got. Coffee made to order, fresh pastries, yogurt, etc. The staff was very polite and friendly. Really the only reason you might not stay here is if you want a hotel in another part of the city, but if you want to be close to the train station on a quiet street, then this place will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back..”
Reviews.Author: Travelator123
Reviews.Content: Positives (in this order) - Very friendly reception staff - very helpful, can plan your itinerary, give their computer to you for internet access - Location - just 2 blocks away from termini. - Rooms - Big & high ceilings. Negatives - Breakfast - Nothing great - very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: pattymelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a total of three nights, and found it to be a wonderful experience. The hotel staff was extremely helpful getting us checked in. We arrived before the normal check-in time, but were able to go up to our room immediately. The staff spoke English well, and were able to help us with directions to the subway. The hotel is only about three blocks from the Tremini rail station, which was a very convenient. We used the subway throughout our stay to move around the city. The hotel room itself was nice sized - not huge but certainly big enough. It was clean and quiet. The continental breakfast was also a nice extra. The room was not cheap by U.S. standards, but after doing a lot of online searches for hotels, we were happy with our choice to stay there. We have recommended the hotel to family members already.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Keralhin
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Rome, I booked online and took a chance. I got lucky!! This hotel was 2 blocks from the Termini station, which can get you anywhere you want. The hotel was alittle confusing to get into, but once in was elegantly appointed, and the room was comfortable and immaculate. The bathroom was spa-like! Super quiet, considering it's location, and the staff was great! Very helpful and friendly. Breakfast could've have had alittle more variety, but still nice to have a quick bite on your way out the door. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lcOcOl
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Convenient location, bright, clean, comfortable, and big rooms. There is a safe available in the room. The only thing is the hot water is not hot enough. The breakfast is also kinda simple. Even though this place is about 10 minute from the train station, the hotel area is not crowded and not dirty at all. If you want, you can actually walk to the colosseum. Or you can simply take the Metro A/B in the train station to go to varies sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent large room, great value, easy location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBeenthere
Reviews.Content: Located on North side of Termini with only a brass plaque out front, easy to walk past and not see, the Domus is family run, has very nice rooms with 14 foot ceilings and our room in the back we only heard birds chirping when we opened the windows during rush hour. Probably the AC not necessary even during summer. Breakfast minimal, could have been improved with some hard-boiled eggs and cereal but pastries and cappucino were excellent. Beds very comfortable and a triple for decent price. Huge room with high ceiling was a joy to relax in and listen to the birds. Internet sketchy except in the lobby. Would definitely return, the two brothers and their father were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, great location..”
Reviews.Author: sanjay2808
Reviews.Content: Location - Great location. Hardly 5 mins from the Termini station and the Metro. Surroundings - Day time there is a market which takes place on the road. Quite a few eateries very near to the hotel and near Termini. There is a Chinese restaurant nearby. We used to come not sooner than 11 pm and we felt safe to do so. So the hotel is near buzzing area and I felt good. Breakfast - Very modest breakfast which included tea/coffee, breads, jam, butter, yogurt and juice. I think fruits and cornflakes could be included to make it better. Rooms - Nice and clean bed rooms. I was in 302. Do not expect great views from the window, rather there is no view from this one. Well, we did not have time to enjoy views after long day outside. Staff - Very friendly staff, no questions about that. You can check out and leave your luggage at the reception as well. Internet service - Well I was not happy about it. I don't know why it never used in my room 302. So I had to go downstairs at the reception to connect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Be7th
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, my husband and I booked online and stayed at the Hotel Domus for 14 days in March, plenty of time to get a feel for the place. The result was complete satisfaction. Here are some highlights form our stay . LOCATION - If all roads lead to Rome, they more specifically lead to the Termini Station. The Hotel DP is 500 meters from the station and that is a huge plus for catching the train, shuttling to and from the airport, and taking the metro anywhere in Rome. Some folks wrote about the area after dark being a little shady. We had no issues with that, and if you do feel funny, there is a police/guard station about 100 meters from the hotel. There is also a internet/laundry cafe close by. They do a great job on your clothes and are reasonably priced. Additionally, check out the Antique Tavern on the street for good food. HOTEL - The actual hotel is run by 3 brothers, aided by their father. Everyone speaks English and the service is excellent. The hotel is clean, quiet (no kids running around) and a free breakfast of yogurt, pastries, and cappuccino is provided daily. The room was large, big king bed, private bath with tub and shower, safe and mini-bar, and wonderful windows that opened two a courtyard. You turn in your key as you leave the hotel, and they buzz you in. The process made us feel very safe about people just coming in and out. SERVICE - The service is top notch. They helped with tours, maps, always followed up on our visits and anything we needed we received ASAP. The internet only works in the breakfast area, but they are working on that, and they are fine with you using their printer if you need it. The building does not allow Irons, but if you find yourself in need the laundry/internet cafe up the street can help. PRICE - for 14 days they charged us $1600 (USD) 1200 EURO. That was the big sale for us. We got a discount for booking so long, but 90 EURO a night in Rome was a great deal which allocated funds for some amazing day trips and other things. All in all, I agree with the above reviews. The Hotel Domus Praetoria is a hidden gem in Rome. The place belongs in Frommers and other travel guides. I have already recommended to several friends and if we visit Rome again (we did throw a coin in the fountain) we will always stay at the Hotel Domus Praetoria.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised and reviewed”
Reviews.Author: alice063
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family because of all the rave reviews and we were not disappointed. We are a family of four, with 13 and 14 year old teenagers. We were given the 2nd floor apartment - huge! A living room, sitting room, bedroom with 2 twin beds and our room with a queen bed. The bathroom had recently been renovated, so everything there was new and in perfect working order. And the place would have passed a white glove test with flying colors! The father and 3 sons were all friendly and accomodating. The breakfast room was small, but never full. Typical european style - bread, pasteries, yogurt, juice, milk, cappucinos. Extra kudos to the cleaning staff - my daughter has a bunny that she takes with her on every trip. It's "well loved". Anyway, they washed it and proped it back on her bed. Bun looked, and smelled much better! Also, the kids like to be really cozy, so they were using extra blankets on top of their covers. The next evening, we came back, to find that the maid had incoporated the extra blankets under the covers! And of course, there were always plenty of clean towels. The only reason why I didnt give the rooms a "5" is that the tv reception was bad - just a lot of snow. My kids would have liked to veg in front of the tv to unwind before bed. The location wasnt bad. It's 3 - 4 blocks from Termini, so easy to find. And easy to catch trains and metro. Very safe, if you keep an eye out for cars and motorcycles... : ) However, it wasnt in the middle of everything. It would have been nice to stop by the room in the middle of the day. That being said, the price we paid was very reasonable and we enjoyed our stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - value and very clean”
Reviews.Author: DeBunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Hotel Domus on our way out of Italy. The hotel is in a shared building and requires buzzing the doorbell to be let into a tradition Italian interior courtyard. They are located to the right(gold sign Scala B) Check in was a breeze and even the room was available before noon. The hotel is run by a family and one of the brothers even helped with our luggage to Room 305. The room had long hallway and separate, very large bedroom & sitting area, and separate bath wih window. All very clean and updated. Large amoire, tv and minibar. Would definately recommend this hotel for the value, cleanliness and great experience with the owners (who spoke English). Yes, this hotel is in shared building and is near train/metro stations, so it is not an American traditional hotel. We were out into the evening and had no worries beyond normal caution in any large city. Train to airport was 5 minute walk to station. Most of Rome is 20-30 minute walk from this area and on foot is best way to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Rome - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonKiwigirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights en route to a conference in Florence and again on my way home to NZ. The place is really handy to the main train station - literally about 5 minutes walk, so it's perfect if you're passing through Rome to some other part of Italy. By European standards, the rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. The place is run by three brothers who speak great English and I found them to be incredibly helpful and polite. The breakfast room is small and the breakfast pretty simple but honestly - it was all I needed. In terms of value for money, this hotel was 1/3 of what I paid in Florence and about twice as good. I was travelling alone and felt quite safe there. The outside is unprepossessing and you might wonder if you have the right door, but stick with it, it's worth it. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: vacationers12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed from December 26th through January 4th (family of five). We stayed in the "new apartment" which is one floor above the reception office. We had booked two rooms consisting of one room with a queen-size bed and another room with three single beds and one bathroom and were happy to find out that the "new apartment" is very spacious. You enter a room that has a coffee table and two chairs and a mini-fridge. A long hall extends from this room, and off the hall were the two bedrooms and bathroom. The bedroom with the three single beds actually had another room adjoining it which had a wardrobe in it. Also, there was a large "spare room" off the hall which was not specifically intended for use but actually had a large table in it which we used once for a family meal. The mattresses on all the beds were very firm (great if you have a back problem) but still comfortable, and the queen-size bed was actually larger than an American standard queen-size bed. The entire "apartment" was immaculate. Heat and hot water were plentiful, although the water in the shower every so often gets reduced pressure or heat for a minute or so and then goes back to normal operation. The three Menichelli brothers and their father, who own the hotel, are incredibly nice and always accommodating. Although the Termini area is a little "sketchy", we always felt completely safe at this hotel. Also, the access to the Termini down the street makes metro and bus transportation easy. (We took the Leonardo Express from the airport to Termini and then walked the short distance to the hotel.) The small breakfast (roll and pastry, yogurt, cappuccino, coffee, or tea) was just right to start the day. Also, if you occasionally get tired of going to restaurants, note that what is called the "Drug Store" in the Termini is actually a supermarket and has all the foods you could possibly want. Also, the best Chinese food we have every had turned out to be at the "Hong Kong" restaurant near the Termini (expensive, and small portions, but absolutely delicious). The Domus Praetoria is a wonderful place to stay. Don't pass this up!

Reviews.Title: “Better Late than Never”
Reviews.Author: Dustin_McOkov
Reviews.Content: Well, using tripadvisor has worked out for us on every front. The Domus Praetoria Hotel, was an outstanding experience. Authentic old Italian building, freindly helpful owners. Having morning cappucino (the best we've ever had) and a sticky bun in a local coffee shop with the locals compliments of the Domus. Great local restaurants, (loved the pene a la vodka) as suggested by the domus owners. A local monday morning street market right out front of the Domus, proximity to the train station (as we travelled europe on a eurail pass) was excellent. The price for proximity, autheticity, and ease of getting around could not be beat. We even had a local laundromat to give our travelling clothes a wash (as we were into our second week of travel) close by. Big room with big bed and great air conditioning (July is very hot, mid to high 30's daily). My wife was a little put off by the area around the train station when we first arrived, but after a geting to the Domus, and getting around the city, she totally warmed up to it. Rome is an old city and it shows, but the historical sites cannot be beat. We were in Rome for the World Cup Final and the celebration was mind blowing. We never felt unsafe, and joined in the celebrations and were welcomed, needed ear plugs though.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: anni373
Reviews.Content: The downside to this hotel...a little tricky to find, pretty meager breakfast of a roll and juice or coffee, you can hear everything through the walls. ALL the positives...The owners were nice and helpful (they spoke english great), the hotel is very secure, room was huge, bathroom was a great size with a nice shower, so close to restaurants and the Termini station. We stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a conventional hotel entrance...”
Reviews.Author: Itapipoca
Reviews.Content: If you arrive at night, you have to ring the bell. One of the owners himself was wating for us. It was Chrismas Eve. Next day he did prepare us a special Chrismas breakfest without any charge. I recommend it. I would return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Incredible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Real_Vacations
Reviews.Content: Domus Praetoria rocks! Excellent value for the money you pay. The rooms at the domus are humongous in size, very beutifully furnished, bathroom is very spacious and clean. But the best thing of all is the service you receive, the hotel is managed by three brothers that look forward on making your stay very pleasant. The hotel is strategically located 100 meters from "Termini" the main train and bus station of rome, main atrractions are just a 5-8 minute metro ride. Their are plenty of places to dine, laundry and internet are close by and inexpensive. Their is a flea market just outside the street of the hotel, you can find very inexpensive souvenirs and a wide variety of everything you might imagine. On the downside the sourrounding areas are not very beautiful but that doesent matter becouse you wont spend your vacations in the hotel. TRIPADVISOR RULES!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookinglou
Reviews.Content: Following several reviews on trip advisor i chose this Hotel. Well it was superb, the owners were very friendly. The room was spacious and big with lovely furniture and paintings. The bed was very comfortable. Bathroom brilliant lots of room. We took the terravision bus from the airport which stopped at the top of the road so about 4 minutes walk from the Termini. Local restaurants lovely, we liked Bar Amici for our evening coffee and brandy. The tours buses are about a five minute walk and are very good. This is a good location for anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Roman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Guy39
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Domus Praetoria for 6 days and had a wonderful time. The location of the hotel is very convenient, it is 2 blocks from the main train station in Rome. The hotel is not "close" to any of the major sights but because Rome is such a small city you can walk from the hotel to nearly all the major sites. The brothers who run the hotel are the most kind and friendly hosts you could ever imagine. They are capable of answering any question and despite working very long hours are always helpful and cheerful. Breakfast in the morning is served in a small, but very nice room and is served by a woman who is very kind and attentive. Our room was exceptionally clean with a comfortable bed and lots of space for two people. It consisted of a king sized bed, a beer fridge, two night tables and in an adjoining room was a wardrobe and a writing table. The bathroom looked brand new and served all our needs. Overall we couldn't say enough nice things about this hotel and will always return to it!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: helsireland
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again! The staff were very friendly and exceptionally helpful. The room we stayed in was very large for Rome, comfortable and spotless. Great location for travelling around Rome using the metro - only 2 minutes walk from the Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: GuisboroughBill
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights October 24th - 26th, using double and triple room. Booked following all positive comments on this site and I would echo all the positive comments. Entrance took a little bit of finding due to the market, but the hotel is immaculately clean and full of character. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and courteous. The breakfast was simple but perfectly adequate to start the day. Very close to main terminal if you want to use the Metro, but also within steady walking distance of most of the main attractions. I would recommend the hotel to anyone withour hesitation, it really helped to make our stay. If you want something different from the generally excellent Italian food, the Roadhouse Grill in the Terminal building provided surprisingly excellent quality steaks, and was a fun place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, easy to find.”
Reviews.Author: yorick2
Reviews.Content: Pleased with the room, it was exceptionally clean. Service was good and unobtrusive. Breakfast was limited in choice but sufficient. The breakfast room is the only 'public' room, and its small; no lounge or other rooms. Good advice about places to eat nearby. Note: our fav Meid in Napols pizzeria is closed Sun and Mon! This Hotel is not central for the tourist sites, but the Metro and train station is close. We walked a lot. Rome is very expensive. Loved the market in the street below our window.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KokobeanCalgary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Domus for a couple of nights prior to joining a Mediterranean cruise and again after returning to Rome for our flight home to Canada. We booked here based on the many positive reviews on the TripAdvisor website and we were not disappointed . This hotel is reasonably priced in an expensive city, is close to transportation at Termini station and has courteous, helpful hotel operators. We only met two of the brothers but both were friendly and spoke excellent English. The only drawbacks have been mentioned by other reviewers. The lift is very small for two people and their luggage. The hotel is difficult to find as there is no obvious street signage and we found our rooms were noisy due to late night revellers and other street activity including the market that sets up early each week day. The latter can be managed by closing windows or investing in earplugs, but is something to be aware of. The area near Termini is a bit downscale but quite safe (the Carabinieri have one of their stations on the same block as the Domus and I don't think criminals want to mess with them). Our rooms were both immaculately clean, modern and nicely decorated. The breakfast provided was very good with excellent cappucino. We definitely would stay here again and would recommend to others, provided you keep in mind that this is a hotel in Rome and not North America.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Picaza
Reviews.Content: An excelent value run by 3 brothers, who were perfect hosts and very helpful with suggestions and answers to our questions. The location was very convenient to the train station and metro, and our room was large, clean, and comfortable. There is a street market in front of the hotel every day (except Sun.) from 6 AM to 2 PM, which can be noisy, but the windows were virtually sound proof, and the available fresh fruit (among other things) was a welcome choice as we headed out the door each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: IncognitoV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights when arriving in Rome. We booked this hotel after reading all the good reviews on Trip advisor. We were not disapointed. We only met 2 of the 3 brothers and they were just so friendly and helpful. Plus for our French speaking friends, they do speak really good French! The rooms are quite large, very clean and well decorated. The location could not be better for someone using the trains, buses or subway. If ever back in Rome, we will certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Foracious
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had an excellent time. First of all, the room we got (#305), blew our minds, it was very big and had its own private corridor. The bed was comfortably big and the room was pleasantly decorated with beautiful art pieces. The rooms are very neat and worth every euro spent. Secondly, the hotel is very close to the train station and believe me, in Rome you would want to be as close to the termini as possible, if you want to take public transportation everywhere (I had very bad experience with taxis). Metro, buses and even hop-on hop-off tour buses start from termini. The termini also has Mc Donalds, 24 hour ATMs, so it was a very convenient location for us. I couldnt agree more with other reviews here about the three brothers who are the hosts. They are very friendly, customer-service oriented. Overall, we had a very pleasant experience and I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Three Brothers make Wonderful Hosts”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Colin
Reviews.Content: Have just finished our two night stay at the Domus hosted by the brothers, Anthony, Fabio and Massimo. Very helpful all round and rang up our Trip Adviser restaurant last night to check whether it was open on a Sunday, only to find not, so recommended Il Matriciano in the same street, which turned out to be an excellent recommendation. We paid €90 per night for each single room and thought it was great value for money. The rooms were spacious, the look contemporary, and all very clean. Added bonus was that the hotel is about 200m from the Roma Termini where we come into and leave from for Venice. Bed was a double and very comfortable, bathroom was great with also a bidet. One minor annoyance was the place the shower head had been fitted in the large shower. It was slap bang in the middle of the widest wall opposite the entry door, so that you couldn't make full use of the shower size. Thoughless of lazy plumbers I call it. Overall a lovely suprise and experience after our French hotel costing about the same.

Reviews.Title: “Secure, Clean, Central”
Reviews.Author: harrison9England
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with family. Location easy to find as described by hotel web site and previous entries, about 5 mins walk from rome's central train station. Neighbourhood not visually appealing but we felt safe. There is a Police station on the same block of the hotel. The Hotel has extensive security measures with buzzed controled access, CCTV, 24hr reception and biult in wall safe in room. Rooms very clean to a high standard and quiet. Outside is a daily street market but due to the double galzed windows in the room we were not awoken by them setting up. The market is an excellent place for daily supplies of fresh fruit. Acroos the road from the hotel are two cafe's and a sandwich shop on the corner. A spar shop is situated at the tarin sation opposite the junction with the road the hotel is in. We would reccomend people consider purchasing a "ROMA PASS" (get this from the tourist information desk within the Rome train station) it currenlty costs 20 euros and provides free or reduced entry to main attractions and free metro travel. it is valid for 3 days. One benifit was at the Colosseum where we skipped a massive que to be fasted tracked straight in. This time of year is very hot 33 degrees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: EJH1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of the positive reviews it has received on Trip Advisor and I'm pleased to say that I wasn't disappointed. I am a frequent visitor to Italy and will certainly stay here again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and proximity to Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: PhillyDoc
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two teenagers) stayed at the Hotel Domus Praetoria for one night at the end of our trip to Italy. We arrived from Florence in the late afternoon and wanted to stay close to the train station and in a convenient and economical hotel prior to our trip home the following day. We booked two rooms, one of which was extremely spacious, the other was smaller but also quite pleasant. The bathrooms were modern and the beds comfortable. We found the staff to be extremely helpful with advice, ordering an early morning taxi for us to the airport etc. The breakfast was ok, pastries and yogurt. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for good value, convenience to the train station. I would like to add that I found previous trip advisor reviews of this hotel to be extremely accurate for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: mad.nomad
Reviews.Content: WE booked this hotel after reading its reviews on tripadviser. This hotel and ots managers certainly live upto all their praises. The hotel is in a very bust street near station. However once you enter, it is an oasis of calm. The rooms are clean and tidy. The service excellent. We wanted to book some train tickets and the trenitalia website was not accepting non-italian cards. So I just chanced it by requesting Massimo and Fabio if they can help and they went straight ahead and booked it with their own cash! How many other hoteliers you have met that will offer and deliver like this! The only improvement that they can do is on the breakfast. It is certainly adequate. I will certainly stay there again if and when I go back to Rome with family.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: alaminvancouver
Reviews.Content: My wife and two teenage sons stayed here for 3 days. We booked based on the great reviews this cute little hotel recieved. It was a real delight. The hotel is run by (I think) 3 brothers. There is genuine care and pride being taken by these owners to keep this hotel a welcome, safe and enjoayble place to stay. The personal touch is immediately apparent and their freindly fairly good English skills helped us a great deal in getting around. The hotel is located at a 10 minute walk from the Termini Station (a site to see itself!) making it very convenient to get anywhere a typical visitor would want. There are good eating places located along the street going to the station and the street becomes a great morning market selling eeverything from fresh fruits to shoes.We would definately stay here again. 2 tips: Everything they say about pickpockets is absolutely true. Use the room safe and wear and under garment money belt at all times. Its a sad fact, but you will bet ripped off otherwise, no question about it. Tio 2: There is a spar market outside the termini station where you can buy water, fruit, snacks etc at "normal" prices.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel; good value”
Reviews.Author: FranWConcordMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, at the end of our trip this July. I picked the hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and because of its proximity to the train station, since we were taking a train to the airport in the morning. We were traveling with our nephew, so we took two rooms. Both were immaculate and comfortable. The price was very reasonable - the two rooms cost us less than one room would have in most other hotels in Rome. The hotel is family run, and the owners are very pleasant and helpful. My only reservation is that the neighborhood around Termine train station is not particularly attractive. For a longer stay in Rome I would pick a different area. But if convenience to the train is a major consideration for you, this hotel would be a good choice. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bisquit
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel, one before a cruise I was taking out of Rome, and the other when the cruise returned. I was happy to find the room was spacious, very clean, very comfortable, quiet, and a reasonable price. In the morning after my first night, I asked Massimo (one of the 3 brothers who run the hotel) to call a taxi for me. He did, but it never arrived. There is an outdoor market in the street in front of the hotel, and it keeps cars from driving down the street, so I had to go to the end of the block to get a taxi. Massimo helped me and when the taxi he called never arrived, he took me down to the next block, told me to stand in the shade, and went out into the traffic to flag down a taxi for me! He is awesome! My last night at the hotel was great, too. It was oppressively hot in Rome that day, and I'd been sightseeing. I was hot, and worn out. It was fantastic to come home to my comfy room. My room had excellent air conditioning and I was really happy about that! The hotel is mid-block, and there are huge wooden doors. There's a rather small plaque out front with the hotel's name, so it's kind of hard to locate. You press a button, and the door buzzes and automatically opens. Once inside, you're in a kind of entry way that looks out into an atrium. Go to your right, up a couple of stairs, then go to your left, and there you'll find the hotel's front desk. The hotel is very close to Termini train station. When exiting the station, go out the door on the right, then go one block to your right and you'll find the right street. It's 3 blocks up that street. I recommend this hotel 100%

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: CanuckinTexas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed this place. The hotel is situated on a quiet side street and perfectly located in the heart of Rome (a rare combination). The room was great and the staff was friendly and very accommodating. The breakfast was a bit sparse, consisting of croissants and coffee, but overall this place is a good value for the money. A tip - book the hotel through their website for a better rate. I learned this after I'd checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Good not perfect”
Reviews.Author: dejoeco
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here with my wife and teenage daughter. The room was a nice size and the bathroom was very nice too. Overall the room was clean and suited our needs very well. The air conditioning worked great! The staff was helpful and and spoke reasonable English. This hotel is not a conventional hotel. It is in an apartment building. If you are looking to be close to the Termini, this is a good place.You can easily hop onto a train or bus or subway. If you want to be where the action is with a more lively setting you should try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “All the thumps up!”
Reviews.Author: miyu_princess
Reviews.Content: I was staying with 2 friends in Domus Praetoria triple room for four nights June 2008 and just like everyone else, we absolutely adored this hotel. The room was very clean, spacious and pretty. The service was friendly and we felt warmly welcome all the time. I would definitely stay here again and recommed this hotel to anyone. Great place indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much.”
Reviews.Author: jkpeters
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in an immaculate spacious room with a large bathroom. The proximity to the train station was great. The continental breakfast was ample and the cappuccino was delicious. The two brothers who own the hotel were very helpful and friendly. The service was wonderful. Examples of the attention we received during our stay included the immediate attention to our request to repair our slow shower drain and the help we received the morning we departed. We needed a cab at 4:45 a.m. and one of the owners, Massimo, not only reserved the cab for us but came out to help us with our luggage and spoke to the cab driver giving him instructions since we don't speak any Italian. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an economical place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ScoutNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stayed at the Hotel Domus Praetoria for 4 nights last month. After traveling from Rome to Florence and Venice and back, we had planned to spend our last night in Rome at a hotel near the airport, but liked the Domus Praetoria so much that we decided to change our plans and book an extra night there and take the train from Rome to the airport in the morning instead. The staff is warm, friendly, and very accommodating. The rates were extremely reasonable.There is a small breakfast area/bar beyond the lobby with good croissants and cappuccino. The room which had A/C, TV, and a safe, was clean, quiet, and more than comfortable for 3. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Rome train station from which one can get a train, a taxi, or the subway. It's also within easy walking distance of a lot of sights. Some people had told us that the area behind the train station was "seedy". It wasn't the Via Veneto, but we never felt unsafe, even late at night. And there are some good neighborhood restaurants in the area. We could not have been happier with the hotel and the staff and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: PopsUpNorth
Reviews.Content: Reading through the many hotel reviews will take you hours but it's well worth it when you come across a good one like the Hotel Domus Praetoria in central Rome. The hotel is no more than 5 minutes walk from the Termini down Via Milazzo and it's the last building on your left, there is no hotel sign just a bell system next to very large doors. We were greeted in English by one of the brothers making us feel most welcome. From the reviews we requested room 301 and this was allocated to us and was kept spotlessly clean for our 7 day stay. Breakfast was in a small but cosy room off reception, fruit juice, coffee, tea, bread rolls and pastries were just the thing to start your day. Our room overlooked the steet and a small market is in full swing from around 0730 daily ex Sun. Buy your fruit, meat and bread here before you go sight seeing as it is much cheaper than the tourist areas. Noise from the market can be a slight problem but as you are in Rome an early start is recommended if you want to fit in all those fantastic tourist sites. Local restaurants are popular and serve very good food and are not as expensive as the more popular sit and watch places. Transport around Rome was by bus and metro at a cost of 16 euros each for a week travel. All tourist places can be reached from the Termini and a bus map is definitely a must have. As we have thrown our coins in the Trevi fountain we will return again and without hesitation use the Domus Praetoria again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, democratic prices”
Reviews.Author: MetropolitanBelgium
Reviews.Content: Traveling alone is an open invitation to bad service, as you will be ignored most of the time, even more so in a city like Rome. Accomodation is Rome is very expensive, and affordable accomodation is often dodgy. Not so for Domus Praetoria. The hotel is very conveniently located at Termini station. Upon your first visit, you might find it a rough area, but it's safe. The hotel is not very clearly indicated, it's at the end of the street. The hotel is set in a great building with a lovely vintage elevator. The room I got was big, clean and comfortable. The ensuite bathroom was likewise, clean and modern. The room was maintained perfectly day in day out during my whole stay. Very remarkable is the absolutely great service and hospitality from the staff. Friendly, warm people that help you with just anything, quite a contrast to some other venues in Rome, but therefore exactly so pleasing. Downsides? Maybe the fact that you could hear people run around on the floor above you. Apart from that, I can only recommend this hotel if you want an affordable place to stay in Rome and still feel safe and very welcome. Great!

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Domus Praetoria for two nights in May. We chose it for its proximity to Termini train station and its TripAdvisor rating. At Fiumicino Airport it was easy for us take the lift to the top floor at Terminal C to wheel one suitcase each to the train station and take the Leonardo Express to Termini. We walked to the right side of Termini station and easily found Via Milazzo. But you really have to look for no. 42 Via Milazzo and not for the hotel sign, which is just one of three plaques (see photo) by the door of 42 Via Milazzo where there often are street bazaars in front of the hotel (we bought some small items). The hotel is family-owned, and it displays pride, care, and personal attention. We were upgraded to room 210 looking out on into an apartment courtyard. The relatively large room had a TV, refrigerator, hardwood floors, and an air conditioner which wasn't needed in 72 degree weather. The shower stall was big enough for two people, and the bathroom was quite spacious. We tried to use the wireless Internet in the lobby, but there seemed to be a protocol problem with both of our laptops, so we walked to one of the nearby Internet cafes and used the Internet for an hour for 1 Euro. There are at least three Internet kiosks within a block of the hotel. There are only 15 rooms in the hotel, so the breakfast room by the lobby holds just 5 small tables. The breakfast included coffees, yoghurt, rolls, pastries, with orange juice and a bottled pear or peach nectar. Everyone on duty spoke very good English, all were helpful, and about half of the guests appeared to be Americans. When we checked out, one of the staff, Massimo, asked how we liked our stay, and we said we were impressed at how everyone tried to please us and make us comfortable. He replied, "We enjoy this business." We enjoyed the stay, and we expect to return to the Domus Praetoria the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: FranK O'Phile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at this hotel for our one week stay in Rome based on the many positive reviews posted on Trip Advisor. Our stay was very consistent with what many others have said: friendly staff, good location vis-a-vis proximity to Termini, clean, good sized rooms, etc. But the reason that I am posting my review is because of the way that the hotel helped me handle an unfortunate incident. On the third day of our seven day stay, my cell phone was stolen while we were out site seeing. I immediately returned to the hotel and asked one of the brothers who was on the front desk at the time for help in reporting the loss to my U.S. phone provider. He could have shrugged his shoulders and dismissed me, but he didn't. He immediately went on the web to get the telephone number of the provider. He then pulled out his personal cell phone, dialed the U.S. number for me, and then handed the phone to me so that I could report the loss. He then let me use the hotel's computer to notify my relatives and business associates that they could no longer contact me by cell phone. When I asked him to add the charges to my hotel bill, he smiled and said that it was his great pleasure to be of help, and that there would be no charge. Now THAT'S customer service, and why I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Still Good but needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: FaCHSIA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Praetoria for 1 night in early April and then for 3 nights at the end of the month. We have previously visited this hotel in April 2006 and whilst it is still great value some area's need to be addressed. The room on the first visit was small and did not have a view except out into the back of the hotel which was not great. On the second visit we were given a larger room with a view to the offices across the courtyard. There had been some painting done in our room but unfortunately the wooden floor had patches of blue paint that was obviously spilt by the painters and not cleaned up. The towels were very thin and fraying at the ends and there was also mould in the bath/shower area that could have easily been removed with a good clean. These were the only 2 issues we had with the hotel. The management and staff are extremely helpful and whilst the area is not the greatest it is not threatening. We asked for any recommentdations from the management on where to eat and both suggestions were very good and close to the hotel (Meid in Naples was just around the corner). The breakfast provided did not have the full array that some other hotels offer. Overall the hotel is still good value for money and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: catherineFL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The brothers, Fabio and Massimo, that run this hotel were so accomodating. The room was great. It was very big compared to European standards. Our room was facing the main street, where there is a market on the weekends. I would stay here again in an instant. Rome, in general, was great. With the hotel so close to the Termini, it was very easy to get everywhere. We had a wonderful dinner at Historia Costanza (Fabio recommended it). Walk the city. It is the only way to see it. Everytime we turned a corner there was another amazing site. Go to the Trevi Fountain at night. It is much more memorable and magical. I cannot wait for my chance to see it all again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near train station”
Reviews.Author: Cinquecento
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Praetoria for one night. The room and bathroom were quite large and very clean. The bathroom looks to have been modernized recently. The check-in was smooth, even though it was almost 0100. The breakfast was nice. Continental breakfast in the hotel's new breakfast room. Juice, cereal, rolls, yogurt and cappuccino.
