Very close to Termini and very easy walk, even with luggage. Good value for the price. We would stay here again. When you go in the front door, need to go to the right side to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: maxx3000
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Domus Hotel on our first trip to Rome-the location was excellent...far enough away from the train station but still convenient. The staff were very friendly, helpful and willing to assist with any inquiries. Our room was spacious and bed was a great size. I would stay at this hotel again for the reasonable value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Hutches
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Perfect for exploring Rome. Easy to get from airport to Termini and five minute walk from there to hotel. Termini is hub for bus/metro connections to anywhere in Rome. Surrounded by countless eating and drinking places. ROOMS: We stayed in room 301. Very large, very clean, large bathroom with double sized shower. Towels changed, bed made up and room cleaned every day. SERVICES: Continental breakfast now served in lobby behind reception. STAFF: Family run business, everyone helpful and friendly. Excellent English spoken. ROME: History fest. Expensive eating and drinking. City and hotel highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LaRoyaute
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Domus Praetoria, having seen the good reviews on Trip Advisor, and were not disappointed. We arrived on the Terravision bus from Ciampino airport, which dropped us at Termini station, a few minutes walk from the hotel. We found the area perfectly safe at all times, and there were always people around. There are shops, cafes, cash machines etc at the station. The location is very convenient for the metro, buses and trains. We bought one-day Travelcards which are valid on the metro or bus and cost 4 euros. It was only 2 stops to the Colisseum. Our room was large, very quiet, and comfortable. It was on the 3rd floor but there is a lift. Breakfast was served in a room next to reception, and was a normal continental breakfast with rolls, pastries, yoghurts, fruit and choice of drinks. The security at the hotel is excellent, and the desk is manned 24 hours by two brothers who speak perfect english and are friendly and charming. All in all a very pleasant hotel in a great location, and at reasonable prices for rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week in Rome at the Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: TheBrownTrout
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Domus Praetoria for a week in late Jan 08 whilst on holiday in Rome. We booked through Venere.com having found the hotel through trip advisor and having been impressed with the reviews. We had a great week and the hotel was an excellent base for sightseeing and shopping in Rome. The area to the east of the station feels a bit seedy but is safe and there is a good selection of small family-run tratoria in which to eat very well and at reasonably low cost. There is a small Spa supermarket at the station for necessities and a variety of cake/coffee shops around. Proximity to Termini Station, the metro and the bus terminal is good news (less than a 5 min walk) for sightseeing and when getting off the Leonardo Express from the main airport. The hotel itself consists of a few groups of rooms within a fairly anonymous Rome apartment block as well as reception and the breakfast room on the ground floor. There is no big sign outside the hotel and you need to be sure of where to go when you arrive - but it's easy to find. It sounds a bit quirky but the rooms are decorated and maintained to a very high standard and comfortable; it is one of the cleanest hotels that I have stayed in. We experienced some noise from the floor above but nothing excessive and despite having the window open most nights, we were not really disturbed by traffic or the market in the street outside. Breakfast was provided in a room behind reception and consisted of bread/yoghurt/croissant/OJ/good coffee. Rooms have a minibar with room for your own stuff and there is a TV but we didn't see anything vaguely English on the single occasion that we switched it on. The thing that makes this hotel stand out is the standard of service provided by the brothers who run it. They speak fluent English and proved to be extremely helpful in just about every way possible. Reception is open 24 hrs a day and there is good security within the hotel. I would certainly recommend this for either business or holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel, near station”
Reviews.Author: Martin_from_Duffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 24/9/07 for one night. Paid 140 Euro prpn B&B. Booked through Venere. This was a quick one night stay, while travelling from Naples to fly home from Rome; we did not go into the city at all. It is located about five minutes from the main railway station; it is a lively tourist area with plenty of restaurants and despite many comments elsewhere seemed pleasant and not a typical station area. The room was spacious (although this was the largest one), very clean and attractive and characterful, good air conditioning, attractive wooden floor. Good bathroom. Owners were very pleasant and helpful. The owner suggest Al 39 Restaurant, which turned out to be a good recommendation. Breakfast is included, but is taken in a cafe across the street, you get a voucher from hotel reception. You just get a coffee and a pastry, so not much, but fine for us as we off to the airport. This was the most expensive hotel in our four week trip, but given hotel prices generally in Rome and the comments on Tripadvisor for many cheaper ones, we would definitely recommend here, especially if you need to be near the station. Reception will sell you tickets for the Terravision bus to Ciampino airport, just a few minutes walk from the hotel, but note that you still need to then go to the bus office to reserve for a specific bus. The bus was 20 minutes late and rather chaotic, but it is convenient and quick.

Reviews.Title: “A dream of a place”
Reviews.Author: exbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: If only I had know of this hotel when I travelled to Rome on business! All the enthusiastic comments are fully justified. A lovely large twin room, our son upgraded from a single to a double, an adequate breakfast in the new mini breakfast room, a very quite room at the rear, extremely comfortable beds and charming hosts. Plenty of local places to eat (remember you get what you pay for though) and no concerns about safety at night. Minor faults were cold coffee from a thermos at breakfast (ask fora fresh cappucinno) and a warm rather than hot shower - but considering all else these are trivial.

Reviews.Title: “Four days in Rome before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: CastroValley1
Reviews.Content: Our group of ten were lucky enough to be able to stay together at this small hotel prior to our 9 day cruise from Rome to Barcelona. Since it was our first trip to Italy, I did a lot of research and based on the ratings, price, and location, reserved this hotel. Our group was separated due to plane schedules so we arrived at different times of the day. The earlier group had to get dropped off a block or so away because there is a daily morning market blocking the street in front of the hotel. Our flight was delayed and we arrived in the afternoon and were dropped off in front. Mossimo greeted us and assigned us our rooms. The rooms aren't uniform so it was interesting comparing room configurations. The location was ideal for exploration. The area when we were there, Nov 19-24 seem safe day and night. The Termini Stazioni is about 2 blocks away and like any busy public terminal has lots of activity and with it all kinds of people including homeless. We walked day and night and bumped one night into the premier of Fred Claus but missed Vince Vaughn . We could have waited 45 minutes to see him come out.... didn't want to be American stalkers. There's a breakfast room now. It's small but quite adequate. You can sit down at small bistro tables and have great rolls, cereal, cappucino. The brothers who run the hotel are great and friendly and speak English well. I think it's a very good competent hotel that is a good value for the weak dollar. The location is ideal and we had a wonderful time in Rome knowing we had a friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: My honey and I were guests at the Hotel Domus Praetoria in Rome for three nights from November 21 – 24, 2007. The 5 star reviews in Trip Advisor on this hotel are accurate. The best part of our stay in the hotel was the superior attention to customer service from the owners and operators of the hotel, the Menichelli brothers. The hotel even picked-up our Trenitalia train tickets from the main station and mailed them to us in the USA and then answer every tourist question we threw at them in Rome. Our room #210 was oversized, even by US standards. We enjoyed wood floors, high ceilings, a granite tile bathroom, an excellent king size bed, and lots of storage space. Breakfast each morning included fresh fruit, Italian pastries, yogurt, juice, and their new espresso machine worked perfectly. The hotel is a quick five-minute walk from the main train station in Rome and is located in a larger condo complex. The map provided on the hotels web site allowed us to walk straight to the complex’s door to ring the bell to find the lobby of the hotel. If you are looking for a hotel with a large lobby and a pool I would suggest another hotel at more than twice the price. However, I wonder if the service will be better? The hotel rates were fair, the service and room were superior, and the location was convenient to the train station, and neighborhood was safe. I also enjoyed the market that was on the street right in front of the hotel. Another bonus was the convenience of boarding the express train that went directly to the airport from the main train station only 5 minutes from the hotel. Overall we highly recommend the Hotel Domus Praetoria in Rome and would stay with the Menichelli brothers when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value In a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: GordoBoston
Reviews.Content: This place was exactly as advertised. Not fancy but but a nice, clean, quiet, comfortable hotel in a very convenient location. The staff was EXCELLENT. Very friendly and accommodating. The neighborhood of this hotel is not high rent but it's not skid row either and not the least bit menacing as some reviews here have suggested. We came and went from our hotel at all hours and did not see anything that gave us concern in the neighborhood. The hotel is a very convenient 2 blocks to the Termini Station which is the central hub for all trains, subways and buses in and around Rome, although central Rome is pretty compact and with a good pair of sneakers you can get almost anywhere within 15 or 20 minutes walk. Another really nice thing about this hotel is that although Rome is a very loud and bustling place with lots of traffic, this hotel was QUIET. We had a courtyard room not facing the street so this could be part of the reason but the street outside is not busy. Some people rating this hotel complained about the lack of breakfast. If you want breakfast, don't come to Rome (or Italy for that matter). The complimentary "breakfast" at the bar across the street is in and of itself a quintessentially Roman experience with locals stopping in on the way to work and sharing the day's stories. No panoramic views, room service, plush king size beds, feather pillows or fluffy towels here, just clean, comfortable rooms in a boutique hotel in a neighborhood with character and with a very nice, accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “look no further”
Reviews.Author: davidvictorpdx
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Italy, 6 nights at this hotel. The room was the biggest, cleanest and nicest one we stayed at. It was conveniently located near the train station and subway which was easy to use to get to all the big attractions in Rome. There was a great little street market out front each morning and we loved staying where the locals hang out. The brothers Mossimo, Antonio and Fabio at the front desk were great! They were extremely helpful and friendly. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel and would hesitate not to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel - friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: Fiona1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves all the glowing reviews on this site. The location - next to Termini underground/station- is perfect for getting everywhere quickly and the area feels safe and not seedy at all. Its well lit and so easily reached. The rooms are big, clean, well decorated, the bed is massive and the bathroom was big, clean and attractive. Its quiet and peaceful. The main point about this hotel is the italian brothers who run it. They are so welcoming and friendly nothing is too much trouble. I think they'd give you the shirts off their backs if they thought it would please you! It was always nice to come back to them after sightseeing in Rome. We stayed for 5 nights - asa couple from London in our 20s and this was perfect as a base for exploring ROme. I have never written a trip advisor review before but the service we received meant I wanted to thank the owners. Breakfast is at a cafe opposite- a selection of pastries and coffees- fine for us. Good value- highly recommended. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: slowcoach
Reviews.Content: All the positive comments about this hotel are true. I just wanted to add that if you take the Terravision Bus from Ciampino Airport into Rome it's drop off point is just 150m from the hotel - an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “King Size bed in ROME”
Reviews.Author: osubarry
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Terrivsion bus from the airport(CIA) and were basically dropped off at the hotel. It was a 3 minute walk from the Termini Station. My 1st impression was not good as it was late when we checked in and the street is dark and not populated, but when we woke up in the morning and stepped on the street it was a different world. There was a little market set up right outside the door with locals buying everything. The location we liked because it wasn't by all the touristy spots, but close to the Metro(inside Termini). All the guys at the front desk were polite and helpful. They gave us a map which we saw several tourists using throughout Rome and circled sites which they would recommend. The train for the main airport was located at Termini so no problems the day we left. 3 minute walk and we were on board. The Room was huge. Like my headline we had a King size bed. A little hard for my taste, but not bad. Plenty of room to hang clothes up on both sides of the bed. A nice little fridge for soft drinks or beer. The bathroom was good size and well lit. The room did have a TV, but don't expect any English stations. You didn't come to Rome to watch the TV did you!?!?!? Overall a great place to lay your head during your stay in Rome. They also have a laptop in the lobby so you can use the internet if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable for the price, but not that good”
Reviews.Author: Thefall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (20-22/10). When carefully choosing the hotel in Rome (as Rome was the main goal of the journey) I've read lots and lots of surveys about different hotels. Domus Praetoria was #33 out of a thousand Rome hotels - this had convinced me, finally. And this is the first time, when my choise (based on what other TripAdvisor members said about this hotel) have totally failed. (I've had great expectations, sadly). 1) First of all, this is NOT a good location. I can't understand those who mentioned location as "great". Yes, it's close to Roma Termini train station, but there are lots of hotels as close as this. And if you need a hotel which is close to the station (or airport, whatever) - yes, it's alright. But the area itself is grey and totally uncharming (compare to the streets around Borghese Gardens!). Every morning you can witness some local market right on the streets with lots of chinese, vietnamese and northafrican people selling their stuff&food. There are also - yes, - some local restaurants, but still I disagree to consider them as good. They are cheap, but lack atmosphere and service is above average. So the only positive thing here is that you can easily walk to hotel from the station and save a few euro on taxi. That's good, but not enough. 2) The property itself disappointed me too. The hotel even has no outdoor sign, so we could hardly find it (it looks just like an ordinary house, not a hotel). The rooms are of a good size, but why on earth did they paint the walls blue? Reminds me of a ward, really. But that's no problem, after all. The only (and the main) problem was with cold. I mean the room - it was really cold inside. Radiators were cold as ice and didn't even seem to have worked ever. Aircon was only blowing the cold air, so every morning we woke up either in a cold, or in a stuffy room. Remember we talk about the end of October - it was +8 at nights! So the morning shower was a torture, not a pleasure. Then the view...well, I'm not kin on it, but the inner yard was not only dark and gloomy - it was noisy, thanks to our Italian neighbours. (Yes, there was also a problem with the card which opens the door - and it was NOT solved until the check-out. But it didn't upset me at all). 3) And, in the end, this breakfast in cafe on the other side of the road. I don't wanna put on a coat every morning to go and have a cup of coffee with a small croissant! Even in small pansions where we stayed on our way to Rome, there was a room (big or small, beautiful or not - it really doesn't matter) where they served breakfast. Here you have to go outside. To be honest, there are also positive moments. The staff was willing to help - that's nice. The size of the rooms and the furniture were good - and that's nice too. Well, the price was not that high (for a Rome hotel). Sadly, that's all; and I advice you to think twice before you made your choice. It's not that bad, but a #33? No way.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay at Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: YasmineinSydney
Reviews.Content: I stay at DP for 4 nights from 28 Sep to 2 Oct 2007 as a single lady traveller and I really enjoyed it. It was only approx 150m walk from Rome Termini and I felt very safe walking around the area right up to 11 or 12 at night. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes around the area and I did not perceive it to be "seedy" at all! There were 4 or 5 "wino's" (drunks) who seemed to live just outside the Termini - I saw them every night, but they were of no threat to my safety! The 3 Menichelli brothers who ran the hotel were the most gracious, patient and kind gentlemen - they helped with tourist information and were very welcoming. Personally, I thought the location of the hotel was fantastic - you could get anywhere you wanted from Via Milazzo - you have the train, the Metro and a bus station with at least 20 different routes, including all the "Hop On Hop Off" buses just outside the Termini. I have never seen that many buses in one terminal! There were even Hop on Hop Off open top buses that specialised in all the relevant Christian sites. Amazing! Being a tourist is very easy in Rome (provided you have the patience to wait with the other 20,000 tourists!) The Praetoria was excellent, clean, safe, spacious accommodation for very reasonable $$. I paid approx EUR82 per night for a single and it was like a 3 or 4 star hotel. The furnishings and bathroom were all fresh and new. There was a minibar, TV, lift, and hairdryer (albeit it was the wall mounted kind with a hose like a vacuum cleaner - a bit difficult to handle if you have long thick hair to style but OK). The breakfast is just a pastry and a coffee across the road at Robertos Cafe - but in saying that, Roberto's makes their own pastries and it was the best custard filled brioche I have ever eaten and still warm out of the oven. The coffees were fab and if you wanted another one, it was like 70 cents. The market in Via Milazzo each morning catered more to local residents than tourists, with fruit, veg, laundry and household items, underwear etc. but you could get some great silk ties for EUR5 each. There are some good imitation designer bags too. All good fun and I would definitely stay again. Rome is one of the worlds most expensive cities and to stay in such lovely accomms for EUR82 a night is almost unheard of - in fact several travel agents laughed at me and said impossible! Well, its not and here it is!!

Reviews.Title: “Fractured holiday”
Reviews.Author: DCN
Reviews.Content: I am not willing to comment fully on our DP experience yet, (please ignore the rating which I was forced to give***) especially as it is all we saw of Rome. I am the guest who could not be moved from Rm210 & who forced the management to displace the pre-booked Finnish guests. I had a fractured spine & had to wait from Mon [morning 1 of our holiday] to Sat to be medi-vac'd out (2 planes, 5 ambulances) - neither they nor I had much choice. I have to say that ASIDE of the nightmare of my accident (in their bathroom) I cannot understand paranoid guests who write frightful reviews that make potential guests, some already with bookings, panic. The last few reviews indicate one or two 'weaknesses' - sadly I couldn't stand to have my breakfast & it was brought to my room each day - but I suspect by morning 4 we too would have ached to sit (tho' the Adriatic B&B we were supposed to move to had this, & we like variety). I would have been most unimpressed by a broken bathroom door & a non-functioning safe BUT they are mendable & don't ruin a holiday. Enough said. The hotel is of a certain style - converting part of a Roman apartment block, on part of 2 floors. There is no communal area. It bears NO resemblance to any 'hostel' and has excellent air con & good beds, which were sadly too well used by us. The inner courtyards are sporadically noisy, because sound carries & echoes in certain ways, & Italians don't know how to speak quietly, nor their dogs to bark quietly, & the person above me did seem to be aiming to walk more kilometres each evening, while moving furniture about, on the wooden floor. However, I am a problem sleeper & none of this would have caused real trouble. The double-glazing, & especially the shutters, are among the best I've seen in Italy. The area around the hotel welcomed my husband/carer with open arms (it is easier for a man) as he travelled from pharmacy to bar to restaurant, on his rare forays out from our joint confinement. Everyone asked after me, all Romans were anxious that we should return (God - who knows!?) and the food he ate was good and reasonably priced. Two more comments as I lie on the floor at home, in a body brace 1.DON'T HAVE AN ACCIDENT IN ROME - the hospital experience was like Dante's Inferno - not hot just hellish & totally lacking in compassion 2.DON'T STINT ON YOUR TRAVEL INSURANCE though we have much paperwork hanging over us - they got us home, door to door, with me totally immobile. I have written personally to the displaced Fin. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Not very reliable”
Reviews.Author: Mika7275
Reviews.Content: We had done a reservation to Hotel Domus Preatoria 3 month before arrival. But when we came to the hotel they said that they have a problem with a guest staying at the hotel. A woman has hurted herself and can not move from the bed. The guest could not leave and wanted to remain. They told us that the hotel is fully booked and they can not accommodate us. Not very good experience of the hotel which is very popular on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Wonkybird
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. The hotel is close to the station- perfect if you arrive by bus from the Campino airport- but very quiet. The rooms were very clean and you felt secure. Unfortunately the door on our bathroom was broken and the aircon and safe didn't work but that didn't matter too much. Our deal included breakfast- this involved popping across the road to a locals cafe for a cappucino [the best in the city we thought] and a croissant. This was a novelty on the first morning but by day 4 I really wanted to sit down [ no seats in cafe] and have a proper breakfast! All in all though a fab hotel with excellent staff and I suspect pretty reasonably priced for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near train terminal”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneBelleville_IL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short stay in Rome and through Venere.com booked a moderately priced hotel near the train terminal in Rome. We were warned this might not be the best area of Rome, but we found it to be quite safe. The hotel was immaculate, as was our room. The king-size bed was comfortable and there was plenty of hot water. Yes, the street noise filtered up to us a bit when the window was open, but shut, it was quiet. A market opens early each morning (except Sunday), so you'll likely hear that, but we found it to be part of the appeal of being in Rome. "Breakfast" came with the room, which we enjoyed. It's a European breakfast of fresh pastry and coffee or juice that you pick up at the coffee bar across the street. Pastries were great and you got your choice from many varieties. The desk staff was very helpful and spoke excellent English. They provided maps and advice. We chose this location in Rome because we didn't want to hire a car or rent one. The hotel is two blocks from the terminal and we could hop on the Metra system and be anywhere in minutes. Our room for two was about 200 euros, but when we checked out, it was less. We think the staff gave us a discount because we met some Americans the first night we were there and told them about Hotel Domus. They booked two rooms that same night . Overall, a good place to stay, especially after the sticker shock of seeing just how expensive a hotel room in Rome can be. I'd also recommend checking out Venere.com; they offer hotel rooms all over Italy, and they don't charge your credit card or put a hold on your account if you book with them. They also have a good cancellation policy. We booked for Sept. 30 and could have backed out as late at Sept. 26.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DawnYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel Domus Praetoria is a couple of minutes walk from Temini, Rome's main train and metro station. Handy for those like us, who turn up in Rome without having thought about transfers. We caught a train from the airport which took about 40 minutes, then walked a couple of blocks to the hotel. On arrival the staff were great. Very friendly, English speaking, and gave us the run down on where to visit in Rome. We were pleasantly surprised when we saw the room. It was clean, well presented and with air con. The street where the hotel is situated is quite busy and has a market every morning, however the room was really quiet with no traffic noise, which has been a problem for us in the past when staying in a city centre. The area felt safe. There are a couple of restaurants and bars, which serve good traditional food. Breakfast is at a local cafe which we enjoyed, however there isn't anywhere in the hotel where you can sit and have a drink or some food, which is the only negative, however we didn't mind too much and enjoyed the local cafes and restaurants. All in all I think we where really lucky to find such a great hotel, within walking distance of major transport (rail, metro and buses). It is friendly, comfortable, clean and felt safe. I would recommend this hotel, and would stop there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb find”
Reviews.Author: EssexUKguy
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel is unbeatable; the rooms are spacious, airy and clean with working aircon. We stayed in 307 which overlooked a courtyard and was incredibly quiet. The brothers are always on hand and although the hotel is accessed by a buzzer entry system, we never had to wait. Some previous reviews question the location. Not once, even at night, did my wife and I feel unsafe. There are some excellent restaurants within a few minutes walk and the fact that you are near the station means that you can get anywhere in the city pretty quickly. We would recommend the 2 hour bus trips that run from outside the station to get your bearings but we walked from the Domus to the Colosseum in about 30 mins. In fact, if you enjoy walking, both The Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain are a similar distance away. Great value - we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ReaderToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Domus Praetoria one night and would recommend to anyone. The room is generous by European standards and the bathroom is clean and attractive. Air conditioning, phone and TV all in good working order. I had read that the area around Rome termini station was noisy, but this wasn't the case last Saturday night. The hotel gives a coupon for breakfast at a coffee shop across the street, which serves an excellent capuccino and you pick your pastry. Staff friendly and helpful; no problem checking in and they carried my bag to my room. Would defintiely revisit since it's just a few minutes walk from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FaCSIA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and then had a 2 day tour to the Amalfi coast and left our bags for the return visit. This is a great hotel, friendly staff and clean spacious rooms. We arrived early from a flight from Bangkok and checked in prior to the normal time but were greeted with a warm friendly greeting and given a voucher for the cafe across the road which was fantastic. The rooms were spacious, clean , well maintained and very quiet. There were numerous local restaurants of a good standard. We would definitely stay here on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: LunaDew
Reviews.Content: We had such a great experience at this hotel. We just came back from Italy yesterday and Domus Praetoria was a good experience. It was really easy to find. like 3 blocks away from the train station and we never felt threatened at any time, it is also within walking distance from the Colisseum and other sites but the Vatican which is far from everything else. The three brothers that own the place are realy helpful and polite. The rooms were spotless, big and nice bathrooms, quiet and nicely decorated. The breakfast in the morning at "Robertos" really gives you a feeling of the local italian atmosphere, the people there are really friendly and we really loved it. We were reading some of the bad reviews and some of the complaints are that you do not have a big variety of TV channels or that it is boring. We basically went to Italy to be around the city not to stay in the room watching TV or to have parties at the hotel but if you are looking for a quiet, charming, super clean hotel with great customer service, this is a perfect fit! Todd and Nancy Dewey

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2_Zotten_en_Co
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Domus Praetoria in september 2007. We based our choice of the hotel on the reviews from Tripadvisor. We were more than satisfied with the service and quality of the hotel. The hotel staff is very helpful and speaks excellent English. They are always ready to answer questions you might have about the hotel or Rome. They recommended the Grotta Azurro restaurant, just behind the corner. Once the German schoolgroup left the restaurant, is was very OK. It is central, with the Termini bus station and metro intersection connecting you to many sights in town. You can even walk all over Rome using the hotel as a base. Rome is a walking city anyway. In the Termini area it’s easy to find a good local cheap eaterie or a bar were you can end your day with a grappa or sambucca. We felt safe, even in the late evening. The rooms are very clean and tidy with a comfortably firm bed. Rooms are dark and quiet, because of the shutters wich makes an excellent shelter from the light and from the noise of the cat in the patio. We had one room with a marble floor and one room with a wooden floor. The air condition unit works efficiently and is remote controlled. The bathroom is very clean and spatious. The water pression is rather low. Every morning, there is a nice little street market right in front of the hotel, with no tourists thus very reasonable prices. Breakfast is taken at the popular and bustling cafe Roberto across the street. Very nice to be amongst romans. The breakfast voucher gives right to one pastry of your choise and a cappucino. There are no chairs or tables in the cafe. You can buy more pastries or drinks if you want to. The hotel is a hidden gem. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: lisaI07
Reviews.Content: we booked this last minute and were after a cheap fairly central hotel We found this hotel ideally situated for all attractions. The rooms were well decorated and clean. The hotel staff were lovely spoke brilliant english and were more than helpful. We would recommend this hotel for a budget weekend in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnM59
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Domus Praetoria. The room and bathroom were spotless. Breakfast in the snack bar across the road was a little different but the opportunity to mix with the locals and take in the atmosphere was very enjoyable. The hotel is in an area a couple of blocks from Termini station. There are some undesirable elements close to the train station but the road the hotel was on was fine. We stopped at the local bar a few shops up from the hotel a couple of nights for a night cap and found the locals very friendly . The hotel is 10 or 15 min bus or metro ride away from the sites. We used these during the days and in the evenings but got taxis back late at night which were very reasonable ( €10) I'd have no problem recommending the Domus Praetoria if you want an inexpensive , very clean & very comfortable room in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Don't believe some of these "fake" reviews!”
Reviews.Author: BKFWaldman
Reviews.Content: *** With all due respect, DO NOT believe the "excellent" review on this page! It is a set-up! Look through all the reviews .. you will see they are very similar and it is obvious the owners of this hotel posted most of the reviews. First off, this hotel is in a terrible location. If you are a tourist and want to see any of the Rome sights, this hotel is in the wrong place. About an hour walking distance from the Vatican .. everything else is 30 minutes away. The hotel is in a very shady and scary location, which is why a guest basically has to enter THREE security doors just to get to his/her room. I did not feel safe walking in this area at night, and I am an avid traveler. Second, the rooms are monastery-like. Quiet, boring, segregated. There is a TV but it only shows Italian cartoons and infomercials. NO CNN, BBC, etc. With no TV and the boring room, it felt like you were in prison. The rooms are clean, however, but our toilet started leaking, and the bathroom tiles were dirty. Third, we traveled all over Italy in hotels where breakfast is included. The hotels we stayed at were similar in price to this hotel. This hotel gives you a "voucher" for a cafe across the street and gives you no direction to how to use the voucher. The cafe has very little options. In the other Italian hotels we stayed at, breakfast was served on a patio or inside the actual hotel. The breakfasts were always continental - fruit, cereal, coffee, tea, etc. A HUGE disappointment. Fourth, this hotel basically ruined our trip because we felt so ripped-off. We read these reviews on Trip Advisor and trusted the "visitors" who wrote about this hotel. It is obvious after reading them, that they were written by the hotel administration itself, most referring to the "3 brothers" who run the hotel, and whom, we had never met. We felt like we were scammed by these reviews and want to make sure no other traveler falls for it again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 3 Brothers”
Reviews.Author: francescaandgio
Reviews.Content: [--] Absolutely LOVED the 3 brothers - we cannot say enough about how helpful, courteous and friendly they all were, actually everyone working at the Domus was friendly and helpful. This hotel was rated # 1 by TripAdvisor and rightfully so. It was everything we had read about. The hotel is located near the train station, in a quaint part of Rome. It was spotlessly clean, king size bed and quite comfortable. One of the brothers (I’m sorry, I cannot remember his name, but it doesn’t matter because all 3 were wonderful) anyway, he was so helpful, he suggested great restaurants, where to buy our train and bus tickets, whether to take the subway or bus depending on where we were going - made getting around Rome quite easy and our stay a lot more relaxing. There were 6 of us traveling together, we spent 3 days at the Domus before heading off on a Carnival cruise. The night before we left, we needed to arrange transportation for a short ride across Rome to a destination where the cruise line was picking us up. Well, no taxi service could accommodate 6 people with a lot of luggage and the ones we called did not want to be bothered with such a short fare, so we told “the brothers” about our problem and they worked endlessly into the night and the next morning they had 2 taxis waiting for us to depart. Will definitely return to the Domus.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: blueslover97
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews, went, and was not disappointed in any form. As said, it is not plush or overflowing with amenities. It is however, very clean, well run, not small rooms, convenient enough, helpful, and very friendly. I wager that at #14 out of 1148 Rome hotels on trip advisor that it is the absolute best value in the top 20. Contact them directly and they will give you as good or better rate than some of the booking services (and they get to make a few extra bucks). All the brothers are great English speakers. Tips- Metro at Stazione or try Castro Pretorio about as close if you want to avoid the crowds. There is free parking on the street in front of the hotel if needed. Website- [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great little property! A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Indianna01
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure where to stay in Rome for a couple of nights...as I had been there before I knew that if I wanted something half decent, I was going to have to pay the money, as Rome is expensive at the best of times. I was concerned as I am really fussy, and have to feel comfortable, otherwise I feel like my whole stay in a town can be ruined by bad accomodation.... After loads of research, I came across the the Hotel Domus Praetoria in Rome. It was reasonably priced, and that concerned me. So I did even more research, and trip advisor was just fantastic. I email the hotel, and the brothers who run the property were great! Very helpful!! The hotel is near the Roma Termini, and not really slam bang next to the sights..but it's not that far, and within easy walking distance. Obviously, as it is close to the Roma Termini, it's not in the prettiest part of Rome, but we never felt unsafe at all. We were two female travelling alone, we arrived into Rome in the early evening, and it was nearly dark...we walked to the hotel, and while it was a little hard to find the actual door into the apartment block where the Domus Praetoria resides, it didn't take us long. It is a door along the street, where you have to buzz the intercom, then they let you in into a hallway into the area. So be mindful, you are looking for a big wooden door- there really isn't alot of signage. But it's not hard to find. The room was big, and clean. We had a big window covered with lovely drapes, and the beds were comfortable. It was sparse, but had all the comforts required. The bathroom was really clean, and quite quaint with its cute tiles..it was also a good size...rare for Europe! The staff were really helpful and friendly. One of the brothers pointed un in the direction of a great restaurant around the corner, where we had the best food we had during our entire stay in Rome. Infact we went back there 3 or 4 times while we were there as no other place really compared...I wish I could remember the name to tell you all! Breakfast which was included was a vouchure which we took across the road of the hotel to the bakery where we had the best coffee in Italy and a really delicious pastry! It was simple, it was Roman, and it was fantastic! This hotel is not 5 star glitz and glamour, it's more like 3 star at 1 star prices- a little more than simple, clean, comfortable, and friendly. I recommend this property to anyone, and will stay there again next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Rooms, 4 Star Service at a 2 Star Price”
Reviews.Author: Middle-aged-man45
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. Don't look for curb appeal, but once you get in the hotel and to your room, you will think you are in a four star hotel. The hotel is situated among apartment homes in a condo building. So, the entrance looks very much like one would expect on entering a local residence. The location is very close to the main train terminal which makes the hotel accessible from any place in Rome at any time of the day. It is about a four-block walk from the station, and although not the most attractive of streets, we walked it at different times of the day and night and always felt safe. Breakfast is a coffee and sweet across the street at a local bar surrounded by locals. The folks who run the place could not have been more helpful. Our room was large, very clean, well air conditioned with a comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom. Unless you need to be among other more popular tourist spots in the city, I would highly recommend this hotel. Should my travels take me back to Rome in the future, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, prepare for a walk”
Reviews.Author: medmom2002
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the hotel--very nice and welcoming property with spacious rooms (and bathrooms,) clean and updated. It is about 10 minutes from Termini (and away from the center), so don't chose it if you want to be in the center of attractions. HOwever, very quiet, friendly and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “yes...but..just little things”
Reviews.Author: cherry0baby
Reviews.Content: yes it is a fair hotel for the price. no views from window but look at the price ! good points being room always cool even during 33C, due to marble floors, high ceilings and good air con that you operate yourself. quaint little lift, area ok, never felt threatened, staff not over friendly/informative but will offer opinions/advice if requested. no noise from street market. cafe where you eat breakfast was a little step back in time, with a friendly owner, great pastries (try the tiny little 2 bite cakes for 35 cents each - gorgeous!) nice to be amongst locals. nice little bar again with friendly staff, out of the hotel turn right 100 mtrs up the road. safe box provided free in the room. nice big bathroom with fab shower. tv - but only italian speaking stations - not a big deal as not in room much. lots of wardrobe space. shutters kept all light and noise out. there is a little breakfast room downstairs - you will see it if you ask them to hold on to your luggage for you on yr last day - dont know why they dont make use of it. handy location for termini although we walked to colleseum fairly easily we did use metro a lot (buy one day pass for all transport 4 euros). couple of ok restaurants nearby, but chinese wasnt so good. after having said all this it seems a bit churlish to give any negative thoughts..but.. reception told me they couldnt do anything about the recurring noise from the room above me as it didnt belong to them, then at the end of the trip told me it did and the noisy family had checked out. also didnt tell us we could use internet foc, only discovered 30 minutes before we were due to leave. our son had been paying at an internet cafe round the corner. also some rooms got free toiletries and some didnt. they also didnt know anything about the free genesis concert, which seems unbelievable. seemed a little like you had to know what questions to ask reception - they certainly didnt make it easy. never mind. bed a bit too hard for my liking and pillow a bit too flat - but sights we saw, and thats why we went, were breathtaking. apart from the pervert in the bushes of the villa borghese -in the middle of the afternoon. heat seems to do funny things to some people!! If you are planning to visit this hotel you will be fine it is ok really, just make sure they try and do something about noisy neighbours!- also not bad supermarket downstairs in the termini if you want to make a picnic for the park . I have stayed in the villa glori, which I preferred, but it was fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Best location you can get for the price”
Reviews.Author: travelingmusicians
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great, reasonably priced hotel that allows you to get anywhere quickly, the Hotel Domus Praetoria is for you. Literally only two blocks from the Roma Termini train station, you can get anywhere in the city easily. The location is not in the flashiest area, but it gives you a taste of Rome without the tourist attractions. The staff was great and the rooms were wonderful. Give this place strong consideration for your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the Domus”
Reviews.Author: rejsefeber
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Domus Praetoria in July 2007. I chose the hotel based on reviews and recommendations from Tripadvisor. Though the Domus is not the cheapest *** hotel in Rome, I was more than satisfied with the service and quality of the hotel. Great value. While making your way down Via Milazzo from Termini Station, you start to expect to have walked too far and right past the hotel. The reason is that the hotel doesn't have a sign besides a plaque on the wall and a note by the buzzer. But don't get fooled, there is a hotel here, and a very good one at that. Staff: The hotel staff is very helpful and speaks excellent English and will show you to your room and how to operate the elevator. They are always ready to answer questions you might have about the hotel or Rome. Rooms: The rooms are average too small size for European hotels. They are very clean and tidy with a comfortably firm bed. The best feature of the rooms is how dark and quiet they are. Double insulated windows with shutters makes an excellent shelter from the noise of the street. Actually, I was surprised to find that there was a street market right outside the window on the first morning. I had heard no sound of that before opening the window. The air condition unit works efficiently and is remote controlled. The wall has a built in safe deposit box. The breakfast: Non-existent besides a pastry and a cup of coffee from the locally popular cafe Roberto across the street. Note that the breakfast is standing - no chairs or tables. The staff at the place is very friendly. The location: The hotel is located a five minute walk from the east side of the Termini station. I had heard about reservations about this location prior to the visit, but I felt perfectly safe on the street during the day as well as during the night. The location of the hotel is very convenient as two subways intersect at Termini and can take you to many sights in town. Given the size of the city center, you can even walk all over Rome using the hotel as a base. Dining: I never dined around the hotel during the stay, so I cannot review the neighboring restaurants. Conclusion: A clean and convenient hotel that will guarantee you a good nights sleep every night. And trust me, you need it for all the walking you will be doing in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobmany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June 2007 and had an excellent experience. The hotel is modern,clean and has an excellent location near the Rome Termini (great for getting around, trains/busses, etc). One extra benefit, there is a neat market each morning just outside the hotel doors. We had a double and triple, both were very nice and worth the price. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We would stay in this hotel again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A little Treasure in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cheunggo
Reviews.Content: I heard of the scary hotels that Rome had to offer especially since I had not been there before. The room was very clean, spacious and air-conditioning was state-of-the-art (i.e. not just a box blowing out air). The rooms were well maintained. The price of this hotel was slightly more than other hotels around the termini area but it was worth every penny (as you will no doubt see when you do your searching). A continental breakfast is included (a coffee and a croissant) but one must go across the street to a local cafe with friendly locals to have it. Three brothers, Antonio, Fabio and Massimo, own this little treasure and are so nice. They also recommend great tratorias to eat nearby in the termini area avoiding 'menu fissos' that serve BAD food. To cut a long story short, this hotel is fantastic. The pictures on the website are 100% reliable and I was not disappointed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lazydavey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June 2007 and It was a pleasent experience. The hotel is modern,clean and has an excellent location. We had a superior double room which was very nice and worth the extra cost. The staff were friendly,helpful and knew a lot about Rome. We would stay in this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: marie943
Reviews.Content: This is not a boutique hotel. It is nice though. Its not small.Not huge. Pillows fine. No wait to be buzzed through door. Lovely cool spacious,high ceilinged rooms with nice quality feel about it,you wont be dissapointed. Had a room which faces the courtyard.Although we had a 3rd floor room,one night at 2.30am we were woken by female voice arguing then,others joining in.Not quite sure where the noise came from,but it carried.When booking maybe ask for a 3rd floor room that faces into the street.This MAY avoid the noise problem.Apart from this safe location,handy for Station and taxis but not too close.Disliked having to stand for breakfast-but understand they may be putting in their own breakfast area very soon.Have to say they accommodated us by allowing us to book in an hour early,and this may have accounted for the slightly bad selection of room (courtyard facing ) that we got.But top marks for trying to help us.Even when Rome was baking hot-91-the room stayed cool.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: sugarlandTexas
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to Rome, you must stay at this great botique hotel. It is located 5 minutes from the train station in a great location of the city. Close enough to all the attractions, but not with all the chaos. The hotel is run by brothers that are extremely friendly and accomadating. Great little restaraunts all around the hotel. I would highly recommend that you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Family loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: peggydill
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults/4children) stayed at this hotel for one night (June 8) at the end of a 2 week Italian vacation. We wanted to be in Rome for our last night. We were quite pleased with the hotel, service, and location. We rented 2 triples through Venere.com for 170 Euros/each room. We needed a hotel close to Termini for quick access to the train to the airport the next morning; it was a short 3-4 block walk. The bus station is on the other side of Termini for transportation throughout Rome. The rooms were incredibly CLEAN and up to date, with everything in working condition (tile floors, good water pressure, soft sheets, a hair dryer, an in-room refrigerator, a safe, soaps/shampoo, plenty of storage, and air-conditioning, which was great as it was beginning to get hot in Rome). We had rooms facing the street and it was very quiet compared to an apartment we had stayed in earlier on our trip. The staff was very nice and accommodating and seemed to take pride in the appearance of the rooms. The desk manager was there all evening and night and greeted us in the early morning on the day of our departure. He also spoke very good English.The building seemed very secure and had an elevator. Although we didn't partake of the breakfast offered and couldn't comment on that, there was a large produce market which was setting up early (7 AM) on the street outside the hotel on the morning we departed ,which I'm sure could provide adequate food/snacks for the day ahead. We had heard that the neighborhood was somewhat sketchy, but we didn't find it threatening as the girls and I walked through it late on our last night without problem. There were cafes and bars nearby, which seemed full of people, although we chose to dine in another part of Rome on our last night. Overall, this hotel was a good value and VERY clean and adequate (who spends time in their room anyway?). Close to the major transportation hubs (for day trips to other areas), the location can't be beat. I would highly recommend this hotel (my daughter said it was a nice place and asked if we could stay again on a return visit). I second that!

Reviews.Title: “great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tammyLakeWorthFl
Reviews.Content: We just honeymooned in Rome, Italy and stayed at this hotel. It is a small quaint hotel with only 16 rooms. It's in an old buliding rich with history. It's around the corner fron the main termini which made traveling in Rome so easy. The rooms are clean and spacious compared to other hotels in Europe. They have in room safes and spacious closets and drawer space. The staff was wonderful! They were helpful in giving us directions to anywhere we asked and offered resturant suggestions. I would reccomend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden but worth finding”
Reviews.Author: Moland
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in May. Opening the large wooden door to the hotel on the bustling fruit and food market is like stepping into a tranquil indoor piazza - the reception is to the right where we found very friendly and helpful staff who man the area 24/7. Our room was simple and clean, with an en suite bathroom in excellent condition and a small balcony overlooking a residential side street. Everything in the room from the toilet to the TV was in perfect working order which made getting ready for the evenings a pleasure. Certainly good value and quality for a 2*. The most pleasing aspect was the location - I had heard the area around Termini was slightly dodgy, especially after dark, but we both felt completely safe walking around the area and were grateful for its proximity to the station re: transport. There was a market outside the hotel in the morning and pasticcerias along the road as well as caffes and tabacci - very nice to be amongst romans rather than tourists in the morning before sightseeing etc. A very enjoyable and trouble-free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jackacp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in mid April, was a bit hesitant due to location, but it turned out to be great. 5 minute walk from train / metro station to hotel and never once felt unsafe. Decent room with a very large shower. You do have to leave your key with the front desk every time you leave and get buzzed in when you return which can be a bit annoying. Received a voucher for breakfast (coffee & pastry) from the front desk every morning to bring to a small cafe across the street. The hotel does offer internet access which was helpful since our luggage got lost and the two brothers were very helpful in giving directions & dinner recommendations. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Hotel Domus!”
Reviews.Author: travelrus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week and had a great time. The room was beautiful, tile floors, big bed and a circular window alcove. The bathroom was also clean and nice as well. The largest of all the rooms we've stayed at in Europe. The brother's at the front desk were all very nice. We had no problems leaving our room key, someone was always there when we left and came back. Breakfast was good, if you like pastries, which I do, and everyone at the bar was really nice. The hotel is not central but we found the location excellent. We like to walk so we rarely used the metro but it is very convenient. We took a cab home twice at night when it was raining and it was cheap so that was no problem either. In addition, we took an early train to Florence one day and Naples another and it was so convient to only walk 5 minutes to the train station that early in the morning (and then back late at night). You may want to ask for a room on one of the upper floors. We had some noisy upstairs neighbors. It seemed like they were tap dancing or bowling in their rooms at some points. The tile floor doesn't damper any of the sounds. It only woke us up twice, one around midnight one night and then once at 5am another day. You also may want to bring your own pillow. I normally sleep with a flat pillow but the pillows we had were REALLY flat, even for me. The first day when we took a shower the water bubbled into the bedroom thru the wall. Just a little trickle, but it was kind of weird. It didn't cause a problem so we ignored it and it never happenned again. It might have been caused because the shower head was broken at first but it was later fixed that day. All in all we had a really great stay. Next time we will probably look for something more central but if we plan on needing the train a lot this is the hotel we'd stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Domus is a great find”
Reviews.Author: barcadan
Reviews.Content: My wife, one year old daughter and I stayed at Domus in September 2004 just after it had been remodeled. We are planning a return trip to Rome later this year and will definitely book at Domus again. I checked this website to make sure that nothing had changed, and it sounds like its still a great bargain. As far as the few complaints I've read about (noise, poor breakfast and location) I must say that neither was really a problem. We had a top floor room with double-paned windows. It was suprisingly large (unlike most similary properties in Paris) and the bathroom was immaculate and big as well. We awoke on our first morning and looked out to see a bustling street market below. I only heard the noise after opening the windows. Breakfast was typical for quantitiy (coffee and a pastry). I have to say that I was hard-pressed to find a better cappuccino anywhere in the city (even Taza d'Oro, at three times the price, didn't compare). Light breakfasts are a great excuse to have a mid-morning pizza anyway. As for the location, well, you are only three blocks from the Metro! While Rome's Metro is not as efficient as London, Paris or Barcelona, it can still get you into the "ballpark" where you simply go on foot. If we could do it with a one year old I am confident that most travellers can manage. If you want to be more centrally located you will have to pay a lot more. I'd rather spend my money on Roman food!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: Dave'n'Rach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter weekend for three nights. Location was a 5 minute walk from Termini. Neighbourhood is fine, just the usual drunks around the station. Initially walked straight past the hotel as we didn't notice the sign - pay attention to the door numbers and it will be easy to find. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay and even left us a small gift on Easter Sunday. Room and internal bathroom were spacious and clean. No breakfast is served within the hotel but we were given a voucher that we could use for a pastry and coffee across the street. Would definitely stay here again. Room was good value for a hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derbyshire_fellow
Reviews.Content: I have just returned with my wife from a four night stay and we were delighted with the hotel. The rooms were very clean and surprisingly spacious, but it is the staff who added that extra ingredient that is worthy of note. Three brothers (Fabio, Massimo and Antonio) run the hotel and do a very good job of it as well. They are very friendly, helpful and courteous and go that extra yard for their customers. I wish many other hotels would take a leaf from their book on how to treat their customers. The hotel is located near to the bus and train station which would be helpful for some visitors to Rome. We walked everywhere, so it did not really matter where we were stayed in Rome. To give you an idea, it is roughly a 30 minutes walk to the Colosseum and perhaps 15 minutes to the Spanish Steps from the hotel. A small breakfast is included (though it was not expected) which consists of a coffee and pastry at a café over the road. I strongly recommend visitors to try the café as it was the best coffee I had whilst in Rome and a snip at 70 cents per cup, compared with an average of around 3 euros per cup in other places. I would not hesitate to recommend the hotels to others as a base when visiting Rome and will certainly book again when next I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the hype?”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Luv2fly
Reviews.Content: If I had never read the reviews on tripadvisor, I would have been neutral to slightly disappointed about our three night stay. Instead, my wife and I were definitely disappointed because we could not see why this hotel was so popular--and my wife and I are comparing this to the twenty or so other moderately priced hotels we've stayed at in Western Europe. What we liked: 1) The room was nicely appointed, quiet, and surprisingly spacious for Europe. 2) The staff at the hotel was nice and helpful. What we didn't like: 1) The hotel location I had two problems with the location. First it was too close to the railroad station. Being close to a railroad station often means not being in the best part of town. I don't know why I ignored my instincts in booking this hotel. Is a 5-7 Euro cab ride to get to a hotel located away from the railroad station that much of a hassle that some people actually prefer staying around the station? The other problem with the hotel's location is that it's not centrally located. From the railroad station, it's roughly in the opposite direction of anything you'd want to visit as a tourist. So everything you'd want to see is either a long walk or a 5-10 minute walk to the subway plus a ride on the Metro. Any time you saved by being close to the railroad station is wiped out as soon as you leave the hotel to visit a tourist attraction. 2) Breakfast Breakfast was a coffee and a croissant at a bar across the street. I bet I've been to fifty hotels offering a free breakfast, and it's never been so little. Lastly, as a warning to anyone thinking of making a toll-free call within Italy from your hotel room at the Hotel Domus Praetoria--don't do it. I HATE hotels with ridiculously high long distance rates, but what's even worse is a hotel that gouges you for toll-free calls. I was charged about 20 Euro for about 20 minutes worth of calls made to toll-free numbers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: aidra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We enjoyed our stay for the most part. We stayed in room 224 and at night the people above us would start walking around, closing doors and watching TV at around 8 pm all the way into the night. I'm not sure if these people were residents of the building or guests of the hotel. If you're a light sleeper it might get to you. Construction was going on on the top floors of the building starting at around 8 am, so if you like to sleep in ask for a room other than 224. For the money and location it's great. My husband and I walked to EVERY tourist location except the Vatican. So unless you're out of shape or older this location is great. Rome isn't that big. All I have to say is wearing proper shoes! Not just any pair of sneakers but shoes with cushioning and good stability, and ladies, no heels! The cobblestone is killer on your feet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: turistLasVegas
Reviews.Content: What a FIND in Rome, the city of expensive hotels! The rooms were immaculate and large, the bathrooms were marble - big and lovely. The desk managers, brothers, are terrific and will do everything to help "lost" travelers! I needed an adapter for my curling iron (must have a hairdo in Rome!) and there is a tiny hardware shop a block from the hotel! They gave us information on where to eat (there are several outdoor cafes around the corner and within a couple of blocks!) and how to catch the city tour buses. We traveled with a two year old and had "lots" of luggage. The small lift was great to have for transporting luggage downstairs at 4:30 am. (They came up to help!) It is a VERY short walk from the train station, maybe four - five blocks. You can hang out of your window and see the market place below every morning. The breakfast is with a voucher in the small "coffee shop" across the street, (not sit-down) but how wonderful the people are there! And the Croissants!!! Fresh baked with a touch of cinnamon. It is on the "good" side of the train station near university so no problems with undesirables, morning , noon or night! Very quiet. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: UsaWriterteacher
Reviews.Content: My experience was much like many other reviewers'. The rooms in this hotel are very small, but lovely. Someone with an eye for design planned and furnished them. The appointments are nicer than they have to be, the fabrics are handsome, the baths are very modern. Everything was spotlessly clean, almost new looking. The location is 4 blocks from the train station so convenient for those coming or leaving that way. However, it is a bit of a hike to get to the metro station there so the location is less than ideal for seeing the sites. I stayed one night prior to catching the train to the airport and it was perfect for that. The staff is friendly and helpful and there is enough security to keep out an army. Lots of locked doors opened from the desk when you buzz a request, and a safe in every room. There was not a lot of storage space or moving around space in the rooms and two people in a double will be cramped. The bed was very comfortable, however. The lack of an inhouse breakfast could get old, I expect, but I didn't mind. Regarding directions from the station, the ones sent to me were not accurate, so here are mine: When you leave your train, walk along the platforms in front of the trains, aiming toward binario number one. Straight in front will be a side entrance to the station (in other words, do not go out to the terminal proper at all.) As you exit that way the road alongside the station is via Marsala. Cross at the light right in front of you. Go right, down via Marsala, for one block, then turn left onto via Milozzi. The hotel is in the last building on the left at the end of the street. Look on the door's buzzers and you will see its name. Buzz to gain entry, and after you enter the "lobby" of the building, go right, then left, to the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff. Perfect ratio quality-price.”
Reviews.Author: rororobledo
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, and its owners/workers were very kind and helpfull. Very clean and big enough rooms even for three people. Well situated to visit town center and historical sites are 20 minutes by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Woodster77
Reviews.Content: Domus Praetoria is undoubtedly better than you'd expect for the price you pay. The service provided was excellent, with friendly helpful staff. The room we stayed in (a triple) was clean, comfortable and spacious enough for the long weekend we were there. On the downside, the hotel is part of an appartment block which means that whether it's the kids going to school or (as in our case) a spot of DIY, there can be unwanted noise: we were woken up before 8am on each of our three mornings, though I'm sure this wouldn't bother everyone. If it's possible, I'd ask for a room that doesn't overlook the central courtyard as this will keep you away from any noise created from the appartments. Overall, a good stay in a hotel that's rightly well rated on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Brief Stay”
Reviews.Author: 2fromTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Domus, one night at the end of our trip so we could spend a day in Rome, and then the night before we flew out. The proximity to the Termini (5 minute walk) makes it ideal for a quick stay. The room was large and clean, the staff was great. It doesn't look like a hotel when you walk up to it but was no hassle to find using the e-mailed directions. Since we spent very little time in the room other than sleeping and needed easy access to the transportation, this hotel was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great room; pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: AAKKentUK
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was a good size, nicely decorated, very comfortable and clean. The tiled bathroom was well appointed with WC, large shower (but no bath), basin and bidet. In our opinion there were plenty of toiletries and towels. The only down side was that the shower went cold (on me!) once in the 3 days of our stay but this only lasted about 3 minutes. The free electronic safe was a nice touch. The lift was a bit small so we chose to use the stairs. For anybody with mobility problems the lift would have been fine. The hotel does not have a standard frontage so it is necessary to look carefully for the nameplate on the intercom by the (massive) studded door. A small market operates in the street and, despite closing the outer shutters and double glazed windows, the early morning activity could be heard in our street facing room. The market also leaves some mess. I would only give the street cleaners 7/10 for their efforts. We really enjoyed our time in Rome. The breakfast coupon for the Cafe across the road prompted us to go into a place that we may not have ventured but it was a nice experiance and the coffee excellent. The hotel's close proximity to the termini is a benefit. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain and location”
Reviews.Author: houston77068
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after our cruise. location was perfect for our needs and the hotel was clean and comfortable. In room mini-frig was nice to have. only the free breakfast left something to be desired. Will definitely stay here on next rome trip

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: PatadePerro
Reviews.Content: We hit the jack pot when we booked our vacation at this hotel. It is in a perfect location for access to the whole city. We took the Leonardo express train from the airport and walked the two blocks to the hotel. The day we arrived there was a public transit strike and we would have had a terrible time getting anywhere else. The family that runs the hotel went out of their way to make us feel welcome and gave us great suggestions for local restaurants and activities. The room was very clean and up to date with a sparkling bathroom. The extra thick glass windows made the room bright and very quiet. The daily market in our street added lots of opportunity for bargain shopping (bought snacks, scarves and beautiful leather boots for great prices)and local colour. The coffee and croissant provided at the cafe across the street was a wonderful way to start the day - when in Rome do as the Romans do. We would highly recommend the hotel to anyone wanting convenience and great value.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: isabelvalencia
Reviews.Content: We were made very welcome by the brothers that run the hotel and speak good english, they were most helpful. We felt very secure staying here and the en suite nicely furnished spotlessly clean comfortable room (with a safe) was delightful overlooking the small daily market. Breakfast was coffee and pastry in the bar opposite. A pleasant area with plenty of restaurants (less expensive than city centre ones) and the metro/bus/coach station close by with its shopping malls was all very convenient. We would recommend this hotel for its locality and easy access to all areas. PS we loved the dear little lift.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: janiceandbryn
Reviews.Content: We had read all the great reviews of this hotel - and they were right! The hotel is situated about 3 minutes walk from the railway station The area is good and there are many excellent cheap restaurants within two minutes walk. Our room was immaculate in every way and the security in the hotel made us feel extremely safe. You will not do better than this in a capital city anywhere - especially for the price ( 88 euros per night)

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: SuperJonny
Reviews.Content: A nice clean, comfortable, affordable hotel which is fine as somewhere to sleep whilst you explore Rome. Just don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed. Booked it as a cheap place by Roman standards to stay for a long weekend. Yes the immediate area is a bit seedy as is the area near a main train terminus in every city (It's not as bad as King's Cross I can tell you) but as other people have said we never felt unsafe at any time and the hotel itself is perfectly secure. Will be nice when thet get their licence for the breakfast room, the cafe over the road is fine but I like to sit down for breakfast. Don't understand why people say it's out of the way, we walked to loads of places and you can also easily get to places on the metro too. As others have said the brothers are friendly and helpful For the price and ease of getting to from the airport, I think it would be hard to beat in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Holiday to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Aussiekiwis
Reviews.Content: We took the advice of other Tripadvisor reviewers and selected this hotel. Its a short walk from the railway station but be warned - like so many Italian hotels there is only a wall plaque to identify it. Once inside in the courtyard we were greeted by Roberto ( one of two brothers who run the hotel. He took us up to our room in a tiny antique lift and it was just great. Spacious with a wonderful bathroom, a/c, small balcony, and spotlessly clean. Considering the price - inexpensive by Rome standards - it was a gem. One tip though. Breakfast is included in the price which actually meant a voucher to use at the small cafe oppsite but we were not offered one until our third morning. But better to buy your own fresh fruit from the wonderful market which sets up in the road outside from 7am to noon. Domus Praetoria is in an excellent location with lots of inexpensive restaurants to choose from. The staff were very friendly and helpful and organised our tours very efficiently. we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely 'stunning' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rickandjude
Reviews.Content: We stayed seven nights in November during our Around the World Trip and could not have chosen a better Hotel. The three brothers and their father were so friendly and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean and was larger and more comfortable than we expected. Being close to the station made it easy to get to all the places of interest and there were plenty of places to eat very close to the Hotel. As we said to the brothers your Hotel is STUNNING. The boys and their father made our stay sensational.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: gordonbs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after reading Trip Advisor comments. In my opinion, the hotel is excellent all round. Very clean, very friendly, in an excellent location, and good value. We stayed in room 203, which was a good size, and looked out onto the street. This is a good family room as it is set up with an additional single bed. Only minor fault is that you have to hand in your key card whenever you leave for the day and you have to buzz to get back inside from the street. Never caused us any problems, but be aware of this. We heard no noise from the market in the mornings, and although breakfast is a coffee and pastry at a cafe across the road, it is a very friendly place that made us feel extremely welcome. The local area does not have much charm, but we always felt safe and it was a 5 minute walk to the Stazione Termini, where you can pick up the metro or bus to anywhwere in Rome. Recommend purchasing a 3 day travel card from Stazione, which lets you travel anywhere in Rome by bus or metro. You only need to use the 40 or 64 buses to reach most of the sights, and they both return to the Termini. Metro also very easy to use. Trams and bendy buses are great fun but can get very busy. We ate a couple of evenings at the Praetorian Taverna (turn left out of the door, left again and it is about 2 blocks up on right hand side) where the food is basic, staff very friendly and overall really good value. Always busy - a good sign. We enjoyed our 3 day break and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No frills!!!”
Reviews.Author: ME-Sydney
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel given the rave reviews in tripadvisor. Much to our disappointment, the hotel is located in a seedy and dirty part of town. There is a street market right out the front of the hotel which didn't smell very nice every morning. You have to buzz into the building and on one occasion we were left waiting outside until another tenant of the building opened the door for us instead! They also insist on you leaving your magnetic key at reception on leaving!! Their level of security may highlight the safety of the area. Eventhough the hotel is located very close to Rome Termini Station, it is far away from all tourist attraction. You will need to travel by metro to all tourist attractions. The hotel staff are helpful and courteous but no more than what is usually expected from hotel staff. The rooms are clean but small. Breakfast is done by a coupon system. You are given a coupon in the morning to take to the cafe across the road and in return you are given one pastry and a small coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with above-average kind staff”
Reviews.Author: kkushiba1
Reviews.Content: I've usually resorted to paying €190-€250 at the Airport Hilton Roma to catch early morning flights back to the US. As TA reviews said good things about Hotel Domus Praetoria, I took a chance and booked a room and arranged an early shuttle using [--].
