As one previous post mentioned, the hotel is located a couple of blocks on the right side of Roma Termini FS Train Station (train platforms at your back) and despite having been in Roma many times, I was always leery about that side of the train station (flashbacks of the right side of Napoli Centrale). I panicked weaving my luggage through a small street market toward the hotel's address; my heart sank when I found out that the hotel didn't have a "storefront" but resides in a building where you need to press a button to get in. Also to reach the front desk, one must go up a couple of stairs which with heavy luggage just added to the disappointment. However, the front desk person, a thin Gabriel Byrne-look-alike, was very kind and dealt with my reservation quickly and helped me with my luggage so my outlook changed. Also, the hotel staff offered to call the airport shuttle people to confirm my reservation(I declined). Unfortunately, there was no hot water in the room. I called the hotel's front desk and I ended up leaving the problem with them as I went out to sightsee. When I returned, the staff apologized and in the room the hot water worked. The fact that the shower head's cradle (room 209) was a bit broken luckily didn't affect its functionality. The toiletries included were two wrapped plastic cups, pieces of soap wrapped in paper, and some packets of shampoo. There were perhaps 6 towels The small refrigerator under the TV didn't seem to work, but I didn't bring it up to the hotel staff as it wasn't important to me. I didn't go onto the room's balcony which seemed to face the inner dmz-area of the back sides of several buildings. There was a temperature control system in the room, however, I didn't use it. Also, I didn't eat the breakfast in the morning as I needed to leave early. It's fascinating that the area outside the elevator on each floor was lushly decorated with stately wooden doors, thick royal blue carpets, and gold accents. However, the hallways to the rooms and the actual rooms had standard ceramic tile (probably easier to clean). Also, the a fluorescent bulb was installed as the room's main center light. IMHO a flood light would have brought out the decor downplayed by the current stark hospital-interrogation room-like fluorescent light. After having walked around the area more, it seemed that the hotel is actually in a pretty quiet area between the two metro stations,Termini and Castro Pretoria. Watch out, the pizzeria across the street from the Castro Pretoria metro stop/Roma Biblioteca library was expensive (€1.90 for a small slice) and served inedible pizza. I received my requested 3:15am wake-up call and later because the airport shuttle hadn't yet arrived, I decided to listen for the shuttle from the inside of front main door leading to the street due to my early morning crime paranoia. The hotel staff person was nice enough to wait with me and made small talk to pass the time. When the shuttle arrived, the hotel staff person was the one to identify what was going on outside, open the door, flag down the shuttle driver, and help me out with my luggage. Also, I don't remember hearing neighbors' noises such as pens dropping/heels clicking from above or doors opening and closing in general. There was no memorable outside noises either, however, I left the room at 3:30am. I arrived at Fiumicino Airport without any problems. The next time I'm faced with another early morning flight out of Fiumicino Airport, I'm definitely going to stay at the Domus Praetoria as it was clean, safe, and within walking distance to Roma Termini FS Train Station and two metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: freyabrit
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a gem of a hotel in the middle of Rome. Near to the Termini rail station - as others have said, it's a perfectly safe area, if not crowded, noisy and a bit dirty. The hotel is down a side street - yes its hard to find, but ask anyone and they will point you in the right direction. Our taxi driver from the airport had no trouble finding it. Fabio, Massemo and Antonio are indeed great hosts - friendly, couteous, helpful to the extreme. So is dad! The hotel is quiet and our room (208) although facing the street, was also surprisingly quiet, especially when we closed the shutters as well as the windows. The rooms are absolutely spotless - we never once saw or heard a maid but they were cleaned and tidied every day. No noisy guests, no banging of doors, no one calling "housekeeping" when you're trying to sleep - much more peaceful than most American hotels I've stayed at. Our room was very spacious, had a wall safe, a great always hot shower , and the bidet was a treat. As there was no tub, I have to admit to soaking my feet in it after walkingf for miles each day :-) There are several restaurants in easy walking distance and the cafe across the street makes wonderful breakfast pastries. Yes, it would have been nice to be able to get breakfast in the hotel itself, but the cafe was fun, the people friendly and going there made sure we got up and out! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed here”
Reviews.Author: wildone
Reviews.Content: Very central,great for access to trains/metro/buses. Clean,safe. Hotel staff VERY good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it very much!”
Reviews.Author: Omer22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the month of Nov. It was easy to get to from termini station. But just keep in mind that suit cases are a bit hard to roll on the pavements but it was not a big deal. There is a market right in front of the hotel that operates from morning to late afternoon but you don't hear any of the noise. now for the hotel and good stuff! the area is like any area around a major train stations. at night we saw a few drunks but that was around Termini station not on the hotel street. We walked back to the hotel late and didn't find it bad at all. There are some nice take out places on the street so if you are coming back late that is an option. internet cafes very close by. Rooms are spacious and washrooms too. very very clean. the brothers are wonderful and friendly. we actually checked out and left for the airport to catch our easy jet flight back to paris, only to find out that it was cancelled due to the weather. it was a nightmare that i will not go into details about. cutting long story short, after spending a good 6 hours at the airport only to have our flight rescheduled for the next day, we realized that we have to spend an extra night in rome. we went back to Hotel Domus because we knew we would get the best service. as expected they checked us into the room right away. Please check this place out when going to Rome. it is totally worth it and location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HIltonMagic
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here due to the great reviews it had received by fellow Trip Advisor members, and all I can tell you is that they are all justified! We knew from prior reviews that it could be somewhat difficult to recognize from the street as they don't have a large sign, but since we knew what to expect we had no trouble at all. Just follow signs for Via Marsala if you are arriving via Termini and you will have no issues whatsoever. The immediate area surrounding the train station was a bit sketchy, but never did we feel concerned for our safety and we made trip from station to hotel more than a few times after dark. The brothers who run the hotel are great, very welcoming and helpful. We arrived in Rome the evening after a day of travel and were pleased to be escorted up to our room and then have our bags brought up to us. They do have an elevator if that is a concern, but it is very SMALL (room for three people at the very maximum). The room was very large by European standards, as was the bathroom. Both rooms were spotlessly clean, and the electronic safe was a welcome addition. Breakfast is a voucher for a bar across the street. We started our day with the locals and we enjoyed it very much. There is a street market outside the hotel every morning, but our room was overlooking the courtyard so we never heard a thing in the mornings. Our only complaints (and these were very small) were that there is no internet access at the hotel and no English language channels on the television. I know, this is Rome and we didn't spend much time in our room anyway, but we were hoping to have had a way to keep up on some of the news from home while we were away. Again, very SMALL things in the grand scheme of things, but nonetheless. The newsstands at Termini do carry a couple of English language newspapers, so we ended up buying those. Just as an aside, there are several internet stops in the neighborhood, but we ended up finding one located at Piazza Barberini (two metro stops away) that we liked very much. 250 terminals, 2 euro per hour. At 85 euro per night, we found this to be a very affordable hotel, with a great staff and room. We wouldn't hesitate staying there again if we find ourselves in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sticks77
Reviews.Content: Very good value family run hotel. Clean and secure though area around train station has dodgy people hanging around. Other than that, spacious and comfortable room and very helpful staff willing to help. Good base to discover Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: katypaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days in Septmener this year. Very plaesed with room and very friendly staff. Although area around train station can look a bit daunting we didn't experince any problems even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for a family holiday.”
Reviews.Author: wglee
Reviews.Content: Before we booked our accomodation in Rome we searched the internet and came across the Trip Advisor web site. How lucky we were to find such a good value lovely hotel. Travelling with a family of four it was not easy to find a quad room at a reasonable price in Rome. The room and bathroom are large with high ceilings and clean. we always felt comfortable with alot of space to move and store our luggage. The security to the Hotel was good we always felt safe even at night. It is located about 5 min from the train station which is good if you arrive in Rome by train you can wheel your luggage to the hotel before going out to explore. There are many good reasonable priced Restaurants nearby. The laundromat is a few doors away so it is very convenient to do the family washing there. The brothers were lovely they really do try to run a very good buisness. They were always helpful and polite. My children adored Massimo. I would definetly recommend this Hotel to families needing extra space. Maybe the single traveller may find this Hotel too isolated. I think the entrance to the Hotel could be improved . More lighting more plants a little more attention to the appearance of the foyer. Overall I think this is a good hotel with a rating well above two star. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Found the area to be seedy but hotel adequate”
Reviews.Author: whatthe111111
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say but I would have to agree with the previous posting - the hotel is adequate, the room was clean and spacious and the staff very helpful and nice. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the train/bus station but I felt the area to be very seedy. At the bus depo you can catch an hop on hop off bus which will take you to all the main attractions in Roma for 11 euro which is great if you are on limited time. If the hotel was situated in a different area I would stay there again as the rooms were clean and basic for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; great staff”
Reviews.Author: Tamahere
Reviews.Content: Date: October 24, 2006 We stayed at this hotel for four nights after touring Italy for a month. It was, without doubt, the best accommodation for price, location and service of any of the hotels we stayed in. Our room was large and airy and overlooked the street where a market was set up each morning. I never heard the stall-holders setting up although they were right beneath our window. We loved the breakfast system - a voucher for coffee and a pastry at the lovely bar across the road. It serves some of the best coffee in Rome and, if you want a second cup, it is just 70c. We also loved browsing in the market. The stall-holders were delightful. The hotel is only five minutes walk from the station, which makes the location ideal if you are travelling by train. The staff were so helpful and answered all our queries. Massimo directed me to a great market where I bought a leather jacket. We would not have found it had it not been for his helpful suggestions. We will return to Rome (we have thrown our coins in the fountain) and we will certainly stay at Domus Praetoria.

Reviews.Title: “amazing deal”
Reviews.Author: joeyhelmet
Reviews.Content: great staff, great location (near Roma Termini), and a really nice room for an incredibly reasonable price. would recommend it without hesitation....

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every moment”
Reviews.Author: toptopcat
Reviews.Content: Have just read a review of this hotel 'Don't understand the Hype" Well to be honest I don't understand this review. We arrived in Rome with no real expectations other than a clean comfortable room and bathroom. We had a very pleasant surprise. The Domus Pretoria was situated very close to the Termini which for our purpose is what we wanted. The railway station wasn't the place we were going to sleep or were the corners of streets where ladies of the night visit. Our room was excellent and we were more than happy. All the brothers were extremely polite and helpful. The room was large and very comfortable, the sheets and linen very clean as was all the amenities. We both liked the idea of the little cafe over the road to get our breakfast, it was great to be part of the 'local' scene, so was the market which was open outside the hotel each morning, and surprisingly no noise from the room, due to the double glazing. I guess it all depends on where your priorities are in as far as a holiday. Ours was a good place to stay whilst enjoying the sites of Rome. Being our first trip to Italy, we were not dissapointed in our stay in Rome. In fact we were more than happy. Good on you 'boys' and as we say in Aussie - it was a 'fair dinkum' place to stay and we will certainly be recommending this hotel to anyone who wishes to visit Ancient Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the hype”
Reviews.Author: blowstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights, in mid-September 2006. Booked the room directly with the property, a large double for single occupancy at 110 Euros per night. The reservation system was very straightforward, and they were expecting me. The room was large and clean and quiet, but totally featureless. A friend staying at the same time in Rome in a monastery at half the price had a better-decorated room with more amenities and certainly a newer bathroom. The TV was too small to see from the bed, and reception was snowy. The cheerless bathroom is out-dated and had tiny worn towels, a dribbly shower and no decent soap or shampoo. Air-con and (dim) lighting work only by the insertion of the room key card, although my library card from home also worked when I went out. Domus Praetoria occupies about two half-floors in a typical faded grandeur Roman mansion building, and with more personality and generosity of hospitality, it could be a charming pensione. But it claims to be a hotel, which is certainly is not in terms of amenity, quality or management. Everything seems mean, from the rationed soap, electricity and towels, to the punctiliousness of checkout time. The three brothers who operate reception on a shift system are individually charming, but there is little overlap or handover and so my request for 2 prebooked tickets into the Villa Borghese turned out to be only 1 when I got to the museum. And it was sold out. However Brother A was very kind to me when I came home with food poisoning from the dismal tourist trap restaurant Brother B had recommended. What annoyed me most was the paranoid security. This is indeed an "edgy" area, but aggressively challenging daylight visitors accompanied by registered guests is ludicrous. I had a business colleague who had arrived to collect a courier package from me at about 10.30am, and was pounced on to leave his driving licence at the desk. Heaven knows what might have happened had I brought back a romantic encounter in the evening. A strip search and a blood sample? I also don't understand why, since room access is by key card, it's necessary to LEAVE the key card at reception when venturing out of the hotel. "Because we prefer it" is not an adequate reason. Because there's no breakfast room or other opportunity to interact with other residents, single travellers may feel more isolated and less charmed by this property than couples, but I couldn't recommend it to anyone really. Nor do I see the value in staying close to the Termini Station. It's a dirty and depressing area, and isn't close to anything a tourist would want to see in Rome - the Villa Borghese is a 35 minute walk, and you'd need the metro to get to the Vatican, the Piazza del Popolo, the Trevi, the Piazza Navona, Trastevere .... everything, really, except the wretched railway terminal. I don't normally worry about edgy locations, and could easily sidestep the prostitutes working the corner, the drunks between the hotel and the station entrance, the hustlers with their 3 Euro bottles of water, or the backpackers sharing a slice of pizza from a greasy spoon - but why bother, when there's nothing you'd want in this locality anyhow? Taxis across Rome rarely cost me more than 10 Euros, so I would suggest staying in a more pleasant property with the facilities you might require - and a reception team that doesn't act like the secret police in pre-glasnost Russia - and to not worry so much about location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel - Unique Character - Freindly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Holtyboy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel becuse of the Trip Advisor rating - infact the hotel displayed a Trip Advisor award on the reception desk! Once you have located the Domus Praetoria (its behind a big wooden door with just a small sign on the outside of the building with a buzzer to gain entrance) you will be entering into a part of 'real' Rome. This is not a fancy four/five star hotel - but a hotel that offers good clean rooms and personal service at a reasonable price. The hotels rooms are on the higher floors of the building, with the reception on the ground floor (lift/elevator provided). The three brothers who run the hotel were all very freindly and able to help out with local information etc. The rooms were clean, had a large bathroom and airconditioning - just what you need for a comfortable nights sleep. Whilst this is only a two star hotel it offered excellant value for Rome and the location - within walking distance of the Termini railway station meant that you could get around the city easily. There are a number of restaurants and coffee shops in the area that offered better value than the main tourist sites of Rome. (e.g 15-20 Euro, 3 course menu, with bottled water) Breakfast, consiting of a cake and coffee is provided across the street at the Cafe Roberto when you hand over a voucher that is obtained from the reception - whilst not a 'full' breakfast it is the Italian way to sart the day! The area around the station does have its share of 'low life', however none caused us any problem - just walk on by and ignore them! If we return to Rome in the future we would stop at the Domus Praetoria again.

Reviews.Title: “believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: nowonmai
Reviews.Content: booked this after reading the previous reviews and it certainly lived up to it's reputation. Customer service is excellent and the room was big and clean. Our window overlooked the street where a there was a busy little market in the morning but the double glazing keeps the noise out. we picked up some nice fruit there in the morning after the breakfast from the cafe opposite. Yes, the immediate area around the station isn't the prettiest, it has the usual fake bag vendors and local drunks like a lot of cities but there's no real danger there and the street they are on is fine, in fact I'm sure they're next to a police station. We walked past the hotel at first as there's no obvious sign (if you're coming from the Termini it's the last building on the left at the bottom of the street) definitely worth all the praise and their award

Reviews.Title: “a real gem”
Reviews.Author: Jen&Mike
Reviews.Content: We took the recommendation of Trip Advisor on this hotel and we were not disappointed. We were allocated their biggest room and we felt like royals! Our room was enormous with high ceilings, entry hall and spacious bathroom (no bath just shower). The room had cold air con and a mini fridge which was great. The floor was a lovely polished timber and the room had a very Roman romantic feel to it. The bathroom was clean, well appointed and relatively modern. The hotel was a bit tricky to find - they are not allowed large street signage, so you need to look for the numbers and then a large timber door. The lift is shared by other tenants in the building and when we tried to leave in the morning the cleaning lady had left the lift door adjar downstairs so the lift wouldn't move to collect us - so we had to take the stairs. Other than that, there are no problems. The hotel was quiet and close to some lovely casual eateries - although we found dining outside meant putting up with a strong drain/garbage smell....I guess that's Rome. It was a short walk from the Termini station and there is a police station on the same street so it feels very safe. The only negatives would be that although we had a small credit-card-like room key with no identifying details on it, the man on the desk insisted we leave this with him when we left the hotel. Also, breakfast is just a voucher at a cafe across the road. When we were there, they did not speak English so I couldn't ask for something other than coffee (which I can't drink) but I am not sure they served anything else anyway. The food was simply a choice of one pastry - nice for a snack but not if you want more for breakfast. Not a big deal though, you can always go elsewhere for breakfast if you know not to expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Good”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: As this was the last hotel we stayed in on a 7 night trip around Europe we were hoping for a great hotel, which, thanks to these reviews, we got. Following just a two minute walk from the Termini (through an area which isn`t really that bad at all) we arrived at the hotel which is marked only by a plaque. The guy on reception (presumably one of the brothers) greeted us by name before we`d even introduced ourself at the desk. Any question was answered and he even tried to sort out some Lazio tickets for us. Check-in was quick, and we were personally shown to our room. The room was huge for a 2 star, and the bathroom was massive (as were the towels), and the air con was a nice touch., Big soft bed and subtle decoration made it feel very classy. Overall, not really sure why this is only a 2 star, its close to all transport links, surrounded by nice restaurants, and has possibly the nicest staff we`ve ever come across. It was a real nice end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitbit
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the start of a trip around Italy. Location is ideal being so close to train, bus and metro station. The area near the train station is never the greatest in any city, but we had no problems and always felt safe. The room we had was spacious and clean and the hosts were always pleasant and helpful. We enjoyed taking breakfast across the street with the locals, a quick cappucino and brioche gets you on your way early as there is a lot to fit in to a day in Rome. Overall I think it would be difficult to beat for the price. Note the comment below about leaving the station onto Via Marsala. The train from the airport arrives at the opposite end of the station so you need to walk all the way through.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring”
Reviews.Author: JezT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in total durring a two week holiday travelling through Italy and found it to be perfect for our needs. The location is ideal for those travelling by train and 5mins walk arounfdthe corner you can catch one of the regular coaches to out of town airports such as ciampino - only takes 30mins. The rooms were clean and spacious, the brothers very helpful and the hotel is in a fine location for exploring the city and jumping on the metro. Granted it is a bit of a treck to the Trevi etc but it didn't bother us. Taxi to Piazza Navano (best for restaurants and bars) averaged 8euro. The area is fine and just like any other surrounding a main train terminal so don't let it put you off. We would definately return. J & F

Reviews.Title: “It's all true”
Reviews.Author: shawnvice
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add about what the previous reviews have said except to say that it's all true. This is a great value hotel, superbly run by the 3 brothers. And the neighbourhood isn't THAT bad, plus you have the convenience of the subway a block away, handy for exploring Rome beyond the Centro Storico. We had a great stay, and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “More than a hotel--a stay with friends”
Reviews.Author: steve39
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel through the Trip Advisor Web site. At first I was a bit cynical that a hotel could have so many excellent ratings. NO MORE! My wife son and I spent four nights there at the end of August 2006. It was great. And when one of the three brothers who run the hotel, walked us to our cab at 6 AM, saying goodbye, it was a bit like leaving a friend. This is a small hotel--16 rooms, located in a neighbohood just far away from the central train station that it is convenient, yet quiet and undisturbed by it. There is NO street noise and double paned windows and AC ensure that. THere is no fancy lobby or place for breakfast (one is probably coming this fall and guests receive a voucher for a continental breakfast at a small and freindly breakfast spot up the block. On checking in, it is clear that one of the brothers is providing far more than clerk services. Any questions, help or requests are answered positively. And each of the brothers, having been trained by the hotel keeping parents, is equally ready to help. THe rooms are two years old, occupying former spaces in the building that must be 100 years old. They are immaculate and maintained that way. Everything is new. We paid $140 a night in the midst of the tourist season. If I needed to return to Rome, there is not a question about the hotel I would select. This is it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: Maltezer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the very good reviews on this site, and I'm glad I did so as we really loved this hotel. Initially I was worried about the safety of the location but we never encountered any problems, even when we walked back to the hotel at night. The room was excellent, quite big and nicely furnished. Air conditioning worked and we also had a safe box and refrigerator in the room, both very useful. Bathroom was also quite spacious unlike other hotels we stayed at in Italy. Hot water was also available. The Praetoria brothers were great! They were very helpful and polite. One of the brothers took us to our room and showed us how things work and he even came up a few minutes later with our (very heavy) luggage. They also provided an adaptor for my battery charger. I loved the simple breakfast across the road! The 'brioche' was really delicious! I really miss them! Buying them from a supermarket back home is not the same somehow! The proximity to Termini station and the bus terminus is a great bonus, and this was the main reason why we chose this hotel. We only had 3 days in Rome and we wanted to see as much as possible. We did not want to walk long distances to the hotel with our luggage and we wanted to be close to the station. Thus we were never far away from anywhere. Tip: Make sure that when you arrive at Termini you get out from the exit leading to Via Marsala. From there its just a 3 minute walk to Via Milazzo and the hotel. We went out from the wrong exit and spent some time walking around with our luggage in the sun till we found Via Milazzo. So ask someone at the station or do some homework before :) Overall the Praetoria provides very good service at a very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Almendarez
Reviews.Content: Although I was initially concerned about staying near the Termini train station, my friend and I chose to stay at the Domus Praetoria based on user reviews on TripAdvisor and Venere. It was a good choice and I would likely stay there again during a future trip to Rome. The location proved to be excellent for the arrival from the FCO airport (an express train runs from the airport to the Termini station and is 1/5 the price of a cab) and then taking the Eurostar to other cities. Termini is also a metro stop, so we took the train to most sites and found this to be an extremely easy and affordable way to get around the city. The hotel is a mere 3 blocks from the station, but be advised to look for the name of the hotel on the doorbell list as there is no sign. The staff (Massimo, Fabio and Antonio) was extremely friendly and helpful (and spoke excellent English). As I waited for the room to be ready, Fabio went over the “must sees” and how to get there. He then carried my bags up the 4 flights of stairs since the elevator was on the fritz (it was fixed later that day). The room was blissfully cool in the blazing late July heat (thanks to individually controlled AC). Room and bathroom were much bigger than expected. Both were clean and had the standard amenities. The included breakfast is a croissant/pastry and coffee at the bar across the street (standing only). Though not exactly filling, the service was courteous and fast and one could easily go out to the open air market on Milazzo and buy fruit to complete the meal. The open air market also offers items ranging from undies to lemon zesters, providing a fun, cool local experience. Overall, great stay and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: VinceM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a residential building several blocks from the Termini station. Security is heavy, giving some indication of the type of neighborhood. Although we arrived without incident after walking from Termini, we were not comfortable. This is not an area that I would otherwise have explored, especially at night. It was a considerable walk to all of the major attractions. The room was newly renovated and nicely appointed, and it certainly was a bargain. Had this hotel been located in a different neighborhood, it would be a four star. They have just added a breakfast room adjacent to the office and served a nice continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: JR010
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 10th August to 14th August. As per other Trip Advisor reviews on this hotel, finding it was a bit of a challenge however the fact that I was told to look for a big brown gate and buzz reception certainly made it easier to locate. Hotel is literally 4 minutes walk to TERMINI (excellent location). Once I arrived I was welcomed by Maximo whom explained to me how the hotel facilities and breakfast vouchers worked. Once he showed me to the room I must say it was FANTASTIC!!!. To Austrlian standards the room is comparable to a 4 star hotel. Clean beds, air cond works, safe facilities and beautiful bathroom Top marks here!!. Breakfast was across the road at "Bar Robertos" which gives you a coffee and a croissant of choice, no tables though but having a quick breakfast at the bar is very common in Italy. You know its a good venue when it quickly fills up with Italians living in the area. For dinner I highly recommend "Mama Angela's" which is around the corner. This was recommended in a prior review and I must definitely give it the thumbs up!!. Food was great, service was excellent, the ambience was great!!, and last but not least, prices very very reasonable. Full marks go to this hotel. Do not search any more!! just book this hotel, you will not be dissapointed. Metro is cheap 1 Euro a one way ticket. It is not recommended to take a daily ticket for 4 Euro because you will be doing a lot of walking and you will find before you know it you would have walked back to the hotel. If you are considering a tour contact ODYSSEY Tours as they honestly did a fantastic tour, Jason the tour guide was out of this world in knowledge and funny! It is recommended you buy your water before you go out otherwise they will charge you higher prices. At TERMINI station you can buy a 2 litre bottle of water for 1.85 Euros. I hope you enjoy your stay, I certainly did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: MTSEYMOUR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in July, including the evening Italy won the World Cup sem-final. Things were pretty noisy out in the street, but not in our room. Restaurants recommended by the brothers at the front desk were all good. The room was clean and nicely done - a great bargain. Although it is near the train station, the hotel is on a very nice street. The reason it's such a good price is it's a further walk to all the sights than the more expensive places. But we thought it was a great find. Our teenage daughter loved the market right outside the front door - lots of good bargains. The cafe where you have breakfast is really Italian - if you want it second capuccino it's only 70 Euro cents.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Dalions
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a five night stay at the Domus Praetoria (August 1-6). Our experience was very positive and would definitely consider staying there again. First, after arriving fairly early in the morning (after a looong flight) the staff did their best to accomodate our early check-in (at no extra cost). The room was clean, the bed was big and soft, and the security was excellent. The hotel also provides a great location from which to visit the various sites in Rome. The Colloseum, for instance, is about a 30 minute walk; however, Termini station is just down the street. The easy access to public transportation made getting aroud a big city like Rome very easy. Some people have mentioned that the neighbourhood is "sketchy", but my wife and I felt perfectly safe. The brothers that run the hotel were very helpful, friendly and accommodating. If you want great value for your money, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in in Europe”
Reviews.Author: michalmm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here a few days after a tour of Italy we took. We booked the room for 92 EUR a night directly with the hotel after reading reviews on this site. I cannot express how much I liked this hote. It is right around the train station, which really didn't make us feel terribly unsafe. Plus, you have to get buzzed into both the hotel itself and the corridor our room was in. We stayed in Room 301, which was enormous. It had two twin size beds, but probably could have comfortably fit 2 double beds. The A/C worked great which was incredibly helpful with the hot weather. The bathroom was very nice, and you could actually turn around in the shower. The breakfast was across the street, and the folks in the bar over there were very kind. Try the coissant with the ricotta. yum! The front desk staff, which must be the brothers mentioned here, were fantastic. They were all incredibly helpful, and very nice. If I ever go back to Rome this would be the place I would book a stay. Clean, secure, and well located to mass transit.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Germerican
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about staying at this hotel, because of the stellar reviews and the 2005 pick. We were incredibly disapplointed in our stay though. I was with a friend of mine and I had booked separate beds. We ended up in a room with one small single bed and no A/C, on an extremely hot weekend in July. The room was obviously under contruction, since the AC unit hadn't been fully taken out of its packaging. They did move us out of that room to another room the next night, but only because they had a cancellation. That room was great, and is the only thing stopping me from giving this hotel 1 star. The hotel staff was nice, but didn't offer any compensation for their error. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great but consider the location”
Reviews.Author: Hank88
Reviews.Content: The location is very near the Termini, the rooms are very modern and very clean (even by my girlfriend's standards), and the staff who were there (we think it was the brothers mentioned in the other posts) were some of the best we had on our stay in Italy. The downside of the location is that some of the people around are sketchy and it doesn't quite feel safe even during the day. However, as a couple we felt safe and there were enough people around who seemed like locals that there was probably little likelihood of anything happening. My girlfriend did feel comfortable enough to stay there alone one more night before she flew out from Rome, but she also made sure that she was inside before dark. The staff told her about a good restaurant around the corner that was close enough to give her a good feeling about her safety but otherwise she felt like she had to be more careful than usual. Please don't let these comments about safety discourage you from staying here - it is a great value, very convenient to the Termini and decent walk to the Forum, Colisseum, etc., and the staff is really trying to deliver a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another positive review!”
Reviews.Author: SK2004
Reviews.Content: Perfect- Three minutes walk from where the Terravision bus from Ciampino dropped us, we walked down Via Milazzo and found the hotel at the end of the street on the left. It's a mixed use building, there's a snall reception area with the Trip Advisor award proudly sitting on the counter and delicious sweeties. The receptionist will bring you to your room in the antiquated lift, there are corridors of rooms on a number of floors. Our first stay we had Room 305. It was huge with a long narrow bathroom and a corridor leading into it. The AC worked great and there was a TV and minibar, and the room was HUGE. It was also spotlessly clean and had endless hot water. Even the sheets felt nice. Our room was really quiet too (as requested) and looked onto an internal courtyard. (we booked this on Venere for €122 per night) We came back a few days later as a last minute thing and got Room 306 for €120- I just phoned the hotel directly. 306 was a triple room, big king sized bed and then a single bed. The bathroom was cleverly built in using a sliding door, and had beautiful Italian marble tiles. Reception staff were very pleasant and always greeted us by name which was nice. One downside was that on that side of Termini there's not many nice places to eat but it is very convenient to getting metro/bus to the touristy areas which is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: seeteekay
Reviews.Content: Great place! Excellent location for accessing the train station and bus system. The neighborhood is safe and has plenty of restaurants and lovely people. Our family made friends with quite a few locals in the area. The rooms were large, nice, comfortable and we could not have asked for more. The brother's were accomodating and made many recommendations. There was one restaurant they recommended that we didn't like. Would stay there again in a heart beat. We stayed at the beginning of June.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: havingfuntraveling
Reviews.Content: Everything that has been written positive about this hotel is true, the family (father and three brothers),the great location by the train station, the clean rooms, and the great price for the room. For those who had written that the area is seedy needs to experience another large city in their life. My wife and I walked at all hours and never felt that the area was not safe. Thank you Trip advisor for your continually good job of helping us find hotels around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Great Find!!”
Reviews.Author: better3rd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a wonderful, fun-filled honeymoon in Italy and our first stay was at the Domus Praetoria. It was both our first time in Europe and were going to be visiting Rome and the Amalfi Coast. We decided to break-up our stays [stayed for 10 days] in 2 moderate priced hotels and 2 more high-end ones. The Domus was perfect. The hotel is family runned and is close to the train station. This is especially helpful if you are planning to travel via train allover Italy. They are friendly and totally agree with all the other reviews that this is a bargain stay. The room is not as small as some people may think [for those accustomed to staying in U.S. hotels] and you must use your room key to activate the electricity in the room [this is actually very common in Italy, perhaps all of Europe as all the hotels we stayed at did this]. The shower is much smaller than we have in America. I would highly recommend those looking for budget travel to park themselves here.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: CotijaBob
Reviews.Content: The Domus was a great hotel-- our room was very large and even though it did not have a lot of furnishings, it was very clean with high ceilings. The hot water did take a rather long time to heat up though, and the hair dryer was really weak, but i was glad it was there. The best part of the hotel was that the service was excellent. The 3 brothers that worked at the front desk all spoke English well and was always a friendly face. They really helped you in everything you would need and did it with a smile. The little cafe that you get your breakfast at across the street was also excellent. They had the best cappucino that we tasted in italy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The difference between an above average rating and an excellent rating is the brothers that run the hotel. We stayed here for 4 nights, and while the hotel itself is adequate, the brothers the run it, and the location of the Hotel make it ideal. The room itself was very clean, and the bathroom was immaculate. The hotel is just about a 5 minute walk from Termini, and is close to several resteraunts, that were quite good for a tourist neighborhood. We were even allowed to leave luggage at the hotel for 4 days as went to other areas of Italy. I think the bottom line is this. If you are used to staying at fancy hotels with every amenity known to man, this is not for you, but if you need a safe, clean, and friendly place to stay for the night, this is for you. Enjoy Rome

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied - Best 2 star hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: chad2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in July 2006. We had a triple room (room 203) that has a single bed and a large double bed. The room was very clean and was air-conditioned. Well, for half of the time we were there, the a/c didn't work properly but there was also a fan in the room, so that wasn't an issue. There was a safe and a mini fridge in the room. The bathroom was very clean and the largest we've ever seen in any European hotels we've ever stayed in. This hotel is approximately a 4-min walk from Termini Station. If you arrive by the express train from the airport, you could exit the station too early and the walk to the hotel with suitcases would seem like a 20-25 min walk. (That's what happened to us.) The trick is when you get off the train (usually platform 26 or 27), follow the sign to the Metro, or find platform 1 of the rail station, then look for the Via Marsala exit. That's the exit you want. The three brothers were very polite and helpful. They all spoke English very well. There were plenty of restaurants in the area. The brothers would be glad to recommend one to you if you ask. For those who complains about the breakfast, a typical Italian breakfast consists of a croissant (or equivalent) and a coffee, and that's what the hotel offers you - a vouncher to a coffee shop across the street for a croissant, or muffin or doughnut AND a coffee, or expresso or water or tea.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL & FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in June of 2006. Rooms were very nice and clean. Staff - 3 brothers were very nice in that they went out of their way in helping us with bookings and insuring that tours picked us up at the hotel. They also suggested some very good local restaurants. The A/C and bathroom were great and so was the room in general. The only negative was the breakfast which was a simple coffee and roll at the bar across the street. It was OK, but definitely would come back to this hotel if in Rome again. Would also highly recommend. There is an open market in front of the hotel each morning which is worth seeing and quite fun. Very Italian. Neighboorhood looks imposing but we had no problems it was filled with tourists and everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say it is”
Reviews.Author: needdm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights at the end of June, and thought the hotel was excellent. It had everything we needed, although given it is a small hotel you do not get all the facilities you get in a big city centre hotel. The room itself was spotless, and very quiet. The hotel is very secure with a very thick locked door at the immediate entrance, plus a further secure door on to each floor. I thought the area was fine being close, but not too close to the main railway station and the metro. There are a lot of nice restaurants in the street immediately around the corner of the hotel which are reasonably price. Only problem we had was finding the hotel on the first day. The map we printed from the Venere Website appeared to show the hotel on Via Palestro, however the hotel is round the corner on Via Milazzo. The only other thing I would say is that despite visiting Rome just before the really hot months of July/August, we found it really to be too hot for sightseeing. Ok if you want to sit at a cafe and watch the world go by. If I went again I would go a little bit earlier in the year or September onwards.

Reviews.Title: “The Brothers are Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sunflowers1128
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome last night and stayed at the Domus our first week and last night. Like all the other reviews, this hotel is well worth the money. Yes, it is by Termini, but we did not feel uncomfortable walking the streets in the area day or night. What makes this hotel special is that it is in a real Roman neighbourhood and is run by the most hospitable family. The brothers are awesome, they attended to our every need. Museum reservations, dinner recommendations as well as navigating the maze of streets that is Rome. The rooms (#201 street facing and #209 courtyard)were great, high ceilings, large windows, comfy bed and spotless bathrooms. The security both into the hotel and on the room floor gave an extra feeling of safety. Our breakfast across the street was run by another group of awesome people. The most wonderful pastries and cappucino, the best in the world. I told Massimo (my favourtie brother) in my so so Italian that I would write about his wonderful hotel on this site, and of our fantastic experience. I can't wait to see you guys again... miss you already. Cial Joe and Marie

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Hotel Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: slocal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three week trip to Europe and stayed four nights at this hotel. We chose it based on the excellent reviews from Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The staff was well informed, spoke excellent English, and were welcoming and professional. It's a family run business, and they clearly take pride in providing quality service. Each of the three brothers who run the front desk has lived and worked in London, Paris, and Germany for over a year to hone their language skills. The hotel feels VERY safe with an elaborate system for restricted entry into various parts of the establishment. Video cameras monitored by the 24 hour staff assured that you could feel secure, even in Rome! Individual safes in the rooms made securing valuables even easier. The rooms were spacious, recently updated, very comfortable and very clean. The air-conditioning worked very well and was a new, efficient unit (and we needed it in the over 100 degree weather!). The bedding was excellent. We were in their smallest unit (120 euro/night) where the bathroom was quite small (although the shower was large by european standards) and we would have liked more places to hang towels to dry. Another member of our party was in a much larger room with a larger bath at 145 euro/night. Both rooms were very quiet, with double paned windows blocking all street noise. There were plenty of restaurants nearby which had traditional Italian food at reasonable prices. The staff's recommendations for restaurants were very helpful and accurate. Inexpensive internet access was also available within a block. A local "farmer's market" was set up daily outside the hotel, offering fresh fruit and inexpensive merchandise where you could mix with locals looking for a buy. An excellent bakery was almost next door, and the shop that provided the food for the breakfast voucher was just across the street. We liked the location, being 3 blocks from the main termini (railroad station), so that we could catch buses of the underground metro to see the sites. The neighborhood within the first block is a little "rougher", as around most train stations, but we felt safe at any hour. We enjoyed being in a quieter neighborhood and getting a break from the intense tourist crowd, but there were plenty of other small hotels nearby and we met other tourists when walking or dining. Don't get put off by the 2 star rating--it was comporable to any of the other small 3 star hotels we stayed at in Europe. It is similar to many hotels in the area that are small and may take up only one floor of a building. This hotel has 16 rooms on two different floors. The lobby does not open directly to the street, so you may be intitially confused finding only a button to push with the hotel name on it on the street. The lobby opens into a courtyard in the building. They are also adding their own pleasant breakfast room, which they showed to us, to make staying there even more convenient. They're just waiting for final approval from the city officials. We would like to personally thank Massimo, one of the brothers who runs the hotel, for his particularly helpful and friendly attitude! Would we stay again? You bet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DB305
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Domus Praetoria for 5 nights in June 2006. This hotel has a lot of good things going for it. I did have one issue with the hotel. First, the good: 1. Room. I have traveled a lot throughout Europe. I was given room 210, a room at the end of the hallway facing the courtyards. The room was spacious, with plenty of room for luggage and belongings, without having to step over every thing. The bed was large and comfortable. Room and bathroom were cleaned spotlessly every morning. In-room refrigerator with mini-bar, plenty of lighting and the air conditioner worked flawlessly, a great comfort after full days of touring through Rome. 2. Location. Three blocks from Termini Station where we could hop on to the Metro or bus to virtually anywhere in Rome or points beyond. Due to construction, the Metro "A" line closed every night at 9PM, but buses and taxis were easy to find to get us where we were going. 3. Price. Compared to similar hotels I've stayed at in major cities throughout Europe, you can't beat the rates. Plus, the free breakfast... while not a lot to eat, some of the best capuccino you'll find in Rome. We always drank our free cup at the counter and then ordered another "di portar via" (to go). 4. Safety. A lot has been written about the safety of the area where the hotel is located. I guess I'm just a seasoned traveler because honestly, I can't see what the problem is. During our stay, we regularly returned to the hotel after 1AM, on foot. The streets around the hotel are well lit and never did I feel threatened or in any kind of danger. Termini Station is similar to any other train station. It's huge, busy with folks from all walks of life passing through. Yes, there are several homeless that congregate near the exit to the station, however, I've seen just as many similar types at Grand Central Station or Port Authority in New York City. The one issue with the hotel: During our stay, it appeared that they were having trouble with the hot water system. When we checked in, we were told that since our room was at the end of the hall, we had to let the water run for a couple minutes before it got hot. First day, it kind of got luke warm after running the water constantly for 15 minutes. Second day, ran the hot water for an hour and it never got hot. Called to the front desk and they sent someone up to check, and they never got hot water after about 15 minutes of fiddling with things. However, when we returned at 5PM, the hot water worked fine. Next day, no hot water any time of the day. 4th day, no hot water in the morning, but some in the afternoon. Last morning we had to wake up at 5:30 AM to get to the airport. Hot water worked fine. After chatting with the front desk a couple of times, they were actually very good about it. They explained that a couple other rooms were also having problems, but since it was over the weekend, they had places a call to a technician to look at the system. They also discounted our room price to compensate for the problem. So, overall I give the hotel a 3 rating. It's a good hotel. If the hot water had worked consistently, I would raise my rating on this hotel to a 4. I would stay here again as the hotel offered everything I needed, was well run and the management staff (brothers and father) were top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, safe and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Domus Praetoria on TripAdvisor. To be quite honest I expected it to be the best of a bad lot. We had heard so much about noisy Rome Hotels and 2 stars did not sound encouraging. What an absolute joy to be personally shown to an immaculate and well equipped room. My request for a quiet room had been noted and ours was 3rd floor, opening onto an internal courtyard with a tree. We left the window open at night and actually slept in because it was so quiet. The area is lively and well serviced with shops and restaurants. Easy to the Termini train station. The staff were friendly, personable and spoke excellent English and were happy to help with any request. The room was not large but had a QS bed, separate reading lights, fridge and a small ante room. An electric jug in the room would have made it perfect. A compact and well equipped bathroom with a very large shower unit. There was an air conditioning unit but we did not try it out. Loved going across the street to the local for coffee and pastry. We felt local. Would we stay at the Hotel Domus Praetoria again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MontrealJasmine
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day stay at Domus Praetoria. We thought the hotel was a great deal for Rome. The room was very clean and had a good size bathroom. The service was friendly and we were warmly greeted when we arrived despite the fact that it was after midnight. The highlight of the hotel is the location, very close to train station which made it very easy to get around even late at night. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others who are looking for a good deal for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Superhoop1969
Reviews.Content: Booking on the basis of other reviews on this site. The hotel is not located in the "best" of areas but is in an area of the city with fantastic transport links and this more than compensates. An incredibly nice family own and run the hotel and they will give you all sorts of fantastic advice on any aspect of your hoilday. They were really good when we rang them up at 11pm informing them that our "notsoeasy" jet flight home had been cancelled and we needed a room. As it happens they had rooms available but I am 100% certain they would have found us somewhere to sleep that night if they hadn't. The acid test- when I go to Rome will I stay there again...I wouldn't contemplate staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “MODERN, CLEAN HOTEL IN FANTASTIC SPOT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 2006 and loved it, modern, clean rooms, helpful English speaking staff in great location, easy access to station and walk to all the sites. Loved Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Domus Praetoria in May 2006 as part of our honeymoon. We loved it! The hotel is conveniently located near Termini station which allows easy access to the Metro and bus system. It's tucked away at the end of Via Milazzo on the left when you're walking down the street from Termini station. It's in the last building on your left before you're at the end of the street and there's no sign sticking out of the building. So, you'll need to watch for the big door and the hotel logo by one of the call buttons to ring them up. Once you find it, you're in for a treat... Our first impression was perfect and the overall experience was very positive. We were greeted graciously by the excellent staff and were shown to our room. The staff speak excellent English and are very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, well equipped, recently renovated and was a welcome retreat from our busy days in Rome. The included cappucino and brioche was a nice treat too -- it's very cool to feel like a local at the bar drinking cappucino. We strongly recommend Hotel Domus Praetoria to anyone staying in Rome and will gladly stay there again the next time we're in Rome. Grazi, Hotel Domus Praetoria !

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: hollychantal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I styaed at this hotel from April 1st to April 5th 2006. It is a little hard to find because it is located behind a huge wooden door. You must be buzzed in. This is good for safety however. The family that runs this establishment were very helpful and were always there to answer questions or give advise. The hotel itself is kind of sparse in terms of design HOWEVER the prices are VERY resonable and the family running it more than make up for this. Just around the corner (exit hotel turn left, turn left again on first street, LOTS of restaurants on this street TRY MAMA ANGELA'S my husband and I ate there 3 times!!) the bar across the street (this is were we had our complimentary cappacinos in the morning) had fantastic pastries etc. I would defenitly stay ay this hotel again. I can see why they won TripAdvisor award!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, a great place”
Reviews.Author: cussandotherrants
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury or even something a bit above average, Hotel Domus Praetoria is not for you. It is a slightly odd set up where the hotel is co-located in a building with other offices and apartments and fairly spread out amoung the other tenants. While that is OK, I just was not really expecting it. While you get a key card, the owners really want to hold onto it while you are gone, which I thought was a little strange, but very traditional. I stayed with 2 friends in a large room with tile floors. It was very basic, but that was fine because we were mostly out and about seeing and doing things in Rome. The bathroom was a bit small. Overall, we were comfortable and the room was clean, which is very important to me. All three of us are women, and we did not feel the least unsafe in the neighborhood. Then again, we live in NYC and are probably more used to urban settings than some of the other reviewers. We've seen sketchy, and this is not really sketchy. Once we had to walk by a group of hooligans at night, but it was OK. You'll be fine. You can actually avoid all of this and walk up a different street to get to the hotel if Via Marsala makes you uncomfortable, so that also is good. The breakfast is fun. You go to a cafe across the street and eat a pastry (value: less than 1 euro, otherwise not free) and drink coffee or tea at the bar with regular people who live in Rome. While the value is not much to speak of (probably a whopping 2 or 3 euros in total), it is great to be in Rome and do as the Romans do... Anyway, for what you get (a clean spacious room, private but small bathroom, easy access to lots of public transportation, walking distance to lots of sites), I thought it was a very good value. We stayed for 169 euro per night, which is what hotels without private bathrooms were charging. Very fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Rome on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were getting a little nervous wheeling our weekend bags through a backstreet market behind Termini station, hawkers and assorted shady types ogling the obviously lost passers-by. Towards the end of the street we reached the enormous but anonymous front door to Hotel Domus Praetoria, and what a hidden gem behind it! The guy on reception was helpful and friendly without fussing, putting us immediately at our ease. The room was spacious, simple and stylish - high ceilings, gorgeous original parquet flooring, great big bed. Bit of a weird 'hot water on demand' system - you pull a bell-rope in the shower and someone/ something makes hot water happen. The lift is a perfectly preserved art deco period piece, a photo opp in itself! No dining area in the hotel, but a coupon each morning for pastry and (compulsory) caffeine fix in the cafe across the street. We had a fantastic first stay in Rome, in no small part down to this place. Boutique Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Points & Bad Points”
Reviews.Author: logonmar
Reviews.Content: My wife & I selected this hotel largely based on the reviews others had written on this site. After spending 4 days there we left with mixed feelings as the hotel had good points and bad points. Good Points: 1. At €140 per night for a double room would have to be seen as excellent value for a central Rome location. 2. Our room was large and spotless and cleaned fully each day. 3. Very central to the main railway station and also to the subway system. In fact we often chose to walk to many of the sights. At a strolling pace we would reach Colliseum in arond 30 minutes and on a few nights we walked back to the hotel from the area around the Trevi fountain in about 30 to 40 minutes. 4. Staff/owners at reception were always very helpful & spoke good English. Bad Points: 1: Area is quite dingy and whilst never felt threatened the walk from the station was through quite a run down area. 2. If you are in room 301 at the front of the building be prepared for lots of street noise which meant that we kept our windows closed fully by night and even that didn't deaden the noise that started around 6:00 AM as the street traders set up their stalls on the street outside. Stalls were a mixture of fruit stalls and what seemed like second hand clothes & books etc. We never spent more than a few seconds looking at them. 3. You have to go across the street for breakfast which consists of a cup of coffee and a croissant. The staff there are friendly & welcoming and you do share an 'Italian experience' however would feel that most people would prefer a sit down leisurely breakfast. 4. The room had an air conditioning unit high up on the wall but the remote control was removed and presumably is only there during peak summer months. As we had to keep the windows closed due to street noise the room became warm and would have liked ability to reduce room heat level on occasions. 5. Didn't like access arrangements where you had to buzz outer door and then collect your room key before using an elevator. Once you got out of the elevator they then had to unlock a door leading to the corridor with the bedrooms. No doubt security was excellent but prefer ability to simply come and go from your room without making it a shared arrangement with the hotel owners! 6. Felt somewhat isolated when in the hotel as didn't even see other guests in passing due to there being no lobby area, cafeteria etc To conclude it was very central, very clean and price was good however the poor points proably mean that our next trip to Rome will involve an alternative choice of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Return in a Heart Beat”
Reviews.Author: fishertrick
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely lives up to its reputation and consistent rave reviews that we first discovered on TripAdvisor. HD is a quality and immaculate hotel with a wonderful, central, yet quiet, location. We were extremely comfortable and very much enjoyed our stay. The three brothers (and we met the father also) were a major bonus in terms of their service, assistance, advice, recommendations and hospitality. We would go back to this hotel in a heart beat. We stayed for the first three nights and two weeks later, returned for one night....it felt like we were coming home. HD definitely offers outstanding value for the price. Massimo's highly recommended "al 39" restaurant was the best during our entire trip. Also, the tour that we booked through the hotel was very good. Thanks to TripAdvisor and its members for ranking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near the train station”
Reviews.Author: The_Lizard1
Reviews.Content: May 8-11, 2006 Since we arrived and departed Rome by train and used the subways, the Hotel Domus Praetoria was a perfect choice for it's location. The room was large and the bathroom was very nice. The hotel floors are secured through 2 locked doors. The brothers who run the hotel do an excellant job, speak very good english and are very helpful. The beds even had my initials on them !!

Reviews.Title: “almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: We thought about giving a 5 star report but felt that a high 4 star was most appropriate. We would stay there again because of the clean room and fully tiled bath. The owner-brothers are most accomodating and the safety inside the building containing the 15 room hotel is good, with the front desk having to buzz open the door to the corridor leading to your upstainrs room. Towels and sheets were clean. The difficulty is the seedy Termini station area, not just our opinion but most travel guides will tell you the same thing. You have to keep your eyes open and be aware of your surroundings in the evening hours after 9:00 or so because the area is populated by enough homeless and intoxicated people who congregate around the station. Not so unusual in most large European cities. The breakfast of coffee and roll across the street is a bit spartan and would cost a walk in only 1 euro or so. Nevertheless, we would consider staying here again. This was our 6th trip to Rome and we wanted to stay by the station to take advantage of the bus and metro beginning points for travel around the city which can be somewhat challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: Route66London_UK
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on other reviews. It lived up to its reputation, being very clean; the staff welcoming and helpful; good location, and great value for money. Having breakfast across the street is a great experience in itself and allows you a taste of 'local life' so often passed by as a tourist. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved rome”
Reviews.Author: rileyjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in Domus Praetoria . It lived up to its reputation it is an excellent hotel . It is so clean and very close to the termini station.The Brothers are so helpfull and Friendly. Enjoyed breakfast in the coffee bar across the road, if we go back to Rome we will be staying there again. A big thank you to the Brothers for being so helpfull to my Husband and I

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Colum_7
Reviews.Content: Convenient and clean, with a friendly and very helpful staff of three sons and their father. Room comfortable but not great for spending a lot of time in because there is no armchair and the lighting is poor for reading (like in too many hotels). Guest rooms are on the third floor, but the reception is on the first (i.e. ground-level). There is an elevator. Buzzer of front door to building (that also includes apartments) rings at entry to hotel rooms on third floor as well as in reception area -- and can be a little noisy at night if staying at that end of the corridor. Breakfast in bar across the road is a coffee and pastry eaten standing at bar with locals: interesting and pleasant, but insist on the pastry of your choice! If arriving by train to Termini Station from the aitport, do NOT go downstairs but go to the very front of the station, which doubles as a modern shopping mall. Exit here and you will find Via Milazzo over to your right and back slightly. The hotel is at the end of Via Milazzo on the left, but you could walk past it because the only sign seems to be a little one on the bell. This is a very central and convenient location, close to many restaurants and shops. Rome's two metro/subway lines cross at Termini and many bus lines depart from the square in front of the station. If walking to the station to catch the train back to the aitport (every half hour) note that the airport platform is a long way from the station entrance (doubling the walk in effect).

Reviews.Title: “you won't be dissapointed!!! an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: frenchiefan
Reviews.Content: This place was great. If they have a vacancy..grab it!! We had a wonderful trip..a week at Colle lungo vineyard in Chianti..then Rome. We dropped our car and checked our big luggage at the airport luggage hold and took the train in to Rome..$ 10 per person. We got off the train and made our way to the main shopping hall of the station. With our backs to the tracks we walked out to the right and crossed the street..the hotel was straight ahead 2 blocks.. It was newly renovated, spotless, safe, excellent value and the host/owners were very pleasant and helpful. Both mornings they had a fun little market happening in front of the hotel. They also give you a voucher for a coffee and a bun at the cafe across the street.. Make sure you get a little lesson on the hot water in the shower...it works perfectly but takes a while to heat up.. This place was night and day in comparison to the $200/night fleabag we stayed in 5 years ago. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere better for the money!”
Reviews.Author: stuiedo
Reviews.Content: Admittedly I was expecting quite a lot of this hotel before my girlfriend and I arrived due to the previous reviews. We booked the hotel direct on the strength of the good reviews on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. Firstly, it isn’t the easiest place to find. we came out of the station at the wrong exit (on the wrong side of the station), so had to lug our suitcases all the way round. As there is no sign outside the hotel it is easy to walk past (which we did a couple of times). But eventually found it and inside the hotel is more like a collection of renovated apartments. Which in a city like Rome is perfect. i wanted a good, clean room with the necessary mod cons (shower, tv, etc) in a good location, at a reasonable price - and that is what i got! The Domus Praetoria doesn’t have a bar or restaurant - but that’s fine! come on, your in Rome, you don’t want to hang around at your hotel, you want to get out and see the city! Some of the previous reviews said the location was a little seedy. Agreed the location isn’t the most picturesque, but it is perfectly safe, and its close to the Metro and within 2 short stops of the Coliseum, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain etc. I was also surprised at how close the attractions were. Ok, they weren’t on the doorstop but I was expecting a little bit of travelling before I saw something of note. On our first evening we thought we would have a walk and find somewhere to eat, within 5-10 mins we were already taking pictures of impressive buildings, ruins and churches, another 5 minutes and we were at the prime ministers house, 5 more minutes and we were at the Trevi fountain!! Certainly close enough. All in all, the brothers and father were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel was perfect for our needs. I don’t think you could find a better hotel for value for money in Rome! I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and family! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay for my trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we(family of 3) stayed for 3 nights at the hotel, and then went to Vinece, Florence, back to Rome, stayed at Colubmia Hotel (also has good rating). we liked Domus Praetoria Hotel: the three brothers are really nice and helpful, the room is clean, I mean really clean, compare to other hotels we stayed (all ~ $200), it is also very convinent, <5 min walk to Train station and metro, as well as bus station. Definetely recommend to all, would stay again, though I am not sure I want to go back to Rome for next Italy trip: I now understood why some folks said it is over priced. Florence is our best city, will definetly will return. My advise for tourist: there are plenty of traps for tourist in Italy: when taking train, you need to stamp your ticket, other wise you will be regret, and those yellow boxes only located at end of platform; and in Vinece, for water taxi, you need to get the ticket first before you on boar, or need to ask the clerk for ticket, they dont let you know that in obivous way(may be on purpose), and if you are amazed by the view, and pass next stop, they will catch you and fine you 35 euro. I do recoomend SANDRA GUSTAFSON's (-) book for Italy, where ever we stopped for food, we just checked the book for recommended restaurants, never disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did not get off to a good start, the instructions we took from the Hotel were a bit hard to follow, especially when they landmarked some lights that were down for construction! But we found it after a bit of wondering. (Important thing is to get all the way into the main station area, do not take any sign posted way outs sooner). The guys on the desk were great, we got maps, with places to see marked on them from the guys. Breakfast was a bit interesting, but very Italian, a voucher for the little place accross the road that is full of locals, to have a yummy pastry and a coffee for breaky. Close to town, only bad thing about the hotel was the terrible smell coming from the bathroom, we simply could not locate it! Other than that would recommend to stay, cheap and comfortable, VERY VERY close to the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyeyellow
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop in Italy, culminating an already outstanding 3 week vacation. We picked the Hotel Domus Praetoria based on other recommendations written on this site. We had a 4-night stay, and it exceeded our expectations. The hotel is well within walking distance of the Termini Train Station and so centrally located that we walked everywhere. My wife and I traveled with her parents and we left our hotel in the AM hours and returned back to the hotel approximately 2200 hours each night after a long day of sight seeing. The front desk was staffed 24 hours by one of the Menicelli family members who own the hotel. They were very professional, gracious hosts and willing to provide guidance at every turn. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome that wants a beautiful, clean, comfortable hotel with great caring staff willing to make your stay in their city an exciting one. Thank You for a wonderful stay. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus Praetoria two nights and had a terrific time. We weren't in our room much but the staff was fantastic. At check-in they talked to us about historic sites, and walked us to our very clean, spacious room. The day before check-out they gratiously offered a wakeup call and inquired about our plans to get to the airport. In addition, we didn't feel uneasy in the the area as other reviewers reported. The area seemed a little more underserved than the other area of Rome we stayed in but I would say that it is safe area and a chance to experience Rome. I would recommend the Domus to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights at the end of March 2006. I booked the hotel totally based on the Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed (when I was booking it the hotel was #6 here, and has only been going up since then!). The brothers who run this hotel are very welcoming and helpful. The room was beautiful and very clean. The breakfast arrangement with the local cafeteria worked well and cappucinos there were really good. We also liked the local market in the front of the hotel and the vegetables from the market were yummie! The location was good. Though the Termini area is often referred to as seedy we (= two females) did not have any problems and Via Milazzo was not seedy at all. The hotel is literally few minutes walk from the station and about 10 mins from the bus stop where the airport buses (like Terravision & Airport shuttle) arrive. We could not have asked more for our stay and would defenitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days in April 06. The staff are very welcoming and give useful tips on dining out and travel.The hotel has secure entry and a safe in each room and the maid service provided fresh towels and sheets, to our spotless rooms, every day.
