The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the termini and close to all major tourist attractions, Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain and Colosseum.8 euros buys an all day ticket for the metro and this can take you to the Vatican city in 10 minutes. All in all this was an excellent trip in a superb hotel and we cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “A welcome respite”
Reviews.Author: Verve_M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning and end of our three week trip through Italy, in March 2006. We stayed on the third floor the first time, with a surprisingly large room, and very comfortable bathroom, and on the second floor on the second visit. The Hotel is part of a block of apartments, but is very well organised, and fulfils/exceeds all the expectations of a 2 star hotel. The staff ~ Gilbert and the two other gentlemen ~ were always helpful, informative and very proud of their hotel. The rooms are a great size, very clean, and well serviced, and the room on the third floor is very quiet (There was some noise from above on the second floor). They have all you need, including TV, mini-bar, etc. (There is no kettle or radio, but this is no big deal... step outside for a delicious coffee!) We had the opportunity to sneak a look at the breakfast area which will be opened by now, and were impressed. The breakfast for us consisted of a coupon to a cafe across the road for a coffee and a (sweet) cake, at the bar. We found this very acceptable, as it is how the Italians do breakfast. The hotel is close to the main railway so the walk with luggage is very do-able. It is therefore also close to the metro for touring, and in walking distance to many famous places in Rome. It may not be the most salubrious part of Rome, but we always felt safe (and paid less for clothes food, etc!) Thanks to Gilbert and the guys for a lovely stay in a lovely hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Menicellis are great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Domus Praetoria has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It's clean, safe and well located. The Menicelli family do everything they can to make you feel at home from the moment you arrive to the moment of reluctant departure. They recommended The Steak House trattoria which despite its name produced fabulous food.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a girly weekend break after reading the fantastic reviews on this website, and at the risk of sounding cliched,I was not disappointed! I'm very careful when choosing accommodation, (I have high standards), so take it from me, this hotel was outstanding for value for money. It was immaculately presented, our room was spotless, and the owners could not do enough for their guests. They recommended trips and restaurants, and the best way to visit the attractions. The hotel was a two-minute walk from the Termini station, and across the road from a delightful cafe, which we had complimentary vouchers for each morning. As two young females travelling alone, we did not find the area threatening in the slightest, despite previous reviews. In a nutshell, this hotel is perfect for those on a moderate budget who don't want to compromise on comfort - it's not the Ritz, but it was perfect for our needs - I've recommended the hotel to a friend who has since stayed there, and I will definitely stay there on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ten out of ten”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and felt we knew the owners when we arrived. The hotel is very safe, clean, friendly, well located and reasonably priced. What more can you ask for. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travelabraod
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Europe for our honeymoon. We booked all our hotels online and we read the great reviews on this hotel. As it was our honeymoon, we wanted to really take time in chosing our hotels carefully. I was quite confident that our stay would be great if not excellent at the hotel. When we got to the hotel we were quite surprised at the size of the room. I read on reviews to request the room with the balcony and sure enough we got one. The bathroom was the largest we had during our 18 days in Europe. We loved the fact that we had breakfast across the street at a local bakery with the locals. Just to conclude our stay, it was one of the best hotels we both stayed in and the warm and friendly atmosphere of the brothers just made us smile. Definietly a great hotel for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Godfrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although a little tricky to find - a simple plaque on the wall, whereas we were probably looking for a big neon sign, gave the impression of security right from the start. As in all major cities, the area around a major railway terminus is not exactly the most salubrious of settings. However, from the moment that we pushed open the large, and heavy, door to the hotel, the feelings of safety were predominant. The greeting by one of the brothers (Fabio) was friendly and not with that over effusiveness that strikes one as false. The room and bathroom were very clean,and sufficiently large. It was also very quiet. One setback was the lack of breakfast facilties, which the brothers are attempting to rectify, but still awaiting their licence. However, the small cafe across the road, with whom they have an arrangement, is very friendly. There is also a large number of pleasant restaurants in the vicinity. Overall a very pleasant hotel, and extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Who can touch it?”
Reviews.Author: freddief
Reviews.Content: I defy anyone to find a better value hotel in Rome.Well positioned-5 mins from Termini Metro.Plenty of very reasonable restaurants close by. What sets this hotel apart is the superb friendliness,professionalism,helpfulness shown by the 3 brothers(and their father)who run it. Many of the large hotel chains could learn a lot from them! Well furnished and decorated large rooms. Excellent security24 hrs.Breakfast(usual coffee and croissant is taken in the bar over the road.This and the local street market show what the real Rome is like. Will definitely be returning although its reviews will make it hard to book.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: RNY99
Reviews.Content: A very strange hotel but absolutely wonderful. Once you find it (It looks like an entrance to apartments) the staff could not be more helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Toilet/shower was clean. Breakfast was provided in the cafe across the road - basic but tasty and the staff were friendly. Bars and restaurants in the area near the hotel were friendly and reasonable (much better than some in more "tourist" areas of the city) We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: teresa35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Domus Paetoria for two nights in February and were extremely satisfied with the rooms and service. This was our first time in Rome and we only had one full day to see the sights.The hotel staff was very helpful and it was so nice to have a pleasant,clean and restful place to come back to after a full day of sightseeing. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Domus!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GregfromtheATL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus February 19th through the 26th of 2006 and were extremely impressed with every aspect of the hospitality we received from every member of the Menicelli family. To start with, the rooms are EXTREMELY clean-that is unfortunately hard to find in this day and age. Secondly, they did not pass up an opportunity to be genuinely helpful and informative, even letting us borrow an excellent book about Tuscany which really helped us out alot in Florence!!! We have traveled quite alot in the last 5 or 10 years and I can honestly say that this is the first hotel I have ever stayed in that really felt like home. I wish we could have stayed longer. Massimo, sorry we left in such a hurry, but thanks for getting us the taxi so promptly. I wish you and your family the best and all the success that OUTSTANDING service will surely bring you!! Greg and Christie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CharlieWhite
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in this hotel in Feb 2006. The location is ideal for a sightseeing holiday. The compact nature of Rome means everything (except the Vatican) is within walking distance. The closeness to the station makes it ideal if you don't want to walk. We had no problems at all with the area around the Hotel even late at night. Our room was a good size and was kept exceptionally clean througout the stay. The people in reception were friendly and efficient. We really liked to voucher scheme with the Cafe across the road, great coffee and quick. So much better than sitting in a breakfast room. Leave the guys behind the bar a tip they seem to appreciate it as most people don't bother. I still can't believe how cheap the hotel was for what it offers (510 Euros for 6 nights) book up now before it gets to tripadvisor number 1 and the owners realise they could charge much much more.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem - will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights here after reading the reviews on this site and I have to say that they were all right! This hotel is a little gem! Superb location, ideal for the Metro and is definately above average for a 2*. The room we stayed in (no: 203) was spotlessly clean with a large double and a single bed and a more than adequate bathroom with large shower. The decor was great and the shutters were great barriers to the noise and bustle of the weekday market below! The family who run this hotel were brilliant, all are very friendly and will help with any questions you may have. I would highly recommend this for an excellent value for money stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: simonlincs
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an excellent four night stay at this hotel in Febraury 2006. Despite all the concerns raised about hotels in Rome, this hotel proved to be well located, and of a high standard. The rooms were well heated during our stay, immaculately clean, and more than comfortable. The service provided by the owners was of a high quality, and we could highly recommend their restaurant choices to others. The rooms appeared to be recently redecorated, and although basic, presented excellent value for money in the centre of Rome. The Termini station, bus station and Metro were a three minute walk from the hotel, making the hotel very suitable as a base for exploring the main sights in Rome. The area is often referred to as seedy in some mainstream guides, but we saw nothing to support this, and the area felt safe at night to walk around. The breakfast arraangements allow you the opportunity to experience a light breakfast in a local cafe, and the staff there made us feel equally welcome. All in all, a hotel we would definitely return to and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond”
Reviews.Author: emporessyoko
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant little hotel that is far above it's two star standard. The brothers that run it fall over themselves to be helpful! The rooms are kept spotless and are all you need for a sightseeing holiday in Rome. I will stay again and have already recommended it to a few people whom I work with

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Y_Tz_99
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we booked a hotel based on user reviews. Domus Praetoria was an excellent choice. Very friendly staff, excellent value for money. Termini station area is not the best but you can live with it. The cappuchino and croissant served at the bar next door added to the atmosphere. Many thanks to the people of Domus Praetoria. We'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a flying visit to Rome where I stayed at this excellent hotel booked, I may add, based on previous reviews from Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed and you won't be either. The location is excellent, less than 5 minutes walk from Termini Station. As a single, female traveller I am routinely put into small and/or substandard, noisy rooms and, quiet often, treated to second rate service - NOT THIS TIME. The room was quiet (facing onto an internal courtyard), spotlessly clean, centrally heated, with a good sized 3/4 bed and an excellent en-suite bathroom with a shower large enough to hold a party in. There was also a safe, hairdryer, fridge, television and plenty of storage space. But the thing that really makes this hotel special are the owners. The brothers, Massimo and Fabio, were the sole of courteousy and amiability and nothing was too much trouble for them. Maps and guidance on the area were provided along with tips and help with transportation, restaurants etc. The reception is manned 24 hours a day and, even if you stagger in at 02:00, you will be greeted with a friendly face. One of them must have noticed the date on my passport when I checked in so, imagine my surprise as I was going out for the evening when I was wished a Happy Birthday and offered a bottle of something fizzy to get the celebrations going - how many other hotels would do that? The only drawback will be when more people discover this lovely place to stay and I can't get booked into it next time I go to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domus for a romantic 4 nights at the end of November and loved it. We booked based on the opinions on the site and were not disappointed. From the outside the hotel looks typically Italian with shutters, large windows and seriously heavy, cast iron/wooden doors. The hotel is clean, rooms spacious with everything you could need. Our room had sat TV, walk in shower, mini bar, fresh towels/toiletries and loads of cupboard space. Our room faced onto the main street which was a great way to soak up the atmosphere of the market downstairs. The hotel isn’t signposted but that was half the fun of finding it. The 3 brothers who run the hotel speak brilliant English and are always on hand to give you suggestions, timetables and make reservations. They provided us with a map with street maps which proved invaluable throughout our trip. They also provide a breakfast voucher, which can be used across the road, where you get to mingle with the locals/market traders. In terms of location its great. Termini station is at the end of the road, which means you have access to the metro ( most of the main tourist attractions have a metro station stop) and train lines in/out of Rome (inc the airport). This saved us a packet on taxi fares and transport costs eg we got a cab from the airport to the hotel which cost Euro 50approx and a train back to the airport from Termini which cost 19 Euro for 2 people. All in all, a real gem, it’s a great hotel with real Italian character. We’d definitely come back .

Reviews.Title: “Nicest reception”
Reviews.Author: Genut
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel had the nicest folks in reception that we encountered during our recent trip. They were unfailingly polite and bent over backwards for us. The family room is basic but very clean and fairly large. They give vouchers for breakfast (beverage & pastry) which can be redeemed across the street at a modest local cafe frequented by Romans, not tourists. The only draw back to the hotel is that during the winter they turn the heat on only from 6pm until 11pm, and then turn it back on in the morning. However they will turn it on earlier if you ask. Basically this is a good value for money and very convenient, since it's really close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “There's nothing seedy about the area surrounding Hotel Domus Praetoria”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law, husband and I stayed at the Hotel Domus Praetoria in a spacious triple room in early November 2005. The room looked over a central courtyard and had a good sized bathroom, plus plenty of space for suitcases, without tripping over them. The hotel is not far from the Terminii Station and I was pleasantly surprised by the station and the streets surrounding it. The restaurants and cafes were nice and relatively inexpensive (even for us converting to Euros from Aussie dollars) and I always felt safe at night walking in the area on my own. The hotel is also not far from Via Nazionale (great for shopping) and of course the Metro gets you everywhere you want to go. As with every other reviewer of Domus Praetoria, I agree that the brothers are fantastic and fabulous. They even arranged tickets for us to see the Pope. Lastly, the beds are comfortable, outside noise was minimal/ non existent, the pillows/ sheets/ towels were great and I even managed to get a 2nd pillow for the perfect nights rest. Thank you Hotel Domus Praetoria, we'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: getupsosage
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to Rome and had an excellent time. I don’t often give feed back on sites such as this, as each persons requirements and expectations differs and so one persons great hotel is the next mans nightmare. However, I feel that the Domus Praetoria was excellent and cant be praised enough. The location, 2 minutes away from the Station Termini, is excellent for both transfers to the airport and for the metro service. The 3 brothers that man the reception were very helpful, friendly and were so eager to help with any questions or queries. The rooms were spacious, clean, modern and was an excellent base from which you could explore the fantastic city. The enormous front door and security within the building (including a free safe) meant that you could have the utmost trust that you would come back to your belongings after a day exploring. The local streets are awash with cafes, shops and restaurants that were excellent value and all very good.
